为什么哲学家应该关心计算复杂性

Why Philosophers Should Care About Computational Complexity

斯科特·阿伦森1

Scott Aaronson1

抽象的

人们可能会认为，一旦我们知道某事物是可计算的，那么如何 高效地计算它就是一个实际问题，而没有进一步的哲学意义。在本文中，我将详细阐述这种观点是错误的。特别是，我认为 计算复杂性理论（研究解决计算问题所需的资源（如时间、空间和随机性）的领域）可以带来关于数学知识的本质、强人工智能争论、计算主义、逻辑全知问题、休谟归纳问题、古德曼的格​​鲁谜语、量子力学的基础、经济合理性、封闭类时曲线以及其他几个哲学主题的新视角。最后，我将讨论复杂性理论本身可以从哲学分析中受益的方面。

One might think that, once we know something is computable, how efficiently it can be computed is a practical question with little further philosophical importance.  In this essay, I offer a detailed case that one would be wrong.  In particular, I argue that computational complexity theory—the field that studies the resources (such as time, space, and randomness) needed to solve computational problems—leads to new perspectives on the nature of mathematical knowledge, the strong AI debate, computationalism, the problem of logical omniscience, Hume’s problem of induction, Goodman’s grue riddle, the foundations of quantum mechanics, economic rationality, closed timelike curves, and several other topics of philosophical interest.  I end by discussing aspects of complexity theory itself that could benefit from philosophical analysis.

介绍

Introduction

我认为，认为机器无法制造意外的观点是哲学家和数学家特别容易犯的一个谬误。这种假设认为，只要一个事实出现在大脑中，该事实的所有后果都会同时出现在大脑中。在许多情况下，这是一个非常有用的假设，但人们很容易忘记它是错误的。—艾伦·M·图灵

The view that machines cannot give rise to surprises is due, I believe, to a fallacy to which philosophers and mathematicians are particularly subject. This is the assumption that as soon as a fact is presented to a mind all consequences of that fact spring into the mind simultaneously with it.  It is a very useful assumption under many circumstances, but one too easily forgets that it is false. —Alan M. Turing

艾伦·图灵、阿隆佐·丘奇、库尔特·哥德尔等人在 20 世纪 30 年代创立的计算理论不仅改变了文明，还对哲学产生了持久影响。事实上，澄清哲学问题是他们工作的初衷，技术成果则是后来才出现的！今天，很难想象一场关于（比如说）心灵哲学、数学基础或机器智能前景的严肃讨论，会没有受到四分之三世纪前这场人类知识革命的影响。

The theory of computing, created by Alan Turing, Alonzo Church, Kurt Gödel, and others in the 1930s, didn’t only change civilization; it also had a lasting impact on philosophy.  Indeed, clarifying philosophical issues was the original point of their work; the technological payoffs only came later!  Today, it would be hard to imagine a serious discussion about (say) the philosophy of mind, the foundations of mathematics, or the prospects of machine intelligence that was uninformed by this revolution in human knowledge three-quarters of a century ago.

然而，随着计算机在 20 世纪 60 年代开始广泛普及，计算机科学家越来越多地认为可计算性理论并没有提出正确的问题。因为我们真正想要解决的几乎所有问题都是图灵意义上的可计算问题；真正的问题是哪些问题是有效 或 可行 计算的。后一个问题催生了一个新领域，称为计算复杂性理论（不要与研究细胞自动机等复杂系统的“其他”复杂性理论相混淆）。自 20 世纪 70 年代以来，计算复杂性理论见证了一些惊人的发现，其中包括名词解释-完备性、公钥密码学、新型数学证明（如概率证明、交互式证明和零知识证明）以及机器学习和量子计算的理论基础。对于研究这些主题的人来说，回顾起来，哥德尔和图灵的工作可能只是计算“大”问题的热身。

However, as computers became widely available starting in the 1960s, computer scientists increasingly came to see computability theory as not asking quite the right questions.  For almost all the problems we actually want to solve turn out to be computable in Turing’s sense; the real question is which problems are efficiently or feasibly computable.  The latter question gave rise to a new field, called computational complexity theory (not to be confused with the “ other” complexity theory, which studies complex systems such as cellular automata).  Since the 1970s, computational complexity theory has witnessed some spectacular discoveries, which include \(\mathsf{NP}%\)-completeness, public-key cryptography, new types of mathematical proof (such as probabilistic, interactive, and zero-knowledge proofs), and the theoretical foundations of machine learning and quantum computation.  To people who work on these topics, the work of Gödel and Turing may look in retrospect like just a warmup to the “big” questions about computation.

因此，我惊讶地发现复杂性理论对 哲学的影响远不及可计算性理论。问题来了：为什么呢？  我想到了几种可能的答案：也许可计算性理论只是具有更丰富的哲学含义。（尽管我们将看到，人们可以提出完全相反的强烈理由。）也许复杂性本质上具有与可计算性相同的哲学含义，并且可计算性首先到达那里。也许局外人被“数学障碍”吓得不敢学习复杂性理论。也许解释是社会性的：哥德尔、图灵、维特根斯坦和罗素参与同一场智力对话的世界随着第二次世界大战而消失；此后，理论计算机科学开始由技术驱动，与其哲学起源失去了联系。也许复杂性理论的最新进展只是没有足够的时间进入哲学意识。

Because of this, I find it surprising that complexity theory has not influenced philosophy to anything like the extent computability theory has.  The question arises: why hasn’t it?  Several possible answers spring to mind: maybe computability theory just had richer philosophical implications.  (Though as we’ll see, one can make a strong case for exactly the opposite.)  Maybe complexity has essentially the same philosophical implications as computability, and computability got there first.  Maybe outsiders are scared away from learning complexity theory by the “math barrier.”  Maybe the explanation is social: the world where Gödel, Turing, Wittgenstein, and Russell participated in the same intellectual conversation vanished with World War II; after that, theoretical computer science came to be driven by technology and lost touch with its philosophical origins.  Maybe recent advances in complexity theory simply haven’t had enough time to enter philosophical consciousness.

然而，我怀疑部分原因在于复杂性理论家未能传达他们可以为哲学概念库增添什么。因此，本文旨在通过调查复杂性理论中可能引起哲学家兴趣的某些方面以及我认为复杂性视角可以阐明的一些哲学问题来帮助纠正这一失败。

However, I suspect that part of the answer is just complexity theorists’ failure to communicate what they can add to philosophy’s conceptual arsenal.  Hence this essay, whose modest goal is to help correct that failure, by surveying some aspects of complexity theory that might interest philosophers, as well as some philosophical problems that I think a complexity perspective can clarify.

为了避免误解，在进一步阐述之前，请允许我先谦虚地补充一点。本文将涉及哲学家们争论了好几代的问题，例如强人工智能、归纳问题、语法和语义之间的关系以及量子力学的解释。  在所有这些情况下， 我都不会声称计算复杂性理论“解决”了哲学问题，而只会提供有用的观点和见解。我经常会明确提到一些哲学难题，我认为复杂性分析要么不涉及，要么会自行引入。但即使我没有这样做，也不应该假设我认为不存在这样的难题！事实上，我对本文的一个希望是，计算机科学家、数学家和其他技术人员在阅读本文后，能够更好地理解现代分析哲学中考虑的一些问题的微妙之处。2

To forestall misunderstandings, let me add a note of humility before going further. This essay will touch on many problems that philosophers have debated for generations, such as strong AI, the problem of induction, the relation between syntax and semantics, and the interpretation of quantum mechanics.  In none of these cases will I claim that computational complexity theory “dissolves” the philosophical problem—only that it contributes useful perspectives and insights.  I’ll often explicitly mention philosophical puzzles that I think a complexity analysis either leaves untouched or else introduces itself.  But even where I don’t do so, one shouldn’t presume that I think there are no such puzzles!  Indeed, one of my hopes for this essay is that computer scientists, mathematicians, and other technical people who read it will come away with a better appreciation for the subtlety of some of the problems considered in modern analytic philosophy.2

本文不涉及 的内容

What This Essay Won’t Cover

我不会试图讨论计算复杂性与哲学之间的所有可能联系，甚至不会讨论已经建立的所有联系。少数哲学家长期以来一直在他们的工作中引用计算复杂性思想；事实上，“philpapers archive”列出了三十二 计算复杂性标题下的论文。3这些  论文中的大多数都证明了有关各种逻辑系统的计算复杂性的定理。在其余的论文中，有些使用“计算复杂性”的含义与我不同——例如，涵盖可计算性理论——有些引用了计算复杂性的概念，但没有专门研究 该领域的特定结果。也许最接近这篇文章精神的是 Cherniak 的有趣文章和莫顿此外，许多作者对第[AI]节中关于计算复杂性和图灵测试的观察做出了一些版本：例如参见 Block 、帕伯里，勒韦斯克和 Shieber。

I won’t try to discuss every possible connection between computational complexity and philosophy, or even every connection that’s already been made.  A small number of philosophers have long invoked computational complexity ideas in their work; indeed, the “ philpapers archive” lists \(32\) papers under the heading Computational Complexity.3  The majority of those papers prove theorems about the computational complexities of various logical systems.  Of the remaining papers, some use “computational complexity” in a different sense than I do—for example, to encompass computability theory—and some invoke the concept of computational complexity, but no particular results from the field devoted to it.  Perhaps the closest in spirit to this essay are the interesting articles by Cherniak and Morton .  In addition, many writers have made some version of the observations in Section [AI], about computational complexity and the Turing Test: see for example Block , Parberry , Levesque , and Shieber .

在决定在本文中包含哪些联系时，我采用了以下基本规则：

In deciding which connections to include in this essay, I adopted the following ground rules:

  1. 这种联系必须涉及一个“适当的哲学”问题——例如，归纳法的依据或数学知识的本质——而不仅仅是逻辑或模型论中的技术问题。

  2. The connection must involve a “properly philosophical” problem—for example, the justification for induction or the nature of mathematical knowledge—and not just a technical problem in logic or model theory.

  3. 这种联系必须借鉴计算复杂性理论领域的具体见解：而不仅仅是复杂性的想法，或者存在难题的事实。

  4. The connection must draw on specific insights from the field of computational complexity theory: not just the idea of complexity, or the fact that there exist hard problems.

现代复杂性理论中有许多哲学上有趣的想法，本文只是简要提及或根本没有提及。一个例子是伪随机生成器（参见 Goldreich）：将短随机“种子”转换为长位串的函数，虽然它不是真正随机的，但“看上去”非常随机，以至于没有有效的算法可以检测出其中的任何规律。虽然这种意义上的伪随机生成器尚未被证实存在，4但有许多合理的候选者，而相信至少有一些候选者是有效的，这是现代密码学的核心。（第[缺点]节将引用伪随机函数 的相关概念。）第二个例子是 全同态加密：一类极其令人兴奋的新方法，其中第一个是由 Gentry 宣布的 2009 年，该专利用于对加密数据进行任意计算而无需解密数据。对于计算它的人来说，这种计算的输出看起来就像毫无意义的胡言乱语，但对于知道解密密钥的人来说，它仍然可以理解（甚至识别为正确的输出）。伪随机生成器对于概率的基础有什么影响，或者完全同态加密对于计算的语义意义的争论有什么影响？我非常希望这篇文章能激励其他人解决这些和类似的问题。

There are many philosophically-interesting ideas in modern complexity theory that this essay mentions only briefly or not at all.  One example is pseudorandom generators (see Goldreich ): functions that convert a short random “ seed” into a long string of bits that, while not truly random, is so “random-looking” that no efficient algorithm can detect any regularities in it.  While pseudorandom generators in this sense are not yet proved to exist,4 there are many plausible candidates, and the belief that at least some of the candidates work is central to modern cryptography.  (Section [DRAWBACKS] will invoke the related concept of pseudorandom functions.)  A second example is fully homomorphic encryption: an extremely exciting new class of methods, the first of which was announced by Gentry  in 2009, for performing arbitrary computations on encrypted data without ever decrypting the data.  The output of such a computation will look like meaningless gibberish to the person who computed it, but it can nevertheless be understood (and even recognized as the correct output) by someone who knows the decryption key.  What are the implications of pseudorandom generators for the foundations of probability, or of fully homomorphic encryption for debates about the semantic meaning of computations?  I very much hope that this essay will inspire others to tackle these and similar questions.

除了计算复杂性之外，哲学与现代理论计算机科学之间至少还有三个主要的交叉点。第一个是编程语言的语义，它与语言哲学有着广泛而明显的联系。5第二  个是分布式系统理论，它为知识推理的哲学工作提供了应用领域和丰富的实例来源（参见 Fagin 等人）。 和斯塔尔纳克）。 第三个是柯尔莫哥洛夫复杂度（参见Li和Vitányi）) 研究 实现某些功能的最短计算机程序的长度，不考虑程序所使用的时间、内存和其他资源。6

Outside of computational complexity, there are at least three other major intersection points between philosophy and modern theoretical computer science.  The first one is the semantics of programming languages, which has large and obvious connections to the philosophy of language.5  The second is distributed systems theory, which provides both an application area and a rich source of examples for philosophical work on reasoning about knowledge (see Fagin et al.  and Stalnaker ).  The third is Kolmogorov complexity (see Li and Vitányi ) which studies the length of the shortest computer program that achieves some functionality, disregarding time, memory, and other resources used by the program.6

在本文中，我不会讨论任何这些联系，除非顺便提及（例如，第[OMNI]节 涉及“逻辑全知问题”背景下的知识逻辑，第[PAC]节 涉及 PAC 学习背景下的 Kolmogorov 复杂性）。为了对这些遗漏进行辩护，请允许我提出四个理由。首先，这些其他联系不属于我所述的主题。其次，它们会使本文比现在更长。第三，我缺乏必要的背景知识。第四，我的印象是，哲学家（至少是一些哲学家）已经更了解这些其他联系，而不是我想要解释的计算复杂性联系。

In this essay, I won’t discuss any of these connections, except in passing (for example, Section [OMNI] touches on logics of knowledge in the context of the “logical omniscience problem,” and Section [PAC] touches on Kolmogorov complexity in the context of PAC-learning).  In defense of these omissions, let me offer four excuses.  First, these other connections fall outside my stated topic.  Second, they would make this essay even longer than it already is.  Third, I lack requisite background.  And fourth, my impression is that philosophers—at least some philosophers—are already more aware of these other connections than they are of the computational complexity connections that I want to explain.

复杂性 101

Complexity 101

计算复杂性理论是一个庞大而繁杂的领域；本文自然只会涉及其中的一小部分。想要深入研究该主题的读者可以查阅许多优秀的教科书，例如 Sipser 的教科书, 帕帕迪米特里奥、摩尔和梅尔滕斯、戈德里奇或阿罗拉和巴拉克；或 Wigderson 的调查文章、 Fortnow 和 Homer或 Stockmeyer。

Computational complexity theory is a huge, sprawling field; naturally this essay will only touch on small parts of it.  Readers who want to delve deeper into the subject are urged to consult one of the many outstanding textbooks, such as those of Sipser , Papadimitriou , Moore and Mertens , Goldreich , or Arora and Barak ; or survey articles by Wigderson , Fortnow and Homer , or Stockmeyer .

有人可能会认为，一旦我们知道某件事是可计算的，那么它是否需要10秒或 20计算所需的时间显然是工程师而不是哲学家关心的问题。但如果问题是10秒与101010秒！事实上，在复杂性理论中，我们关心的量变差距通常非常大，以至于人们必须将它们视为质变差距。例如，想想阅读一篇400页的书和阅读每一本可能这样的书之间，或者写下一个千位数字和数到这个数字之间。

One might think that, once we know something is computable, whether it takes \(10\) seconds or \(20\) seconds to compute is obviously the concern of engineers rather than philosophers.  But that conclusion would not be so obvious, if the question were one of \(10\) seconds versus \(10^{10^{10}}\) seconds!  And indeed, in complexity theory, the quantitative gaps we care about are usually so vast that one has to consider them qualitative gaps as well.  Think, for example, of the difference between reading a \(400\)-page book and reading every possible such book, or between writing down a thousand-digit number and counting to that number.

更准确地说，复杂性理论提出了这样一个问题：解决问题所需的资源如何随着某种程度的扩大而扩大n问题规模：“合理”（例如 n 或者n2，比如说），或者“不合理地”（比如 2n 或者n！)? 例如，两个n位整数可以用以下方法相乘 ∼n2计算步骤（通过小学方法），甚至∼n日志⁡n日志⁡日志⁡n 步骤（通过更高级的方法）。这两种方法都被认为是有效的。相比之下，已知的最快的逆运算方法是分解一个n位整数分解为素数—用途∼2n1/3 步骤，这被认为是低效的。7众所周知  ，乘法和因式分解的固有困难之间的这种推测差距是目前互联网上使用的大多数密码学的基础。

More precisely, complexity theory asks the question: how do the resources needed to solve a problem scale with some measure \(n\) of the problem size: “reasonably” (like \(n\) or \(n^{2}\), say), or “unreasonably” (like \(2^{n}\) or \(n!\))?  As an example, two \(n\)-digit integers can be multiplied using \(\sim n^{2}\) computational steps (by the grade-school method), or even \(\sim n\log n\log\log n\) steps (by more advanced methods ).  Either method is considered efficient.  By contrast, the fastest known method for the reverse operation—factoring an \(n\)-digit integer into primes—uses \(\sim2^{n^{1/3}}\) steps, which is considered inefficient.7  Famously, this conjectured gap between the inherent difficulties of multiplying and factoring is the basis for most of the cryptography currently used on the Internet.

理论计算机科学家通常称一个算法是“有效的”，如果它的运行时间可以用任意多项式函数来设定上限n，如果其运行时间的下限为n8这些标准具有理论上便利性的巨大优势。  虽然问题的确切复杂性可能取决于“低级编码细节”，例如我们的图灵机是否有一个或两个存储带，或者输入如何编码为二进制字符串，但问题落在多项式/指数二分法上的位置可以证明与几乎所有此类选择无关。9多项式和指数时间的封闭性同样  重要：调用多项式时间子程序的多项式时间算法仍然会产生一个整体多项式时间算法，而调用指数时间子程序（或反之亦然）的多项式时间算法会产生一个指数时间算法。理论计算机科学家关注多项式时间（而不是，比如说，n2 时间或n日志⁡n时间）；我们将在第[COBHAM] 节中探讨其中一些原因。

Theoretical computer scientists generally call an algorithm “ efficient” if its running time can be upper-bounded by any polynomial function of \(n\), and “ inefficient” if its running time can be lower-bounded by any exponential function of \(n\).8  These criteria have the great advantage of theoretical convenience.  While the exact complexity of a problem might depend on “low-level encoding details,” such as whether our Turing machine has one or two memory tapes, or how the inputs are encoded as binary strings, where a problem falls on the polynomial/exponential dichotomy can be shown to be independent of almost all such choices.9  Equally important are the closure properties of polynomial and exponential time: a polynomial-time algorithm that calls a polynomial-time subroutine still yields an overall polynomial-time algorithm, while a polynomial-time algorithm that calls an exponential-time subroutine (or vice versa) yields an exponential-time algorithm.  There are also more sophisticated reasons why theoretical computer scientists focus on polynomial time (rather than, say, \(n^{2}\) time or \(n^{\log n}\) time); we’ll explore some of those reasons in Section [COBHAM].

多项式/指数的区别显然存在异议：一个算法1.00000001n 在实践中，步骤会比算法快得多n10000 步骤！此外，还有许多增长率介于多项式和指数之间，例如 n日志⁡n 和22日志⁡n。但从经验上看，多项式时间对应于“实践中有效”，指数时间对应于“实践中无效”，复杂性理论家们经常会做出这样的区分。  为什么这种区分有效本身就是一个有趣的问题，我们将在[CONC]节中回顾这个问题。

The polynomial/exponential distinction is open to obvious objections: an algorithm that took \(1.00000001^{n}\) steps would be much faster in practice than an algorithm that took \(n^{10000}\) steps!  Furthermore, there are many growth rates that fall between polynomial and exponential, such as \(n^{\log n}\) and \(2^{2^{\sqrt{\log n}}}\).  But empirically, polynomial-time turned out to correspond to “efficient in practice,” and exponential-time to “ inefficient in practice,” so often that complexity theorists became comfortable making the identification.  Why the identification works is an interesting question in its own right, one to which we will return in Section [CONC].

先验地，坚持程序在合理的时间后终止，使用合理数量的内存等，听起来像是对图灵的计算概念的相对较小的修正。但在实践中，这些要求导致了一种与可计算性理论完全不同的理论。首先，复杂性与科学有着更密切的联系 ：它让我们提出关于（例如）进化、量子力学、统计物理、经济学或人类语言习得的问题，而这些问题从可计算性的角度来看毫无意义（因为所有相关问题都是可计算的）。复杂性在所使用的数学技术的多样性方面也不同于可计算性：虽然最初复杂性（如可计算性）主要借鉴数理逻辑，但今天它借鉴了概率、数论、组合学、表示论、傅里叶分析以及几乎所有其他黄皮书所涉及的主题。当然，这不仅增加了复杂性理论的深度，也增加了其被认为的难以理解性。

A priori, insisting that programs terminate after reasonable amounts of time, that they use reasonable amounts of memory, etc. might sound like relatively-minor amendments to Turing’s notion of computation.  In practice, though, these requirements lead to a theory with a completely different character than computability theory.  Firstly, complexity has much closer connections with the sciences: it lets us pose questions about (for example) evolution, quantum mechanics, statistical physics, economics, or human language acquisition that would be meaningless from a computability standpoint (since all the relevant problems are computable).  Complexity also differs from computability in the diversity of mathematical techniques used: while initially complexity (like computability) drew mostly on mathematical logic, today it draws on probability, number theory, combinatorics, representation theory, Fourier analysis, and nearly every other subject about which yellow books are written.  Of course, this contributes not only to complexity theory’s depth but also to its perceived inaccessibility.

在本文中，我将论证复杂性理论与哲学中的重大问题有着直接的关联，包括语法和语义、归纳问题以及量子力学的解释。或者至少，复杂性理论是否具有这样的关联对于哲学来说是一个重要的问题！我个人的观点是，复杂性最终将证明比可计算性与哲学更相关，这恰恰是因为前面提到的与科学的丰富联系。

In this essay, I’ll argue that complexity theory has direct relevance to major issues in philosophy, including syntax and semantics, the problem of induction, and the interpretation of quantum mechanics.  Or that, at least, whether complexity theory does or does not have such relevance is an important question for philosophy!  My personal view is that complexity will ultimately prove more relevant to philosophy than computability was, precisely because of the rich connections with the sciences mentioned earlier.

多项式时间的相关性

The Relevance of Polynomial Time

任何怀疑多项式/指数区别重要性的人只需思考一下，数学、科学和哲学中有多少基本直觉已经隐含地依赖于这种区别。在本节中，我将给出三个例子。

Anyone who doubts the importance of the polynomial/exponential distinction needs only ponder how many basic intuitions in math, science, and philosophy already implicitly rely on that distinction.  In this section I’ll give three examples.

重新审视恩赐问题

The Entscheidungsproblem Revisited

判定性问题是 大卫·希尔伯特在 20 世纪 20 年代提出的梦想，即设计一种机械程序来确定任何格式正确的数学陈述的真假。根据通常的说法，希尔伯特的梦想被 20 世纪 30 年代哥德尔、丘奇和图灵的工作彻底摧毁了。首先，不完备性定理表明，没有一个可递归公理化的形式系统可以编码所有且仅编码真实的数学陈述。其次，丘奇和图灵的结果表明，即使我们满足于不完备的系统F到目前为止，还没有一个机械的程序把数学陈述分成三类“可证明的F” “无法证明 F”和“无法判定的F”

The Entscheidungsproblem was the dream, enunciated by David Hilbert in the 1920s, of designing a mechanical procedure to determine the truth or falsehood of any well-formed mathematical statement.  According to the usual story, Hilbert’s dream was irrevocably destroyed by the work of Gödel, Church, and Turing in the 1930s.  First, the Incompleteness Theorem showed that no recursively-axiomatizable formal system can encode all and only the true mathematical statements.  Second, Church’s and Turing’s results showed that, even if we settle for an incomplete system \(F\), there is still no mechanical procedure to sort mathematical statements into the three categories “provable in \(F\),”  “disprovable in \(F\),” and “undecidable in \(F\).”

然而，上述故事中有一个问题，这个问题最早是由哥德尔本人在 1956 年写给约翰·冯·诺依曼的一封信中指出的，这封信自 20 世纪 80 年代被重新发现以来，在理论计算机科学中就变得举世闻名（见 Sipser英文翻译）。给定一个形式系统F哥德尔写道，（例如 Zermelo-Fraenkel 集合论）考虑决定一个数学陈述是否年代 有证明F 和 n 符号或更少。  与希尔伯特的原始问题不同，这个“截断判定问题”显然是可判定的。因为，如果没有别的办法，我们总是可以编写一个计算机来搜索所有2n 可能的位串n符号，并检查其中是否有一个编码有效的F-证明年代问题“仅仅”在于这种方法需要大量的时间：如果n=1000（比如说），那么在计算机能够检查之前，宇宙就会退化为黑洞和辐射21000 证明！

However, there is a catch in the above story, which was first pointed out by Gödel himself, in a 1956 letter to John von Neumann that has become famous in theoretical computer science since its rediscovery in the 1980s (see Sipser for an English translation).  Given a formal system \(F\) (such as Zermelo-Fraenkel set theory), Gödel wrote, consider the problem of deciding whether a mathematical statement \(S\) has a proof in \(F\) with \(n\) symbols or fewer.  Unlike Hilbert’s original problem, this “truncated Entscheidungsproblem” is clearly decidable.  For, if nothing else, we could always just program a computer to search through all \(2^{n}\) possible bit-strings with \(n\) symbols, and check whether any of them encodes a valid \(F\)-proof of \(S\).  The issue is “ merely” that this approach takes an astronomical amount of time: if \(n=1000\) (say), then the universe will have degenerated into black holes and radiation long before a computer can check \(2^{1000}\) proofs!

但正如哥德尔所指出的那样，如何证明没有更好的方法还远未可知 ：一种方法可以避免暴力搜索，并找到大小证明n在时间多项式中n。 此外：

But as Gödel also pointed out, it’s far from obvious how to prove that there isn’t a much better approach: an approach that would avoid brute-force search, and find proofs of size \(n\) in time polynomial in \(n\).  Furthermore:

如果真的有一台[运行时间]的机器∼钾n（或者甚至只与∼钾n2）[对于某个常数钾独立于n]，这将产生最重大的影响。也就是说，这将清楚地表明，尽管判定问题无法解决，但数学家在是非问题中的脑力劳动可以完全被机器取代[在脚注中补充：除了公理的假设]。人们确实只需选择一个n如此之大，以至于如果机器没有产生结果，那么就没有理由进一步思考这个问题。

If there actually were a machine with [running time] \(\sim Kn\) (or even only with \(\sim Kn^{2}\)) [for some constant \(K\) independent of \(n\)], this would have consequences of the greatest magnitude.  That is to say, it would clearly indicate that, despite the unsolvability of the Entscheidungsproblem, the mental effort of the mathematician in the case of yes-or-no questions could be completely [added in a footnote: apart from the postulation of axioms] replaced by machines.  One would indeed have to simply select an \(n\) so large that, if the machine yields no result, there would then also be no reason to think further about the problem.

如果我们替换“∼钾n或者 ∼钾n2”在哥德尔的挑战中∼钾n丙 对于 任意常数丙那么我们就得到了计算机科学现在所知道的磷 相对名词解释问题。这里磷 （多项式时间）粗略地说，是所有可以通过多项式时间算法解决的计算问题。同时，名词解释 （非确定性多项式时间）是一类可以在多项式时间内找到解决方案的计算问题，即使解决方案可能很难找到。10 （  例如，考虑分解一个大数，或解决拼图或数独难题。）显然磷⊆名词解释，所以问题是包含是否严格。如果磷=名词解释，那么高效检查谜题解决方案的能力就意味着高效寻找解决方案的能力 。打个比方，如果任何能够欣赏伟大交响乐的人也能自己创作一首交响乐！

If we replace the “\(\sim Kn\) or \(\sim Kn^{2}\) ” in Gödel’s challenge by \(\sim Kn^{c}\) for an arbitrary constant \(c\), then we get precisely what computer science now knows as the \(\mathsf{P}\ \)versus \(\mathsf{NP}\) problem.  Here \(\mathsf{P}\) (Polynomial-Time) is, roughly speaking, the class of all computational problems that are solvable by a polynomial-time algorithm.  Meanwhile, \(\mathsf{NP}\) (Nondeterministic Polynomial-Time) is the class of computational problems for which a solution can be recognized in polynomial time, even though a solution might be very hard to find.10  (Think, for example, of factoring a large number, or solving a jigsaw or Sudoku puzzle.)  Clearly \(\mathsf{P}\subseteq\mathsf{NP}%\), so the question is whether the inclusion is strict.  If \(\mathsf{P}% =\mathsf{NP}\), then the ability to check the solutions to puzzles efficiently would imply the ability to find solutions efficiently.  An analogy would be if anyone able to appreciate a great symphony could also compose one themselves!

鉴于这种情景在直觉上不可信，基本上所有的复杂性理论家都（在我看来，这是合理的）假设 磷≠名词解释，即使他们公开宣称对这个问题持开放态度。证明或反驳磷≠名词解释 是七个百万美元克莱千禧年大奖难题之一11 （与黎曼猜想一起，庞加莱猜想于 2002由佩雷尔曼等人提出），这应该能表明问题的难度。12

Given the intuitive implausibility of such a scenario, essentially all complexity theorists proceed (reasonably, in my opinion) on the assumption that \(\mathsf{P}\neq\mathsf{NP}\), even if they publicly claim open-mindedness about the question.  Proving or disproving \(\mathsf{P}\neq\mathsf{NP}\) is one of the seven million-dollar Clay Millennium Prize Problems11 (alongside the Riemann Hypothesis, the Poincaré Conjecture proved in \(2002\) by Perelman, etc.), which should give some indication of the problem’s difficulty.12

现在回到数学陈述是否年代有证明n在某些形式系统中，符号或更少 F. 这个问题的适当形式化很容易看出是名词解释。因为找到一个证明可能很难，但如果我们给出了一个所谓的证明，我们当然可以检查时间多项式n证明的每一行是否都遵循了前面几行的简单逻辑操作。事实上，这个问题实际上是名词解释-完全的，这意味着它属于一个巨大的类名词解释 20 世纪 70 年代首次发现的问题，“捕捉到了名词解释” 其他几个例子 名词解释完全问题包括数独和拼图游戏、旅行商问题和命题公式的可满足性问题。13  询问磷=名词解释 相当于询问是否有 名词解释-完全问题可以在多项式时间内解决，也等同于问是否 所有问题都可以解决。

Now return to the problem of whether a mathematical statement \(S\) has a proof with \(n\) symbols or fewer, in some formal system \(F\).  A suitable formalization of this problem is easily seen to be in \(\mathsf{NP}\).  For finding a proof might be intractable, but if we’re given a purported proof, we can certainly check in time polynomial in \(n\) whether each line of the proof follows by a simple logical manipulation of previous lines.  Indeed, this problem turns out to be \(\mathsf{NP}\)-complete, which means that it belongs to an enormous class of \(\mathsf{NP}\) problems, first identified in the 1970s, that “capture the entire difficulty of \(\mathsf{NP}\).”  A few other examples of \(\mathsf{NP}%\)-complete problems are Sudoku and jigsaw puzzles, the Traveling Salesperson Problem, and the satisfiability problem for propositional formulas.13  Asking whether \(\mathsf{P}=\mathsf{NP}\) is equivalent to asking whether any \(\mathsf{NP}\)-complete problem can be solved in polynomial time, and is also equivalent to asking whether all of them can be.

那么，用现代术语来说，哥德尔的意思是，如果磷=名词解释，那么只要一个定理有合理长度的证明，我们就能在合理的时间内找到证明。在这种情况下，我们可以说“出于所有实际目的”，希尔伯特机械化数学的梦想已经实现，尽管哥德尔、丘奇和图灵的不可判定性结果。如果你接受这一点，那么可以说，直到磷相对名词解释 已经解决，希尔伯特判定问题的故事——它的兴起、衰落及其对哲学的影响——尚未结束。

In modern terms, then, Gödel is saying that if \(\mathsf{P}=\mathsf{NP}\), then whenever a theorem had a proof of reasonable length, we could find that proof in a reasonable amount of time.  In such a situation, we might say that “for all practical purposes,” Hilbert’s dream of mechanizing mathematics had prevailed, despite the undecidability results of Gödel, Church, and Turing.  If you accept this, then it seems fair to say that until \(\mathsf{P}\) versus \(\mathsf{NP}\) is solved, the story of Hilbert’s Entscheidungsproblem—its rise, its fall, and the consequences for philosophy—is not yet over.

可进化性

Evolvability

创造论者经常声称，达尔文进化论对于复杂适应的解释就像“龙卷风在穿过垃圾场时组装了一架 747 飞机”一样空洞。为什么这种说法是错误的？有几种相关的回答方式，但对我来说，最有启发性的一种是以下方式。原则上，人们 可以在龙卷风频发的垃圾场看到一架 747 飞机自行组装——但在那之前，人们需要等待预期数量的龙卷风，该数量随着自组装垃圾的数量呈指数增长。（这类似于热力学中，n盒子里的气体粒子最终会 聚集在盒子的一个角落，但只有在∼丙n一些恒定的时间丙) 相比之下，进化过程通常可以在模拟中观察到——在某些情况下，甚至可以得到理论证明——经过多个步骤后找到优化问题的有趣解决方案，这些步骤仅 随着变量的数量呈多项式增长。

Creationists often claim that Darwinian evolution is as vacuous an explanation for complex adaptations as “a tornado assembling a 747 airplane as it passes through a junkyard.”  Why is this claim false?  There are several related ways of answering the question, but to me, one of the most illuminating is the following.  In principle, one could see a 747 assemble itself in a tornado-prone junkyard—but before that happened, one would need to wait for an expected number of tornadoes that grew exponentially with the number of pieces of self-assembling junk.  (This is similar to how, in thermodynamics, \(n\) gas particles in a box will eventually congregate themselves in one corner of the box, but only after \(\sim c^{n}\) time for some constant \(c\).)  By contrast, evolutionary processes can often be observed in simulations—and in some cases, even proved theoretically—to find interesting solutions to optimization problems after a number of steps that grows only polynomially with the number of variables.

有趣的是，在 1972 年写给王浩的一封信中（见），库尔特·哥德尔（Kurt Gödel）对进化论表达了自己的怀疑：

Interestingly, in a 1972 letter to Hao Wang (see ), Kurt Gödel expressed his own doubts about evolution as follows:

我认为生物学中的机制是我们这个时代的偏见，它将被推翻。在这种情况下，我认为一个反证将来自一个数学定理，即人体在地质时期内按照物理定律（或任何其他类似定律）从基本粒子和场的随机分布开始形成，就像大气偶然分离成其组成部分一样不可能。

I believe that mechanism in biology is a prejudice of our time which will be disproved.  In this case, one disproof, in my opinion, will consist in a mathematical theorem to the effect that the formation within geological time of a human body by the laws of physics (or any other laws of similar nature), starting from a random distribution of the elementary particles and the field, is as unlikely as the separation by chance of the atmosphere into its components.

就我个人而言，我认为没有理由接受哥德尔在这个问题上的直觉，而放弃现代生物学的共识！但请注意哥德尔一贯谨慎的措辞。他没有问进化是否最终能形成人体（因为他知道，给定指数时间，它可以）；相反，他问它是否可以在“仅仅”地质上做到这一点时间尺度。正如哥德尔在写给冯·诺依曼的信中预言的那样磷 相对名词解释 问题，因此，哥德尔写给王的信可以说是预示了著名计算机科学家莱斯利·瓦利安特最近努力构建一个量化的“可进化性理论” . 基于 Valiant 早期在计算学习理论方面的工作（在[PAC]节中讨论），可进化性试图形式化并回答有关进化速度的问题。例如：“哪些类型的适应性行为可以在仅经过多项式代数后以高概率进化？哪些类型的行为可以在多项式时间内学习，但 不能通过进化？”虽然有一些有趣的早期结果，但进化性还远远不能从第一原理计算出四十亿年对于人类大脑从原始汤中进化出来来说是否是“合理”或“不合理”的时间长度，这应该不会让任何人感到惊讶。

Personally, I see no reason to accept Gödel’s intuition on this subject over the consensus of modern biology!  But pay attention to Gödel’s characteristically-careful phrasing. He does not ask whether evolution can eventually form a human body (for he knows that it can, given exponential time); instead, he asks whether it can do so on a “merely” geological timescale.  Just as Gödel’s letter to von Neumann anticipated the \(\mathsf{P}% \ \)versus \(\mathsf{NP}\) problem, so Gödel’s letter to Wang might be said to anticipate a recent effort, by the celebrated computer scientist Leslie Valiant, to construct a quantitative “theory of evolvability” .  Building on Valiant’s earlier work in computational learning theory (discussed in Section [PAC]), evolvability tries to formalize and answer questions about the speed of evolution.  For example: “what sorts of adaptive behaviors can evolve, with high probability, after only a polynomial number of generations?  what sorts of behaviors can be learned in polynomial time, but not via evolution?”  While there are some interesting early results, it should surprise no one that evolvability is nowhere close to being able to calculate, from first principles, whether four billion years is a “reasonable” or “unreasonable” length of time for the human brain to evolve out of the primordial soup.

在我看来，这种困难反映了哥德尔“可进化性”问题的一个普遍观点。也就是说，即使假设哥德尔是对的，现代生物学的机械世界观“就像大气偶然分离成其组成部分一样不可能”，计算复杂性理论似乎也远远无法证明任何此类问题！1972 年，人们可能会说，这仅仅反映了该主题的新颖性：还没有人深入思考如何证明计算时间的下限。但到现在为止，人们已经对此进行了深入思考，并发现了证明甚至“明显”且定义明确的猜想的巨大障碍，例如磷≠名词解释. 14  （第[AI]节将提出相关观点，关于证明计算机程序通过图灵测试所需的时间或内存的非平凡下限的难度。）

As I see it, this difficulty reflects a general point about Gödel’s “evolvability” question.  Namely, even supposing Gödel was right, that the mechanistic worldview of modern biology was “as unlikely as the separation by chance of the atmosphere into its components,” computational complexity theory seems hopelessly far from being able to prove anything of the kind!  In 1972, one could have argued that this merely reflected the subject’s newness: no one had thought terribly deeply yet about how to prove lower bounds on computation time.  But by now, people have thought deeply about it, and have identified huge obstacles to proving even such “obvious” and well-defined conjectures as \(\mathsf{P}\neq\mathsf{NP}\).14  (Section [AI] will make a related point, about the difficulty of proving nontrivial lower bounds on the time or memory needed by a computer program to pass the Turing Test.)

已知整数

Known Integers

我最后举的关于多项式/指数区别的哲学意义的例子与数学中的“知识”概念有关。15  截至 2011 年，据 GIMPS（互联网梅森素数大搜索）报告，“已知最大素数” 16是页：=243112609−1。但仔细想想，我们说这句话是什么意思页是“已知”的吗？我们的意思是，如果我们愿意，我们可以直接打印出它的十进制数字（使用大约三十，000页）？这似乎是一个过于严格的标准。对于给定一个正整数钾以及问=2钾−1 是素数，我想大多数数学家都会毫不犹豫地称问一个“已知”的素数，即使钾如此之大，以至于打印出它的十进制数字（或将它们存储在计算机内存中）超出了地球的容量。我们应该称221000 “未知的力量2”，只是因为它有太多的小数位，在太阳变冷之前无法列出？

My last example of the philosophical relevance of the polynomial/exponential distinction concerns the concept of “ knowledge” in mathematics.15  As of 2011, the “largest known prime number,” as reported by GIMPS (the Great Internet Mersenne Prime Search),16 is \(p:=2^{43112609}-1\).  But on reflection, what do we mean by saying that \(p\) is “ known”?  Do we mean that, if we desired, we could literally print out its decimal digits (using about \(30,000\) pages)?  That seems like too restrictive a criterion.  For, given a positive integer \(k\) together with a proof that \(q=2^{k}-1\) was prime, I doubt most mathematicians would hesitate to call \(q\) a “known” prime, even if \(k\) were so large that printing out its decimal digits (or storing them in a computer memory) were beyond the Earth’s capacity.  Should we call \(2^{2^{1000}}\) an “unknown power of \(2\),”  just because it has too many decimal digits to list before the Sun goes cold?

我觉得真正重要的是

All that should really matter, one feels, is that

  1. 表达式 '243112609−1' 选出一个唯一的正整数，并且

  2. the expression ‘\(2^{43112609}-1\)’ picks out a unique positive integer, and

  3. 该整数已经被证明（在这种情况下，当然是通过计算机）为素数。

  4. that integer has been proven (in this case, via computer, of course) to be prime.

但是等等！如果这些就是标准，那么为什么我们不能立即打破已知最大素数记录呢？页′=第一个大于 243112609−1.清楚地页′存在，无歧义地定义，并且是素数。如果我们愿意，我们甚至可以编写一个程序，保证找到页′并输出其十进制数字，使用可以先验地 设定上限的步骤数。17然而  我们的直觉却固执地坚持认为243112609−1是“已知”素数，即页′不是。这样的区分有没有什么原则性依据？

But wait!  If those are the criteria, then why can’t we immediately beat the largest-known-prime record, like so? \[p^{\prime}=\text{The first prime larger than }2^{43112609}-1.\] Clearly \(p^{\prime}\) exists, it is unambiguously defined, and it is prime.  If we want, we can even write a program that is guaranteed to find \(p^{\prime}\) and output its decimal digits, using a number of steps that can be upper-bounded a priori.17  Yet our intuition stubbornly insists that \(2^{43112609}-1\) is a “known” prime in a sense that \(p^{\prime}\) is not.  Is there any principled basis for such a distinction?

我能给出的最清晰的基础如下。我们知道一个算法，它以一个正整数作为输入钾，并输出十进制数字 页=2钾−1 使用多项式（实际上是线性的）的步骤数，其位数为 页但我们不知道有任何类似有效的算法可以证明输出第一个大于2钾−1. 18

The clearest basis that I can suggest is the following.  We know an algorithm that takes as input a positive integer \(k\), and that outputs the decimal digits of \(p=2^{k}-1\) using a number of steps that is polynomial—indeed, linear—in the number of digits of \(p\).  But we do not know any similarly-efficient algorithm that provably outputs the first prime larger than \(2^{k}-1\).18

概括

Summary

这些例子的目的是为了说明，除了对理论计算机科学的实用性之外，多项式/指数差距也是哲学的沃土。我认为多项式/指数差距占据了另外两种差距的“中间地带”：一方面，小的量化差距（例如n 步骤和2n一方面，有限步骤数与无限步骤数之间的差距；另一方面，有限步骤数与无限步骤数之间的差距。小的量化差距的问题在于，它们对“平凡的”建模选择和技术细节过于敏感。但有限与无限之间的差距则存在相反的问题：它对我们真正关心的区别不太敏感 ，比如找到解决方案与验证解决方案之间的区别，或者经典物理与量子物理之间的区别。19多项式  /指数差距避免了这两个问题。

The point of these examples was to illustrate that, beyond its utility for theoretical computer science, the polynomial/exponential gap is also a fertile territory for philosophy.  I think of the polynomial/exponential gap as occupying a “middle ground” between two other sorts of gaps: on the one hand, small quantitative gaps (such as the gap between \(n\) steps and \(2n\) steps); and on the other hand, the gap between a finite number of steps and an infinite number.  The trouble with small quantitative gaps is that they are too sensitive to “ mundane” modeling choices and the details of technology.  But the gap between finite and infinite has the opposite problem: it is serenely insensitive to distinctions that we actually care about, such as that between finding a solution and verifying it, or between classical and quantum physics.19  The polynomial/exponential gap avoids both problems.

计算复杂性和图灵测试

Computational Complexity and the Turing Test

计算机能思考吗？  近一个世纪以来，关于这个问题的讨论常常混淆两个问题。第一个是“形而上学”问题：

Can a computer think?  For almost a century, discussions about this question have often conflated two issues.  The first is the “ metaphysical” issue:

假设一个计算机程序通过了图灵测试（或者图灵测试的一个强变体），20 我们是否可以正确地赋予它“意识”、“感质”、“关于性”、“意向性”、“主观性”、“人格”，或者我们希望赋予其他人和我们自己的任何其他迷人地位？

Supposing a computer program passed the Turing Test (or as strong a variant of the Turing Test as one wishes to define),20 would we be right to ascribe to it “ consciousness,” “qualia,”  “aboutness,” “ intentionality,” “ subjectivity,” “ personhood,” or whatever other charmed status we wish to ascribe to other humans and to ourselves?

第二是“实际”问题：

The second is the “practical” issue:

真的能写出通过（强化版）图灵测试的计算机程序吗？有什么根本原因导致它无法实现？

Could a computer program that passed (a strong version of) the Turing Test actually be written?  Is there some fundamental reason why it couldn’t be?

当然，图灵提出图灵测试的目的正是要区分这些问题！但尽管他做出了努力，但反人工智能论证至今仍有一个常见特点，即他们首先断言人工智能在形而上学上是不可能的，然后试图用人工智能在实际中的困难来支持这一立场。他们说：“当然，计算机程序可能会模仿几分钟的诙谐玩笑，但与人类不同，它永远不会表现出恐惧、愤怒或嫉妒，也不会创作交响乐，也不会变老，也不会坠入爱河……”

Of course, it was precisely in an attempt to separate these issues that Turing proposed the Turing Test in the first place!  But despite his efforts, a familiar feature of anti-AI arguments to this day is that they first assert AI’s metaphysical impossibility, and then try to bolster that position with claims about AI’s practical difficulties.  “ Sure,” they say, “a computer program might mimic a few minutes of witty banter, but unlike a human being, it would never show fear or anger or jealousy, or compose symphonies, or grow old, or fall in love...”

显而易见的后续问题——如果程序确实做了所有这些事情会怎样？ ——通常没有被问到，或者通过列出更多计算机程序显然永远无法做到的事情来回答。正因为如此，我怀疑许多说他们认为人工智能是形而上学不可能的人，实际上只是认为它是一种实践上的不可能：他们只是没有进行必要的思想实验，以至于看不出两者之间的区别。21顺便说一句  ，这是我所知道的最明显的例子，人们可以从学习更多哲学中受益！

The obvious followup question—and what if a program did do all those things?—is often left unasked, or else answered by listing more things that a computer program could self-evidently never do.  Because of this, I suspect that many people who say they consider AI a metaphysical impossibility, really consider it only a practical impossibility: they simply have not carried the requisite thought experiment far enough to see the difference between the two.21  Incidentally, this is as clear-cut a case as I know of where people would benefit from studying more philosophy!

因此，我最感兴趣的反人工智能论点始终是那些从一开始就针对实际问题的论点，通过提出经验性的“石中剑测试”（用丹尼尔·丹尼特的话来说) 据称人类可以通过，但计算机不能。最著名的此类测试可能是基于哥德尔不完全性定理的测试，由约翰·卢卡斯提出罗杰·彭罗斯在他的著作《皇帝的新脑》中详细阐述  和心灵阴影 。

Thus, the anti-AI arguments that interest me most have always been the ones that target the practical issue from the outset, by proposing empirical “sword-in-the-stone tests” (in Daniel Dennett’s phrase ) that it is claimed humans can pass but computers cannot.  The most famous such test is probably the one based on Gödel’s Incompleteness Theorem, as proposed by John Lucas and elaborated by Roger Penrose in his books The Emperor’s New Mind  and Shadows of the Mind .

简而言之，卢卡斯和彭罗斯认为，根据不完备定理，计算机通过固定的形式规则进行推理永远无法做到的一件事就是“看到”自己规则的一致性。然而，他们断言，这是人类数学家 可以通过某种对柏拉图现实的直觉感知来做到的事情。因此，人类（或者至少是人类数学家！）永远无法被机器模拟。

Briefly, Lucas and Penrose argued that, according to the Incompleteness Theorem, one thing that a computer making deductions via fixed formal rules can never do is to “see” the consistency of its own rules.  Yet this, they assert, is something that human mathematicians can do, via some sort of intuitive perception of Platonic reality.  Therefore humans (or at least, human mathematicians!) can never be simulated by machines.

批评者指出了这一论点的许多漏洞，22彭罗斯在《心灵的阴影》 中对此进行了长篇回应，但在我看来，这种回应毫无说服力。然而，在我们分析一些拟议的石中剑测试之前，在我看来，还有一个更基本的问题。也就是说，当人们说某人有一项任务“人类可以完成但计算机不能完成”时，到底是什么意思呢？

Critics pointed out numerous holes in this argument,22 to which Penrose responded at length in Shadows of the Mind, in my opinion unconvincingly.  However, even before we analyze some proposed sword-in-the-stone test, it seems to me that there is a much more basic question.  Namely, what does one even mean in saying one has a task that “humans can perform but computers cannot”?

查找表论证

The Lookup-Table Argument

这里有一个根本的困难，其他人在稍微不同的背景下也注意到了这一点我先解释一下难点，然后再讨论一下我的论证和前面的论证的不同之处。

There is a fundamental difficulty here, which was noticed by others in a slightly different context .  Let me first explain the difficulty, and then discuss the difference between my argument and the previous ones.

实际上，人们在互动很短的时间后，可能只有几秒钟，就判断对方有意识。这表明我们可以设定一个有限的上限——慷慨地说，我们可以说1020—两个人之间传递的信息位数一个 和乙之前一个已经收集了足够的证据来得出结论乙是有意识的。23现在  想象一个查找表，它存储了所有可能的历史赫 的 一个和乙的谈话，旁边是赫，动作f乙（赫）那乙 假设历史，接下来会发生什么。当然，就像博尔赫斯的巴别图书馆一样，查找表几乎完全由毫无意义的废话组成，而且它也太大了，无法容纳在观察到的宇宙中。但对我们来说，重要的是查找表是有限的，因为假设对话长度有一个有限的上限。这意味着函数f乙是可计算的（事实上，它可以被有限自动机识别！）。从这些简单的考虑中，我们得出结论，如果计算机通过图灵测试存在根本障碍，那么它就不会在可计算性理论中找到。24

In practice, people judge each other to be conscious after interacting for a very short time, perhaps as little as a few seconds.  This suggests that we can put a finite upper bound—to be generous, let us say \(10^{20}\)—on the number of bits of information that two people \(A\) and \(B\) would ever realistically exchange, before \(A\) had amassed enough evidence to conclude \(B\) was conscious.23  Now imagine a lookup table that stores every possible history \(H\) of \(A\) and \(B\)’s conversation, and next to \(H\), the action \(f_{B}\left( H\right)\) that \(B\) would take next given that history.  Of course, like Borges’ Library of Babel, the lookup table would consist almost entirely of meaningless nonsense, and it would also be much too large to fit inside the observed universe.  But all that matters for us is that the lookup table would be finite, by the assumption that there is a finite upper bound on the conversation length.  This implies that the function \(f_{B}\) is computable (indeed, it can be recognized by a finite automaton!).  From these simple considerations, we conclude that if there is a fundamental obstacle to computers passing the Turing Test, then it is not to be found in computability theory.24

心灵阴影 彭罗斯认识到了这个问题，但却给出了一个令人费解且不令人满意的回答：

In Shadows of the Mind , Penrose recognizes this problem, but gives a puzzling and unsatisfying response:

我们同样可以设想计算机只包含完全错误的数学“定理”列表，或包含随机混杂的真假真假的列表。我们如何判断哪台计算机是可信的？我在这里试图提出的论点并不是说，对有意识的人类活动（这里指数学）的输出进行有效模拟是不可能的，因为纯粹出于偶然，计算机可能会“碰巧”做出正确的判断——即使没有任何理解。但这种可能性非常大，而这里要解决的问题，即如何确定 哪些数学陈述是真的，哪些是假的，甚至没有被触及……

One could equally well envisage computers that contain nothing but lists of totally false mathematical ‘theorems,’ or lists containing random jumbles of truths and falsehoods.  How are we to tell which computer to trust?  The arguments that I am trying to make here do not say that an effective simulation of the output of conscious human activity (here mathematics) is impossible, since purely by chance the computer might ‘happen’ to get it right—even without any understanding whatsoever.  But the odds against this are absurdly enormous, and the issues that are being addressed here, namely how one decides which mathematical statements are true and which are false, are not even being touched...

这种回应的问题在于，它相当于从石中剑测试中撤退，回到更模糊的内部标准。如果最终我们无论如何都要查看计算机内部，以确定它是否真正“理解”其答案，那么为什么不从一开始就放弃可计算性理论呢？  因为可计算性理论只解决是否 存在图灵机来解决各种问题，而我们已经看到这不是相关问题。

The trouble with this response is that it amounts to a retreat from the sword-in-the-stone test, back to murkier internal criteria. If, in the end, we are going to have to look inside the computer anyway to determine whether it truly “understands” its answers, then why not dispense with computability theory from the beginning?  For computability theory only addresses whether or not Turing machines exist to solve various problems, and we have already seen that that is not the relevant issue.

在我看来，彭罗斯可以从这一点出发，采取一个方向来避免前后矛盾——尽管令人失望的是，这不是他选择的方向。也就是说，他可以指出，虽然查找表“有效”，但它需要成倍增长的计算资源对话的长度！这将导致以下猜测：

To my mind, there is one direction that Penrose could take from this point to avoid incoherence—though disappointingly, it is not the direction he chooses.  Namely, he could point out that, while the lookup table “works,” it requires computational resources that grow exponentially with the length of the conversation!  This would lead to the following speculation:

(*)任何通过图灵测试的计算机程序在测试长度上都必须是指数级低效的——以时间、内存使用量或编写程序所需的位数等资源来衡量。换句话说，天文数字般的查找表基本上是人们能做到的最好的了。25

(*) Any computer program that passed the Turing Test would need to be exponentially-inefficient in the length of the test—as measured in some resource such as time, memory usage, or the number of bits needed to write the program down.  In other words, the astronomical lookup table is essentially the best one can do.25

如果是真的，推测 (*) 就会实现彭罗斯想要的结果：这意味着在可观测宇宙的资源限制内，人类大脑甚至无法被计算机模拟。此外，与之前的可计算性主张不同，(*) 的优势在于它不是显而易见的错误！

If true, speculation (*) would do what Penrose wants: it would imply that the human brain can’t even be simulated by computer, within the resource constraints of the observable universe.  Furthermore, unlike the earlier computability claim, (*) has the advantage of not being trivially false!

另一方面，说得客气一点，(*) 也不是那么 简单。对于人工智能支持者来说，(*) 缺乏令人信服的证据并不奇怪。毕竟，如果你相信大脑本身基本上是一个高效的26 经典图灵机，那么你就可以简单地解释为什么没有人证明大脑不能被这样的机器模拟！然而，复杂性理论也清楚地表明，即使我们假设 (*) 成立，在我们目前的数学知识水平下，也几乎没有希望证明 它。毕竟，我们甚至无法证明如下合理、定义明确的猜想磷≠名词解释。

On the other hand, to put it mildly, (*) is not trivially true either.  For AI proponents, the lack of compelling evidence for (*) is hardly surprising.  After all, if you believe that the brain itself is basically an efficient,26 classical Turing machine, then you have a simple explanation for why no one has proved that the brain can’t be simulated by such a machine!  However, complexity theory also makes it clear that, even if we supposed (*) held, there would be little hope of proving it in our current state of mathematical knowledge.  After all, we can’t even prove plausible, well-defined conjectures such as \(\mathsf{P}\neq\mathsf{NP}\).

与先前研究的关系

Relation to Previous Work

如前所述，我并不是第一个询问通过 图灵测试所需的计算资源的人，以及它们是否随着对话长度呈多项式或指数级增长。虽然许多作家都忽略了这一关键区别，但 Block、帕伯里，勒韦斯克、希伯和其他几篇文章都明确讨论了这一点。主要的区别在于，之前的讨论是在 Searle 的中文房间论证背景下进行的 。

As mentioned before, I’m far from the first person to ask about the computational resources used in passing the Turing Test, and whether they scale polynomially or exponentially with the conversation length.  While many writers ignore this crucial distinction, Block , Parberry , Levesque , Shieber , and several others all discussed it explicitly.  The main difference is that the previous discussions took place in the context of Searle’s Chinese Room argument .

简而言之，塞尔提出了一个思想实验（这里我们不必关心细节），旨在表明计算机程序可以通过图灵测试，即使该程序明显缺乏理性人所称的“智能”或“理解”的东西。对此，许多批评者表示，塞尔的论点具有极大的误导性，因为它暗中鼓励我们想象一个内部操作过于简单的计算机程序（类似于第[LOOKUP]节中描述的巨型查找表）。批评者继续说，虽然巨型查找表确实无法“真正理解”其响应，但这一点也无关紧要。因为巨型查找表无论如何都是一个哲学虚构：甚至无法容纳在可观测的宇宙中！如果我们想象一个 紧凑、高效的计算机程序通过图灵测试，那么情况将发生巨大变化。现在，为了 解释程序如何如此紧凑和高效，我们需要假设程序包括抽象概念的表示、学习和推理能力以及我们期望在头脑中找到的各种其他内部功能。

Briefly, Searle proposed a thought experiment—the details don’t concern us here—purporting to show that a computer program could pass the Turing Test, even though the program manifestly lacked anything that a reasonable person would call “intelligence” or “understanding.”  In response, many critics said that Searle’s argument was deeply misleading, because it implicitly encouraged us to imagine a computer program that was simplistic in its internal operations—something like the giant lookup table described in Section [LOOKUP].  And while it was true, the critics went on, that a giant lookup table wouldn’t “truly understand” its responses, that point is also irrelevant.  For the giant lookup table is a philosophical fiction anyway: something that can’t even fit in the observable universe!  If we instead imagine a compact, efficient computer program passing the Turing Test, then the situation changes drastically.  For now, in order to explain how the program can be so compact and efficient, we’ll need to posit that the program includes representations of abstract concepts, capacities for learning and reasoning, and all sorts of other internal furniture that we would expect to find in a mind.

我个人认为，对 Searle 的这个回应非常有趣——因为如果正确的话，它表明多项式和指数复杂度之间的区别具有形而上学 意义。根据这个回应，通过图灵测试的指数大小的查找表不会有知觉（或意识、智能、自我意识等），但具有完全相同输入/输出行为的多项式有界程序将是有知觉的。此外，后者将是有知觉的，因为它是多项式有界的。

Personally, I find this response to Searle extremely interesting—since if correct, it suggests that the distinction between polynomial and exponential complexity has metaphysical significance.  According to this response, an exponential-sized lookup table that passed the Turing Test would not be sentient (or conscious, intelligent, self-aware, etc.), but a polynomially-bounded program with exactly the same input/output behavior would be sentient.  Furthermore, the latter program would be sentient because it was polynomially-bounded.

然而，尽管感知能力的标准让我对复杂性理论的自豪感倍增，但我发现自己不愿意在如此重要的问题上表明立场。在第[LOOKUP]节中，我的观点更简单，（希望）争议更少：也就是说，如果你想声称通过图灵测试是完全不可能的，那么不管你喜欢与否，你都必须谈论复杂性，而不仅仅是可计算性。换句话说，之前的作者 我都对通过长度为n，但理由不同。其他人援引复杂性考虑来与 Searle 争论形而上学问题，而我援引复杂性考虑来与 Penrose 争论实践问题。

Yet, as much as that criterion for sentience flatters my complexity-theoretic pride, I find myself reluctant to take a position on such a weighty matter.  My point, in Section [LOOKUP], was a simpler and (hopefully) less controversial one: namely, that if you want to claim that passing the Turing Test is flat-out impossible, then like it or not, you must talk about complexity rather than just computability.  In other words, the previous writers  and I are all interested in the computational resources needed to pass a Turing Test of length \(n\), but for different reasons.  Where others invoked complexity considerations to argue with Searle about the metaphysical question, I’m invoking them to argue with Penrose about the practical question.

人类能解决名词解释-高效地完成问题？

Can Humans Solve \(\mathsf{NP}\)-Complete Problems Efficiently?

那么，我们对于实际问题究竟能说些什么呢？是否有理由接受我称之为（*）的说法——即人类无法被图灵机有效模拟的说法？在考虑这个问题时，我们立即想到了一些推测性的可能性。例如， 如果事实证明人类可以解决任意的名词解释- 多项式时间内完成的问题，那么这肯定是强有力的经验证据（*）。27  然而，尽管偶尔有人声称相反，但我个人认为没有理由相信人类 可以解决名词解释-多项式时间完成的问题，以及相信相反的充分理由。28例如  ，回想一下整数分解问题名词解释。因此，如果人类能够解决 名词解释-完全问题，那么我们大概也应该能够分解巨大的数字！但分解因式似乎并不是石中剑测试最有希望的候选者：即对人类来说很容易但对计算机来说很难的任务。据今天所知，分解因式对人类和（传统）计算机来说都很难，尽管计算机方面有明显的优势！

In that case, what can we actually say about the practical question?  Are there any reasons to accept the claim I called (*)—the claim that humans are not efficiently simulable by Turing machines?  In considering this question, we’re immediately led to some speculative possibilities.  So for example, if it turned out that humans could solve arbitrary instances of \(\mathsf{NP}\)-complete problems in polynomial time, then that would certainly strong excellent empirical evidence for (*).27  However, despite occasional claims to the contrary, I personally see no reason to believe that humans can solve \(\mathsf{NP}\)-complete problems in polynomial time, and excellent reasons to believe the opposite.28  Recall, for example, that the integer factoring problem is in \(\mathsf{NP}\).  Thus, if humans could solve \(\mathsf{NP}\)-complete problems, then presumably we ought to be able to factor enormous numbers as well!  But factoring does not exactly seem like the most promising candidate for a sword-in-the-stone test: that is, a task that’s easy for humans but hard for computers.  As far as anyone knows today, factoring is hard for humans and (classical) computers alike, although with a definite advantage on the computers’ side!

基本观点怎么强调都不为过：当复杂性理论家谈论“难以解决”的问题时，他们通常指的是数学问题，我们的所有经验都让我们相信这些问题对人类和计算机来说至少一样难。这意味着，即使图灵机不能有效地模拟人类，他们难以模拟的“方向”几乎肯定与复杂性理论通常考虑的方向不同。我认为有两种（假设的）方式可能发生这种情况。

The basic point can hardly be stressed enough: when complexity theorists talk about “intractable” problems, they generally mean mathematical problems that all our experience leads us to believe are at least as hard for humans as for computers.  This suggests that, even if humans were not efficiently simulable by Turing machines, the “direction” in which they were hard to simulate would almost certainly be different from the directions usually considered in complexity theory.  I see two (hypothetical) ways this could happen.

首先，人类擅长的任务（如绘画或写诗）可能无法与解决名词解释完全问题，因为两者都不能有效地归结为另一个。这尤其意味着，甚至不可能存在多项式时间算法来识别伟大的艺术或诗歌（因为如果存在这样的算法，那么创作 伟大的艺术或诗歌的任务将是名词解释）。在复杂性理论中，已知存在着一对在这种意义上无法比较的问题。举一个合理的例子，目前没有人知道如何将量子计算机的模拟简化为名词解释- 完成问题， 反之亦然。

First, the tasks that humans were uniquely good at—like painting or writing poetry—could be incomparable with mathematical tasks like solving \(\mathsf{NP}\)-complete problems, in the sense that neither was efficiently reducible to the other.  This would mean, in particular, that there could be no polynomial-time algorithm even to recognize great art or poetry (since if such an algorithm existed, then the task of composing great art or poetry would be in \(\mathsf{NP}\)).  Within complexity theory, it’s known that there exist pairs of problems that are incomparable in this sense.  As one plausible example, no one currently knows how to reduce the simulation of quantum computers to the solution of \(\mathsf{NP}\)-complete problems or vice versa.

其次，人类可以有能力解决有趣 的特殊情况名词解释- 比任何图灵机都更快地完成问题。因此，例如，即使计算机在分解大数或解决随机生成的数独难题方面比人类更好，人类可能仍然更擅长搜索具有“高级结构”或“语义”的问题，例如证明费马大定理或（具有讽刺意味的是）设计更快的计算机算法。事实上，即使在解谜等有限的领域，虽然计算机可以以数百万倍的速度检查解决方案，但人类（目前）在注意谜题中的整体模式或对称性方面要好得多，这些模式或对称性使得解决方案变得微不足道或不可能。举一个有趣的例子，考虑一下鸽巢原理，它说n+1 鸽子不能被放入n每个洞最多有一只鸽子。构造一个命题布尔公式并不难φ 将鸽巢原理编码为某个固定值n（说，1000）但是如果你随后喂食φ 对于当前的布尔可满足性算法，他们会孜孜不倦地开始尝试各种可能性：“让我们看看，如果我把这只鸽子放在这里，把那只鸽子放在那里……该死，它仍然不起作用！”他们会继续尝试指数级步骤的可能性，而忽略了目标永远无法实现的“整体”原因。事实上，从 20 世纪 80 年代开始，证明复杂性领域——计算复杂性的近亲——已经能够证明，大量算法需要指数级时间来证明鸽巢原理和类似的命题重言式（参见 Beame 和 Pitassi 进行调查）。

Second, humans could have the ability to solve interesting special cases of \(\mathsf{NP}\)-complete problems faster than any Turing machine.  So for example, even if computers were better than humans at factoring large numbers or at solving randomly-generated Sudoku puzzles, humans might still be better at search problems with “higher-level structure” or “semantics,”  such as proving Fermat’s Last Theorem or (ironically) designing faster computer algorithms.  Indeed, even in limited domains such as puzzle-solving, while computers can examine solutions millions of times faster, humans (for now) are vastly better at noticing global patterns or symmetries in the puzzle that make a solution either trivial or impossible.  As an amusing example, consider the Pigeonhole Principle, which says that \(n+1\) pigeons can’t be placed into \(n\) holes, with at most one pigeon per hole.  It’s not hard to construct a propositional Boolean formula \(\varphi\) that encodes the Pigeonhole Principle for some fixed value of \(n\) (say, \(1000\)).  However, if you then feed \(\varphi\) to current Boolean satisfiability algorithms, they’ll assiduously set to work trying out possibilities: “let’s see, if I put this pigeon here, and that one there ... darn, it still doesn’t work!”  And they’ll continue trying out possibilities for an exponential number of steps, oblivious to the “ global” reason why the goal can never be achieved.  Indeed, beginning in the 1980s, the field of proof complexity—a close cousin of computational complexity—has been able to show that large classes of algorithms require exponential time to prove the Pigeonhole Principle and similar propositional tautologies (see Beame and Pitassi  for a survey).

尽管如此，如果我们想将我们的石中剑测试建立在检测组合搜索问题中的“高级模式”的能力上，那么我们就有责任解释我们所说的高级模式是什么意思，以及为什么我们认为没有一个多项式时间图灵机——甚至比我们今天能想象的更复杂的图灵机——能够检测到这些模式。为了初步尝试理解名词解释-从认知科学的角度完成问题，参见 Baum。

Still, if we want to build our sword-in-the-stone test on the ability to detect “higher-level patterns” in combinatorial search problems, then the burden is on us to explain what we mean by higher-level patterns, and why we think that no polynomial-time Turing machine—even much more sophisticated ones than we can imagine today—could ever detect those patterns as well.  For an initial attempt to understand \(\mathsf{NP}\)-complete problems from a cognitive science perspective, see Baum .

概括

Summary

我的结论是，如果你原则上反对人工智能的可能性，那么

My conclusion is that, if you oppose the possibility of AI in principle, then either

  1. 你可以走“形而上学路线”（正如 Searle 承认计算机程序有可能通过所有可以想象到的智能实证测试，但认为这还不够，或者

  2. you can take the “metaphysical route” (as Searle  does with the Chinese Room), conceding the possibility of a computer program passing every conceivable empirical test for intelligence, but arguing that that isn’t enough, or

  3. 你可以推测运行这样的程序或者编写这样的程序所需的资源的天文数字的下限——但在可预见的未来，几乎没有什么可以证明这一点的。

  4. you can conjecture an astronomical lower bound on the resources needed either to run such a program or to write it in the first place—but here there is little question of proof for the foreseeable future.

至关重要的是，由于查找表论证，您没有 的一个选择是断言计算机程序通过图灵测试完全不可能，而没有提及定量复杂性界限。

Crucially, because of the lookup-table argument, one option you do not have is to assert the flat-out impossibility of a computer program passing the Turing Test, with no mention of quantitative complexity bounds.

逻辑全知问题

The Problem of Logical Omniscience

对知识进行正式说明是现代分析哲学关注的核心问题之一；文献数量太多，甚至无法在此进行调查（尽管参见 Fagin 等人的著作）。  以获得计算机科学友好的概述）。通常，知识的形式化描述涉及传统的“逻辑”公理，例如

Giving a formal account of knowledge is one of the central concerns in modern analytic philosophy; the literature is too vast even to survey here (though see Fagin et al.  for a computer-science-friendly overview).  Typically, formal accounts of knowledge involve conventional “logical” axioms, such as

  • 如果你知道磷你知道 问，那么你也知道磷∧问

  • If you know \(P\) and you know \(Q\), then you also know \(P\wedge Q\)

辅以与知识本身有关的“模态”公理，例如

supplemented by “modal” axioms having to do with knowledge itself, such as

  • 如果你知道磷，那么你也知道你知道磷

  • If you know \(P\), then you also know that you know \(P\)

  • 如果你不知道磷，那么你知道你不知道磷 二十九

  • If you don’t know \(P\), then you know that you don’t know \(P\) 29

虽然细节各不相同，但大多数正式的知识描述都有一个共同点，即它们将代理的知识视为在应用上述各种推理规则的情况下封闭的知识 。换句话说，代理在逻辑上被认为是无所不知的：如果他们知道某些事实，那么他们也知道这些事实可能产生的所有逻辑后果。

While the details differ, what most formal accounts of knowledge have in common is that they treat an agent’s knowledge as closed under the application of various deduction rules like the ones above.  In other words, agents are considered logically omniscient: if they know certain facts, then they also know all possible logical consequences of those facts.

可悲的是，显然，没有任何凡人能够达到或接近这种全知全能（回想一下第[INTRO]节开头的图灵名言）。例如，我可以知道算术规则而不知道费马大定理，我可以知道国际象棋规则而不知道白方是否有强制获胜。此外，困难并不（如有时所声称的那样）仅限于数学和游戏等少数领域。正如 Stalnaker 所指出的那样如果我们假设逻辑全知，那么我们就无法解释 对我们已经知道的事实的任何思考——因此，也无法解释哲学本身的主要活动和主要主题之一！

Sadly and obviously, no mortal being has ever attained or even approximated this sort of omniscience (recall the Turing quote from the beginning of Section [INTRO]).  So for example, I can know the rules of arithmetic without knowing Fermat’s Last Theorem, and I can know the rules of chess without knowing whether White has a forced win.  Furthermore, the difficulty is not (as sometimes claimed) limited to a few domains, such as mathematics and games.  As pointed out by Stalnaker , if we assumed logical omniscience, then we couldn’t account for any contemplation of facts already known to us—and thus, for the main activity and one of the main subjects of philosophy itself!

现在我们可以大致说出 Hintikka称为逻辑全知问题：

We can now loosely state what Hintikka called the problem of logical omniscience:

我们能否对“知识”做出某种正式的解释，使人们无需离开座位就能学习新知识？

Can we give some formal account of “ knowledge” able to accommodate people learning new things without leaving their armchairs?

当然，一个空洞的“解决方案”是宣称你的知识只是你“知道”的所有真实句子30的列表——并且，如果这个列表碰巧在逻辑推理下没有被封闭，那就这样吧！但这种“解决方案”对于解释你如何或为什么知道事情 毫无帮助。难道我们不能做得更好吗？

Of course, one vacuous “solution” would be to declare that your knowledge is simply a list of all the true sentences30 that you “know”—and that, if the list happens not to be closed under logical deductions, so be it!  But this “solution” is no help at all at explaining how or why you know things.  Can’t we do better?

直观地讲，我们想说你的“知识”由各种非逻辑事实（“草是绿色的”）以及 这些事实的一些简单推论（“草不是粉红色的”）组成，但不一定是所有推论，当然也不是所有涉及复杂数学推理的推论。不幸的是，一旦我们试图将这个想法形式化，就会遇到问题。

Intuitively, we want to say that your “ knowledge” consists of various non-logical facts (“grass is green”), together with some simple consequences of those facts (“grass is not pink”), but not necessarily all the consequences, and certainly not all consequences that involve difficult mathematical reasoning.  Unfortunately, as soon as we try to formalize this idea, we run into problems.

最明显的问题是，你立即知道的事实与你“可能”知道但需要经过深思熟虑的事实之间缺乏明确的界限。（回想一下第[INTEGERS]节中关于“已知素数”的讨论。）一个相关的问题是，你“只有被问到时才知道”的事实与即使没有被问到你也知道的事实之间缺乏明确的界限。有趣的是，这两个界限似乎相互交叉。例如，虽然你可能已经遇到过这样的事实91是复合词，你可能需要花些时间才能记住它；而你可能从未遇到过这样的事实83190是复合的，一问出来你可能马上就会同意。

The most obvious problem is the lack of a sharp boundary between the facts you know right away, and those you “could”  know, but only after significant thought.  (Recall the discussion of “known primes” from Section [INTEGERS] .)  A related problem is the lack of a sharp boundary between the facts you know “only if asked about them,” and those you know even if you’re not asked.  Interestingly, these two boundaries seem to cut across each other.  For example, while you’ve probably already encountered the fact that \(91\) is composite, it might take you some time to remember it; while you’ve probably never encountered the fact that \(83190\) is composite, once asked you can probably assent to it immediately.

但正如 Stalnaker 所讨论的那样，还有第三个问题似乎比上述两个问题都严重得多。也就是说，如果以一种方式询问，你可能“知道”某个事实，但如果以另一种方式询问，你就不会知道！为了说明这一点，Stalnaker 举了一个例子，我们可以从讨论中立即认出磷相对名词解释 问题在第[ENTSCH]节。如果我问你 43×三十七=1591，你很可能可以轻松回答（例如，通过使用（40+3）（40−3）=402−32）。另一方面，如果我问你 1591您可能 无法如此轻易地回答。

But as discussed by Stalnaker , there’s a third problem that seems much more serious than either of the two above.  Namely, you might “know” a particular fact if asked about it one way, but not if asked in a different way!  To illustrate this, Stalnaker uses an example that we can recognize immediately from the discussion of the \(\mathsf{P}\) versus \(\mathsf{NP}\) problem in Section [ENTSCH].  If I asked you whether \(43\times37=1591\), you could probably answer easily (e.g., by using \(\left( 40+3\right) \left( 40-3\right) =40^{2}-3^{2}\)).  On the other hand, if I instead asked you what the prime factors of \(1591\) were, you probably couldn’t answer so easily.

但这两个问题的答案具有相同的内容，即使在非常精细的内容概念上也是如此。假设我们固定可访问性的阈值，以便43和三十七是1591在回答第二个问题时是可访问的，但在回答第一个问题时不可访问。你知道1591 是还是不是？...我们的问题是，我们不只是想说代理人在被问到某些问题时会知道什么；相反，我们试图利用有关代理人问答能力的事实来了解代理人知道什么，即使没有问这些问题。

But the answers to the two questions have the same content, even on a very fine-grained notion of content.  Suppose that we fix the threshold of accessibility so that the information that \(43\) and \(37\) are the prime factors of \(1591\) is accessible in response to the second question, but not accessible in response to the first.  Do you know what the prime factors of \(1591\) are or not? ... Our problem is that we are not just trying to say what an agent would know upon being asked certain questions; rather, we are trying to use the facts about an agent’s question answering capacities in order to get at what the agent knows, even if the questions are not asked.

再举一个例子：一个典型的四岁孩子“知道”实数加法是可交换的吗？如果我们用这些话问她，她肯定不知道——如果我们试图解释这些话，她可能不会理解我们。然而，如果我们给她看一摞书，问她是否可以通过打乱书的顺序让书堆得更高，她可能不会犯下想象加法是不可交换的错误。从这个意义上说，我们可以说她已经“隐含地”知道了她的数学课以后会明确说明的内容。

To add another example: does a typical four-year-old child “ know” that addition of reals is commutative?  Certainly not if we asked her in those words—and if we tried to explain the words, she probably wouldn’t understand us.  Yet if we showed her a stack of books, and asked her whether she could make the stack higher by shuffling the books, she probably wouldn’t make a mistake that involved imagining addition was non-commutative.  In that sense, we might say she already “implicitly” knows what her math classes will later make explicit.

在我看来，这些例子和其他例子强烈表明，我们所说的“知识”只有一小部分是关于个别命题的真假的知识。而且至关重要的是，即使我们将注意力限制在“纯粹可言语的”上，情况仍然如此。 知识——实际上是用来回答事实问题的知识——而不是（比如说）关于如何骑自行车或挥动高尔夫球杆的知识，或关于一个人或一个地方的知识。31 “  知道”一词的许多日常用法都支持这一观点：

In my view, these and other examples strongly suggest that only a small part of what we mean by “knowledge” is knowledge about the truth or falsehood of individual propositions.  And crucially, this remains so even if we restrict our attention to “purely verbalizable” knowledge—indeed, knowledge used for answering factual questions—and not (say) knowledge of how to ride a bike or swing a golf club, or knowledge of a person or a place.31  Many everyday uses of the word “know” support this idea:

你懂微积分吗？

你懂西班牙语吗？

你知道桥牌的规则吗？

Do you know calculus?

Do you know Spanish?

Do you know the rules of bridge?

上述每个问题都可以解释为：你是否拥有一种内部算法，通过它可以回答大量（可能无限制）的某种形式的问题？  虽然这一点很少明确说明，但本节和第[INTEGERS]节的示例  建议添加附加条件： ...在合理的时间内回答？

Each of the above questions could be interpreted as asking: do you possess an internal algorithm, by which you can answer a large (and possibly-unbounded) set of questions of some form?  While this is rarely made explicit, the examples of this section and of Section [INTEGERS]  suggest adding the proviso: …answer in a reasonable amount of time?

但假设我们接受“知道如何”（或“知道一个好的算法”）是一个比“知道那个”更基本的概念。这对我们解决逻辑全知问题有什么帮助呢？你可能会担心我们又回到了原点。毕竟，如果我们试图对“知道如何”给出一个正式的解释，那么就像在“知道那个”的情况下一样，写下如下公理是很诱人的：

But suppose we accept that “knowing how”  (or “knowing a good algorithm for”) is a more fundamental concept than “knowing that.”  How does that help us at all in solving the logical omniscience problem?  You might worry that we’re right back where we started.  After all, if we try to give a formal account of “knowing how,” then just like in the case of “knowing that,” it will be tempting to write down axioms like the following:

如果你知道如何计算f（十）和克（十）有效地，那么你也知道如何计算 f（十）+克（十）高效。

If you know how to compute \(f\left( x\right)\) and \(g\left( x\right)\) efficiently, then you also know how to compute \(f\left( x\right) +g\left( x\right)\) efficiently.

当然，我们接下来会想要对这些公理进行逻辑上的封闭。但是，在不知不觉中，我们是否已经在想象中想象出一个计算无所不知的超级生物，他可以高效地计算任何东西？

Naturally, we’ll then want to take the logical closure of those axioms.  But then, before we know it, won’t we have conjured into our imaginations a computationally-omniscient superbeing, who could efficiently compute anything at all?

科巴姆公理

The Cobham Axioms

令人高兴的是，上述担忧最终被证明是没有根据的。我们可以 写下“知道如何高效计算”的合理公理，然后继续对这些公理进行闭包，而不会得到计算全知的不良后果。解释这一点将涉及复杂性理论中一个古老而迷人的角落——它可能对哲学家们有独立的兴趣。

Happily, the above worry turns out to be unfounded.  We can write down reasonable axioms for “knowing how to compute efficiently,” and then go ahead and take the closure of those axioms, without getting the unwanted consequence of computational omniscience.  Explaining this point will involve a digression into an old and fascinating corner of complexity theory—one that probably holds independent interest for philosophers.

众所周知，20 世纪 30 年代，丘奇和克莱尼提出了“可计算函数”的定义，结果发现它们与图灵的定义完全等同，但与图灵的定义不同之处在于没有明确提到机器。丘奇-克莱尼的方法不是分析 计算过程，而是简单地列出自然数的可计算函数的 公理f：否→否 应该满足——例如，“如果f（十）和克（十） 都是可计算的，那么f（克（十））”——然后将“可计算函数”定义为满足这些公理的最小集合。

As is well-known, in the 1930s Church and Kleene proposed definitions of the “computable functions” that turned out to be precisely equivalent to Turing’s definition, but that differed from Turing’s in making no explicit mention of machines.  Rather than analyzing the process of computation, the Church-Kleene approach was simply to list axioms that the computable functions of natural numbers \(f:\mathbb{N}\rightarrow\mathbb{N}\) ought to satisfy—for example, “if \(f\left( x\right)\) and \(g\left( x\right)\) are both computable, then so is \(f\left( g\left( x\right) \right)\) ”—and then to define “ the” computable functions as the smallest set satisfying those axioms.

1965 年，艾伦·科巴姆有人问，对于有效或可行可计算函数，是否可以做同样的事 。作为回答，他提出了一些公理，这些公理准确地描述了我们今天所说的 计划生育或函数多项式时间（尽管科巴姆称之为大号）类计划生育 由所有自然数函数组成f：否→否可以通过确定性图灵机在多项式时间内计算出来。注意计划生育 在道德上与阶级相同磷 （多项式时间）在[ENTSCH]节中定义：它们的区别仅在于磷 是一类 决策问题（或等价地，函数f：否→{0，1}）， 然而计划生育 是一类具有整数范围的函数。

In 1965, Alan Cobham asked whether the same could be done for the efficiently or feasibly computable functions.  As an answer, he offered axioms that precisely characterize what today we call \(\mathsf{FP}\), or Function Polynomial-Time (though Cobham called it \(\mathcal{L}\)).  The class \(\mathsf{FP}\) consists of all functions of natural numbers \(f:\mathbb{N}\rightarrow\mathbb{N}\) that are computable in polynomial time by a deterministic Turing machine.  Note that \(\mathsf{FP}%\) is “morally” the same as the class \(\mathsf{P}\) (Polynomial-Time) defined in Section [ENTSCH]: they differ only in that \(\mathsf{P}\) is a class of decision problems (or equivalently, functions \(f:\mathbb{N}\rightarrow\left\{ 0,1\right\}\)), whereas \(\mathsf{FP}\) is a class of functions with integer range.

科巴姆对多项式时间的描述值得注意的是，它没有明确提及计算设备或其运行时间的界限。现在让我列出科巴姆公理的一个版本，改编自 Arora、Impagliazzo 和 Vazirani. 每个公理都讨论了自然数的哪些函数f：否→否 是“可有效计算的”。

What was noteworthy about Cobham’s characterization of polynomial time was that it didn’t involve any explicit mention of either computing devices or bounds on their running time.  Let me now list a version of Cobham’s axioms, adapted from Arora, Impagliazzo, and Vazirani .  Each of the axioms talks about which functions of natural numbers \(f:\mathbb{N}\rightarrow\mathbb{N}\) are “efficiently computable.”

  1. 每个常数函数f 是可有效计算的，就像每个仅有限次非零的函数一样。

  2. Every constant function \(f\) is efficiently computable, as is every function which is nonzero only finitely often.

  3. 配对：如果f（十）和克（十）是可有效计算的，那么⟨f（十），克（十）⟩， 在哪里⟨，⟩ 是自然数的一些标准配对函数。

  4. Pairing: If \(f\left( x\right)\) and \(g\left( x\right)\) are efficiently computable, then so is \(\left\langle f\left( x\right) ,g\left( x\right) \right\rangle\), where \(\left\langle ,\right\rangle\) is some standard pairing function for the natural numbers.

  5. 组成：如果f（十）和克（十）是可有效计算的，那么 f（克（十））。

  6. Composition: If \(f\left( x\right)\) and \(g\left( x\right)\) are efficiently computable, then so is \(f\left( g\left( x\right) \right)\).

  7. Grab Bag：以下函数都是可有效计算的：

    • 算术函数十+是 和十×是

    • |十|=⌊日志2⁡十⌋+1（位数十的二进制表示）

    • 投影函数Π1（⟨十，是⟩）=十 和Π2（⟨十，是⟩）=是

    • 少量（⟨十，我⟩） （这我吨时长 有点十的二进制表示，或0如果我>|十|）

    • 差异（⟨十，我⟩）（从十 通过翻转我吨时长少量）

    • 2|十|2（称为“粉碎功能”）

  8. Grab Bag: The following functions are all efficiently computable:

    • the arithmetic functions \(x+y\) and \(x\times y\)

    • \(\left\vert x\right\vert =\left\lfloor \log_{2}x\right\rfloor +1\) (the number of bits in \(x\)’s binary representation)

    • the projection functions \(\Pi_{1}\left( \left\langle x,y\right\rangle \right) =x\) and \(\Pi_{2}\left( \left\langle x,y\right\rangle \right) =y\)

    • \(\operatorname*{bit}\left( \left\langle x,i\right\rangle \right)\) (the \(i^{th}\) bit of \(x\)’s binary representation, or \(0\) if \(i>\left\vert x\right\vert\))

    • \(\operatorname*{diff}\left( \left\langle x,i\right\rangle \right)\) (the number obtained from \(x\) by flipping its \(i^{th}\) bit)

    • \(2^{\left\vert x\right\vert ^{2}}\) (called the “smash function”)

  9. 有界递归：假设f（十） 是可有效计算的，并且|f（十）|≤|十|面向所有人十∈否.然后函数克（⟨十，钾⟩），定义为克（⟨十，钾⟩）={f（克（⟨十，⌊钾/2⌋⟩））如果 钾>1十如果 钾=1，也是可以有效计算的。

  10. Bounded Recursion: Suppose \(f\left( x\right)\) is efficiently computable, and \(\left\vert f\left( x\right) \right\vert \leq\left\vert x\right\vert\) for all \(x\in\mathbb{N}\).  Then the function \(g\left( \left\langle x,k\right\rangle \right)\), defined by \[g\left( \left\langle x,k\right\rangle \right) =\left\{ \begin{array} [c]{cc}% f\left( g\left( \left\langle x,\left\lfloor k/2\right\rfloor \right\rangle \right) \right) & \text{if }k>1 \\ x & \text{if }k=1 \end{array} \right. ,\] is also efficiently computable.

关于科巴姆公理的一些评论可能会有所帮助。首先，“完成大部分工作”的公理是 (5)。直观地讲，给定任何自然数钾∈否我们可以从原始输入开始生成十∈否有界递归公理让我们可以建立一个运行日志2⁡钾 步骤二、“smash 功能”的作用 2|十|2，就是让我们映射n位整数n2位整数n4位整数等等，从而（结合有界递归公理）建立计算过程，运行任意多项式步骤数。第三，虽然加法和乘法被列为“高效可计算函数”，但至关重要的是 不包括指数运算。事实上，如果十 和是 是n位整数，则十是 可能需要指数级多的位数才能写下来。

A few comments about the Cobham axioms might be helpful.  First, the axiom that “does most of the work” is (5).  Intuitively, given any natural number \(k\in\mathbb{N}\) that we can generate starting from the original input \(x\in\mathbb{N}\), the Bounded Recursion axiom lets us set up a “computational process”  that runs for \(\log_{2}k\) steps.  Second, the role of the “smash function,” \(2^{\left\vert x\right\vert ^{2}}\), is to let us map \(n\)-bit integers to \(n^{2}\)-bit integers to \(n^{4}\)-bit integers and so on, and thereby (in combination with the Bounded Recursion axiom) set up computational processes that run for arbitrary polynomial numbers of steps.  Third, although addition and multiplication are included as “efficiently computable functions,” it is crucial that exponentiation is not included.  Indeed, if \(x\) and \(y\) are \(n\)-bit integers, then \(x^{y}\) might require exponentially many bits just to write down.

基本结果如下：

The basic result is then the following:

定理 1 (）类计划生育，函数f：否→否 可由确定性图灵机在多项式时间内计算，满足公理（1）-（5），并且是满足这一点的最小类。

Theorem 1 (). The class \(\mathsf{FP}\), of functions \(f:\mathbb{N}\rightarrow\mathbb{N}\) computable in polynomial time by a deterministic Turing machine, satisfies axioms (1)-(5), and is the smallest class that does so.

为了证明定理1，需要做两件事，这两件事都不难：首先，证明任何函数f 可以用科巴姆公理定义的也可以在多项式时间内计算出来；其次，证明科巴姆公理足以模拟任何多项式时间图灵机。

To prove Theorem 1, one needs to do two things, neither of them difficult: first, show that any function \(f\) that can be defined using the Cobham axioms can also be computed in polynomial time; and second, show that the Cobham axioms are enough to simulate any polynomial-time Turing machine.

科巴姆公理的一个缺点是，它们似乎“从后门偷偷带入多项式时间的概念”——既通过“粉碎函数”，也通过任意条件|f（十）|≤|十| 公理（5）。然而，在 20 世纪 90 年代，Leivant以及贝兰托尼和库克两者都给出了更“优雅”的逻辑描述计划生育 避免了这个问题。例如，Leivant 证明了一个函数f 属于计划生育，当且仅当f由一个程序计算，该程序可以在二阶逻辑中证明其正确性，理解仅限于无正量词公式。这些结果提供了进一步的证据（如果需要的话），表明多项式时间可计算性是一个非常自然的概念：一个“概念空间中的广泛目标”，即使瞄准纯逻辑方向也能击中。

One drawback of the Cobham axioms is that they seem to “sneak in the concept of polynomial-time through the back door” —both through the “smash function,” and through the arbitrary-looking condition \(\left\vert f\left( x\right) \right\vert \leq\left\vert x\right\vert\) in axiom (5).  In the 1990s, however, Leivant and Bellantoni and Cook both gave more “elegant” logical characterizations of \(\mathsf{FP}\) that avoid this problem.  So for example, Leivant showed that a function \(f\) belongs to \(\mathsf{FP}\), if and only if \(f\) is computed by a program that can be proved correct in second-order logic with comprehension restricted to positive quantifier-free formulas.  Results like these provide further evidence—if any was needed—that polynomial-time computability is an extremely natural notion: a “wide target in conceptual space” that one hits even while aiming in purely logical directions.

在过去的几十年里，定义复杂性类别的想法如下磷和名词解释 以“逻辑的、非机器的”方式进行计算，催生了一个名为 描述复杂性理论的整个领域，它与有限模型理论有着深厚的联系。虽然进一步讨论描述复杂性理论会让我们走得太远，但请参阅 Immerman 的书 为最终介绍，或费金 进行一项调查。

Over the past few decades, the idea of defining complexity classes such as \(\mathsf{P}\) and \(\mathsf{NP}\) in “logical, machine-free” ways has given rise to an entire field called descriptive complexity theory, which has deep connections with finite model theory.  While further discussion of descriptive complexity theory would take us too far afield, see the book of Immerman  for the definitive introduction, or Fagin  for a survey.

全知与无限

Omniscience Versus Infinity

回到我们最初的话题，科巴姆（或丘奇和克莱恩）的公理理论究竟是如何逃避全知问题的？一个直接的答案是，与某些形式语言中只有可 数无限的真句子集不同，函数集f：否→否 是 不可数无限的。因此，即使我们定义“有效可计算”函数f：否→否 通过采用可数无限逻辑闭包，我们肯定会错过 一些函数f （事实上​​，几乎全部都是！）。

Returning to our original topic, how exactly do axiomatic theories such as Cobham’s (or Church’s and Kleene’s, for that matter) escape the problem of omniscience?  One straightforward answer is that, unlike the set of true sentences in some formal language, which is only countably infinite, the set of functions \(f:\mathbb{N}\rightarrow\mathbb{N}\) is uncountably infinite.  And therefore, even if we define the “efficiently-computable” functions \(f:\mathbb{N}\rightarrow\mathbb{N}\) by taking a countably-infinite logical closure, we are sure to miss some functions \(f\) (in fact, almost all of them!).

上述观察提出了一种解决逻辑全知问题的一般策略。也就是说，我们可以拒绝根据代理人可以快速回答哪些单个问题来定义代理人的“知识”，而是坚持谈论代理人可以快速回答哪些无限的 问题系列。用口号的形式来说，我们希望“用无限来对抗全知”。

The observation above suggests a general strategy to tame the logical omniscience problem.  Namely, we could refuse to define an agent’s “knowledge” in terms of which individual questions she can quickly answer, and insist on speaking instead about which infinite families of questions she can quickly answer.  In slogan form, we want to “fight omniscience with infinity.”

让我们看看，通过这种方式，我们可以对本节前面讨论的知识难题给出半可信的答案。首先，你为什么可以“知道”1591=43×三十七，但同时 不“知道”1591，当我们说知道这些问题的答案时，我们实际上是指知道 如何回答这些问题。正如我们所看到的，即使我们将你对算法的知识建模为演绎封闭的，知道快速乘法算法而不知道快速因式分解算法也并不会有任何矛盾 。换句话说，通过将这两个问题嵌入

Let’s see how, by taking this route, we can give semi-plausible answers to the puzzles about knowledge discussed earlier in this section.  First, the reason why you can “know” that \(1591=43\times37\), but at the same time not “know”  the prime factors of \(1591\), is that, when we speak about knowing the answers to these questions, we really mean knowing how to answer them.  And as we saw, there need not be any contradiction in knowing a fast multiplication algorithm but not a fast factoring algorithm, even if we model your knowledge about algorithms as deductively closed.  To put it another way, by embedding the two questions

Q1 = “是1591=43×三十七“‘啊？’

Q2 = “1591“‘啊？’

Q1 = “Is \(1591=43\times37\)?”

Q2 = “What are the prime factors of \(1591\) ?”

分解成无限多个相关问题，我们就可以打破回答这些问题所需的知识之间的对称性。

into infinite families of related questions, we can break the symmetry between the knowledge entailed in answering them.

类似地，我们可以认为一个孩子拥有一种内部算法，给定任何形式的陈述十+是=是+十 （对于具体十 和是 值），立即输出 true，甚至没有检查十和是。然而，孩子还没有能力处理量化的陈述，例如“∀十，是∈R  十+是=是+十”从这个意义上说，她仍然缺乏加法是交换的明确知识。

Similarly, we could think of a child as possessing an internal algorithm which, given any statement of the form \(x+y=y+x\) (for specific \(x\) and \(y\) values), immediately outputs true, without even examining \(x\) and \(y\).  However, the child does not yet have the ability to process quantified statements, such as “\(\forall x,y\in\mathbb{R}~~x+y=y+x\).”  In that sense, she still lacks the explicit knowledge that addition is commutative.

尽管上面概述的逻辑全知的“治疗方法”解决了一些难题，但毫不奇怪，它本身也引发了许多难题。所以，让我通过讨论对“无限疗法”的三个主要反对意见来结束本节。

Although the “cure” for logical omniscience sketched above solves some puzzles, not surprisingly it raises many puzzles of its own.  So let me end this section by discussing three major objections to the “infinity cure.”

第一个反对意见是，我们只是把逻辑全知的问题推到了别处。假设一个代理“知道”如何计算某些受限类中的每个函数，例如计划生育那么我们如何理解智能体学习新算法的过程呢？  一个自然的反应是，即使你有计算函数的“潜在能力”，f∈计划生育你可能不知道你有这个能力——要么是因为你不知道一个合适的算法，要么是因为你确实知道一个算法，但不知道它是一个算法f当然，如果我们想追根溯源，我们接下来需要讲述一个关于算法知识的故事，以及如何在那里避免逻辑全知。然而，我认为这代表着进步！请注意，即使没有这样的故事，我们已经可以解释逻辑全知的一些失败。例如，你不知道大数的因数的原因可能不是你不知道快速分解因式的方法，而是不存在这种方法。
