The first objection is that we’ve simply pushed the problem of logical omniscience somewhere else.  For suppose an agent “ knows” how to compute every function in some restricted class such as \(\mathsf{FP}\).  Then how can we ever make sense of the agent learning a new algorithm?  One natural response is that, even if you have the “latent ability” to compute a function \(f\in\mathsf{FP}\), you might not know that you have the ability—either because you don’t know a suitable algorithm, or because you do know an algorithm, but don’t know that it’s an algorithm for \(f\).  Of course, if we wanted to pursue things to the bottom, we’d next need to tell a story about knowledge of algorithms, and how logical omniscience is avoided there.  However, I claim that this represents progress!  For notice that, even without such a story, we can already explain some failures of logical omniscience.  For example, the reason why you don’t know the factors of a large number might not be your ignorance of a fast factoring method, but rather that no such method exists.

第二个反对意见是，当我主张关注无限的问题家族而不是孤立的单个问题时，我从未具体说明是哪些无限的家族。困难在于，同一个问题可以用截然不同的方式概括。例如，考虑这个问题

The second objection is that, when I advocated focusing on infinite families of questions rather than single questions in isolation, I never specified which infinite families.  The difficulty is that the same question could be generalized in wildly different ways.  As an example, consider the question

Q = “是432，150 合成的？”

Q = “Is \(432,150\) composite?”

Q 是人类认为非常困难的计算问题的一个例子：“给定一个大整数否， 是 否复合吗？”然而，Q 也是人类发现非常容易计算的一个例子：“给定一个大整数否 结束于 0， 是否复合材料？”事实上，如果一个人注意到432，150结尾于0，但不是其他情况。对我来说，这个例子表明，如果我们想从诸如 Q 之类的个别问题的角度来讨论代理的知识，那么相关的问题将是是否存在Q 的泛化 G，使得代理知道回答类型 G 问题的快速算法，并且还认识到 Q 属于类型 G。

Q is an instance of a computational problem that humans find very hard: “given a large integer \(N\), is \(N\) composite?”  However, Q is also an instance of a computational problem that humans find very easy: “given a large integer \(N\) ending in \(0\), is \(N\) composite?”   And indeed, we’d expect a person to know the answer to Q if she noticed that \(432,150\) ends in \(0\), but not otherwise.  To me, what this example demonstrates is that, if we want to discuss an agent’s knowledge in terms of individual questions such as Q, then the relevant issue will be whether there exists a generalization G of Q, such that the agent knows a fast algorithm for answering questions of type G, and also recognizes that Q is of type G.

第三个反对意见只是关于渐近复杂性和有限语句之间关系的标准反对意见。例如，如果我们使用科巴姆公理来建模代理的知识，那么我们确实可以解释为什么代理不知道如何在一个n×n 板，用于任意 值的n. 32  但按照标准8×8 棋盘上，完美下棋“仅仅”需要（比如说）∼1060计算步骤，这是一个常数，因此肯定是多项式！那么严格地根据科巴姆公理，我们能提供什么解释来解释为什么一个知道规则的理性主体8×8下国际象棋，却不知道如何以最佳方式下棋？虽然这种反对意见听起来可能很具破坏性，但重要的是要理解，它与通常针对复杂性理论论证的反对意见没有什么不同，并且可以给出通常的回应。即： 如果常数因子被证明是荒谬的， 渐近陈述总是容易变得无关紧要。然而，经验表明，无论出于何种原因，这种情况很少发生，因此人们通常可以将渐近行为视为“具有解释力，直到证明相反为止”。（第[CONC]节将更多地讨论渐近主张的解释力，这是一个需要哲学分析的问题。）

The third objection is just the standard one about the relationship between asymptotic complexity and finite statements.  For example, if we model an agent’s knowledge using the Cobham axioms, then we can indeed explain why the agent doesn’t know how to play perfect chess on an \(n\times n\) board, for arbitrary values of \(n\).32  But on a standard \(8\times 8\) board, playing perfect chess would “ merely” require (say) \(\sim10^{60}\) computational steps, which is a constant, and therefore certainly polynomial!  So strictly on the basis of the Cobham axioms, what explanation could we possibly offer for why a rational agent, who knew the rules of \(8\times8\) chess, didn’t also know how to play it optimally?  While this objection might sound devastating, it’s important to understand that it’s no different from the usual objection leveled against complexity-theoretic arguments, and can be given the usual response.  Namely: asymptotic statements are always vulnerable to being rendered irrelevant, if the constant factors turned out to be ridiculous.  However, experience has shown that, for whatever reasons, that happens rarely enough that one can usually take asymptotic behavior as “having explanatory force until proven otherwise.”  (Section [CONC] will say more about the explanatory force of asymptotic claims, as a problem requiring philosophical analysis.)

概括

Summary

由于第[OMNIINF]节中指出的困难，我个人认为计算复杂性理论尚未接近“解决”逻辑全知问题，即无法给出令人满意的形式化知识解释，同时又不能避免做出荒谬的预测。我不知道这样的解释是否有可能。33但是  ，我在本节中试图表明，复杂性理论提供了一个明确定义的“极限情况”，其中逻辑全知问题是 可解的，并且几乎和人们希望的一样好。极限情况是问题的规模无限增长，而那里的解由科巴姆公理给出：“知道如何的公理”，人们可以接受其逻辑闭包而不会因此而导致全知。

Because of the difficulties pointed out in Section [OMNIINF], my own view is that computational complexity theory has not yet come close to “solving” the logical omniscience problem, in the sense of giving a satisfying formal account of knowledge that also avoids making absurd predictions.  I have no idea whether such an account is even possible.33  However, what I’ve tried to show in this section is that complexity theory provides a well-defined “limiting case”  where the logical omniscience problem is solvable, about as well as one could hope it to be.  The limiting case is where the size of the questions grows without bound, and the solution there is given by the Cobham axioms: “axioms of knowing how” whose logical closure one can take without thereby inviting omniscience.

换句话说，当我们思考全知问题时，我认为我们处在一种与物理学中经常遇到的情况类似的境地——我们可能无法理解某些现象（例如引力熵），除非是黑洞等极端情况。在认识论中，就像在物理学中一样，我们或多或少理解的极端情况 为那些希望解决一般情况的人提供了一个明显的起点。

In other words, when we contemplate the omniscience problem, I claim that we’re in a situation similar to one often faced in physics—where we might be at a loss to understand some phenomenon (say, gravitational entropy), except in limiting cases such as black holes.  In epistemology just like in physics, the limiting cases that we do more-or-less understand offer an obvious starting point for those wishing to tackle the general case.

计算主义和瀑布

Computationalism and Waterfalls

在过去的二十年里，心灵哲学家们广泛讨论了关于计算的某个论证——我称之为瀑布论证。34  就像塞尔著名的中文房间论证一样中，瀑布论证试图表明计算“本质上是句法的”，并且永远不可能“关于”任何事情——因此，“计算主义”学说是错误的。35但  与中文房间不同，瀑布论证通过进一步的主张补充了对直觉的单纯诉求：即计算的“含义”，无论它具有什么程度，总是 与某个外部观察者有关。

Over the past two decades, a certain argument about computation—which I’ll call the waterfall argument—has been widely discussed by philosophers of mind.34  Like Searle’s famous Chinese Room argument , the waterfall argument seeks to show that computations are “inherently syntactic,”  and can never be “about” anything—and that for this reason, the doctrine of “ computationalism” is false.35  But unlike the Chinese Room, the waterfall argument supplements the bare appeal to intuition by a further claim: namely, that the “ meaning” of a computation, to whatever extent it has one, is always relative to some external observer.

更具体地说，考虑一个瀑布（尽管任何其他具有足够大状态空间的物理系统也可以）。这里我指的不是专门为执行计算而设计的瀑布，而是一个真正自然发生的瀑布：比如尼亚加拉瀑布。受物理定律支配，瀑布实现了一些映射f 从一组可能的初始状态到一组可能的最终状态。如果我们接受物理定律是可逆的，那么f也必须是单射。现在假设我们将注意力限制在某个有限子集上年代可能的初始状态，|年代|=n。 然后f只是一对一映射年代 到某个输出集电视=f（年代） 和|电视|=n。现在的“关键观察”是：给定任何排列σ 来自整数集{1，…，n} 有一些方法可以标记元素年代和电视通过整数{1，…，n}，这样我们就可以解释f 作为实施 σ。例如，如果我们让 年代={s1，…，sn} 和f（s我）=吨我，那么标记初始状态就足够了s我 经过我以及最终状态吨我 经过σ（我）.但排列σ 可以具有我们喜欢的任何“语义”：它可能代表一个下棋的程序，或分解整数，或模拟不同的瀑布。因此，“单纯的计算”不能产生语义意义。以下是 Searle 的说法 表达结论：

More concretely, consider a waterfall (though any other physical system with a large enough state space would do as well).  Here I do not mean a waterfall that was specially engineered to perform computations, but really a naturally-occurring waterfall: say, Niagara Falls.  Being governed by laws of physics, the waterfall implements some mapping \(f\) from a set of possible initial states to a set of possible final states.  If we accept that the laws of physics are reversible, then \(f\) must also be injective.  Now suppose we restrict attention to some finite subset \(S\) of possible initial states, with \(\left\vert S\right\vert =n\).  Then \(f\) is just a one-to-one mapping from \(S\) to some output set \(T=f\left( S\right)\) with \(\left\vert T\right\vert =n\).  The “crucial observation” is now this: given any permutation \(\sigma\) from the set of integers \(\left\{ 1,\ldots,n\right\}\) to itself, there is some way to label the elements of \(S\) and \(T\) by integers in \(\left\{ 1,\ldots,n\right\}\), such that we can interpret \(f\) as implementing \(\sigma\).  For example, if we let \(S=\left\{ s_{1}% ,\ldots,s_{n}\right\}\) and \(f\left( s_{i}\right) =t_{i}\), then it suffices to label the initial state \(s_{i}\) by \(i\) and the final state \(t_{i}\) by \(\sigma\left( i\right)\).  But the permutation \(\sigma\) could have any “semantics” we like: it might represent a program for playing chess, or factoring integers, or simulating a different waterfall.  Therefore “mere computation” cannot give rise to semantic meaning.  Here is how Searle expresses the conclusion:

如果我们始终采用图灵测试或其他“客观”标准来判断智能行为，那么诸如“非智能物质能产生智能行为吗？”甚至“它们究竟是如何做到的”等问题的答案就显而易见了。任何恒温器、袖珍计算器或瀑布都会产生“智能行为”，而且我们都知道它们是如何工作的。某些人工制品被设计成表现得像智能一样，而且由于一切都遵循自然法则，所以一切都会有一些描述，在这些描述下，它们表现得像智能一样。但这种“智能行为”的意义与心理学毫无关系。

If we are consistent in adopting the Turing test or some other “objective” criterion for intelligent behavior, then the answer to such questions as “Can unintelligent bits of matter produce intelligent behavior?”  and even, “How exactly do they do it” are ludicrously obvious.  Any thermostat, pocket calculator, or waterfall produces “intelligent behavior,” and we know in each case how it works.  Certain artifacts are designed to behave as if they were intelligent, and since everything follows laws of nature, then everything will have some description under which it behaves as if it were intelligent.  But this sense of “intelligent behavior” is of no psychological relevance at all.

瀑布论证因多种原因而受到批评：参见 Haugeland， 堵塞 尤其是查尔默斯（他通过证明蛋糕配方仅仅是句法的，永远不会产生易碎的语义属性来讽刺该论点。）但在我看来，推翻瀑布论证的最简单方法可能是通过计算复杂性的考虑。

The waterfall argument has been criticized on numerous grounds: see Haugeland , Block , and especially Chalmers (who parodied the argument by proving that a cake recipe, being merely syntactic, can never give rise to the semantic attribute of crumbliness).  To my mind, though, perhaps the easiest way to demolish the waterfall argument is through computational complexity considerations.

事实上，假设我们真的想用瀑布来帮助我们计算棋步。我们该怎么做呢？从复杂性的角度来看，我们想要的是将国际象棋问题简化为瀑布模拟问题。也就是说，我们想要一种有效的算法，以某种方式编码国际象棋的位置磷进入初始状态s磷∈年代瀑布，这样一个很好的举动磷可以从瀑布对应的最终状态中高效地读出， f（s磷）∈电视36  但这样的算法会是什么样子的呢？我们  无法肯定地说——当然，在没有详细了解的情况下f （即瀑布的物理学），以及年代和电视 元素被编码为二进制字符串。但对于任何合理的选择，任何简化算法都极有可能只解决国际象棋问题本身，而根本不使用瀑布！更准确地说，我推测，给定任何国际象棋算法 一个 访问“瀑布式预言机” 西有一个同样优秀的国际象棋算法一个′具有相似的时间和空间要求，无法访问 西如果这个猜想成立，那么它就为我们提供了一种完全独立于观察者的方法来形式化我们的直觉，即瀑布的“语义”与国际象棋无关。37

Indeed, suppose we actually wanted to use a waterfall to help us calculate chess moves.  How would we do that?  In complexity terms, what we want is a reduction from the chess problem to the waterfall-simulation problem.  That is, we want an efficient algorithm that somehow encodes a chess position \(P\) into an initial state \(s_{P}\in S\) of the waterfall, in such a way that a good move from \(P\) can be read out efficiently from the waterfall’s corresponding final state, \(f\left( s_{P}\right) \in T\).36  But what would such an algorithm look like?  We cannot say for sure—certainly not without detailed knowledge about \(f\) (i.e., the physics of waterfalls), as well as the means by which the \(S\) and \(T\) elements are encoded as binary strings.  But for any reasonable choice, it seems overwhelmingly likely that any reduction algorithm would just solve the chess problem itself, without using the waterfall in an essential way at all!  A bit more precisely, I conjecture that, given any chess-playing algorithm \(A\) that accesses a “ waterfall oracle” \(W\), there is an equally-good chess-playing algorithm \(A^{\prime}\), with similar time and space requirements, that does not access \(W\).  If this conjecture holds, then it gives us a perfectly observer-independent way to formalize our intuition that the “semantics” of waterfalls have nothing to do with chess.37

一切皆有可能的“减量”

“Reductions” That Do All The Work

有趣的是，“平凡”或“退化”归约的问题也出现在复杂性理论中，因此看看它在那里是如何处理的可能会很有启发。回想一下第[ENTSCH]节 ，一个问题是名词解释-完整的，如果，宽泛地说，它是“所有中最困难的名词解释问题” (名词解释是可以在多项式时间内检查其解的一类问题）。更正式地说，我们说大号是名词解释-完成如果

Interestingly, the issue of “trivial” or “degenerate” reductions also arises within complexity theory, so it might be instructive to see how it is handled there.  Recall from Section [ENTSCH] that a problem is \(\mathsf{NP}\)-complete if, loosely speaking, it is “ maximally hard among all \(\mathsf{NP}\) problems”  (\(\mathsf{NP}\) being the class of problems for which solutions can be checked in polynomial time).  More formally, we say that \(L\) is \(\mathsf{NP}\)-complete if

  1. 大号∈名词解释， 和

  2. \(L\in\mathsf{NP}\), and

  3. 给定任何其他 名词解释 问题大号′，存在一个多项式时间算法来求解大号′使用访问解决的预言机大号（或者更简洁地说， 大号′∈磷大号， 在哪里磷大号 表示复杂度类别磷 增强了 大号-神谕。

  4. given any other \(\mathsf{NP}\) problem \(L^{\prime}\), there exists a polynomial-time algorithm to solve \(L^{\prime}\) using access to an oracle that solves \(L\).  (Or more succinctly, \(L^{\prime}\in\mathsf{P}% ^{L}\), where \(\mathsf{P}^{L}\) denotes the complexity class \(\mathsf{P}%\) augmented by an \(L\)-oracle.)

概念名词解释-完备性具有令人难以置信的解释力：它表明，物理学、生物学、工业优化、数理逻辑和其他领域的数千个看似不相关的问题从多项式时间计算的角度来看都是 相同的，并且除非 磷=名词解释因此，理论计算机科学家很自然地想要定义一个类似的概念磷- 完整性。换句话说：在所有可以在多项式时间内解决的问题中，哪些是“最大难度”的？

The concept of \(\mathsf{NP}\)-completeness had incredible explanatory power: it showed that thousands of seemingly-unrelated problems from physics, biology, industrial optimization, mathematical logic, and other fields were all identical from the standpoint of polynomial-time computation, and that not one of these problems had an efficient solution unless \(\mathsf{P}% =\mathsf{NP}\).  Thus, it was natural for theoretical computer scientists to want to define an analogous concept of \(\mathsf{P}\)-completeness.  In other words: among all the problems that are solvable in polynomial time, which ones are “maximally hard”?

但应该如何磷完备性如何定义？为了理解其中的困难，我们假设，通过类比名词解释-完整性，我们说 大号 是磷-完成如果

But how should \(\mathsf{P}\)-completeness even be defined?  To see the difficulty, suppose that, by analogy with \(\mathsf{NP}\)-completeness, we say that \(L\) is \(\mathsf{P}\)-complete if

  1. 大号∈磷和

  2. \(L\in\mathsf{P}\) and

  3. 大号′∈磷大号 对于每一个 大号′∈磷。

  4. \(L^{\prime}\in\mathsf{P}^{L}\) for every \(L^{\prime}\in\mathsf{P}\).

那么很容易看出第二个条件是空的： 每个 磷 问题是磷-完成！因为在“减少” 大号′ 到大号，多项式时间算法总是可以忽略大号-oracle 和解决方案 大号′ 就像我们假设的忽略瀑布预言的国际象棋程序一样。因此，条件 (ii) 必须用更强的条件代替；一个流行的选择是

Then it is easy to see that the second condition is vacuous: every \(\mathsf{P}\) problem is \(\mathsf{P}\)-complete!  For in “ reducing” \(L^{\prime}\) to \(L\), a polynomial-time algorithm can always just ignore the \(L\)-oracle and solve \(L^{\prime}\) by itself, much like our hypothetical chess program that ignored its waterfall oracle.  Because of this, condition (ii) must be replaced by a stronger condition; one popular choice is

  1. 大号′∈物流空间大号 对于每一个大号′∈磷。

  2. \(L^{\prime}\in\mathsf{LOGSPACE}^{L}\) for every \(L^{\prime}% \in\mathsf{P}\).

这里物流空间 非正式地，是指由具有读/写存储器的确定性图灵机可以解决的一类问题，该存储器仅由日志⁡n 位，给定大小的输入n. 38  不难证明物流空间⊆磷，并且这种遏制被认为是严格的（尽管就像磷≠名词解释，目前还没有证据）。关键点在于，如果我们想要一个 非空洞的完整性概念，那么降低复杂度的类需要比被降低到的类更弱（无论是可证明的还是推测的）。事实上，复杂度类甚至比物流空间 在实践中几乎总是足够的。

Here \(\mathsf{LOGSPACE}\) means, informally, the class of problems solvable by a deterministic Turing machine with a read/write memory consisting of only \(\log n\) bits, given an input of size \(n\).38  It’s not hard to show that \(\mathsf{LOGSPACE}\subseteq\mathsf{P}\), and this containment is strongly believed to be strict (though just like with \(\mathsf{P}\neq\mathsf{NP}\), there is no proof yet).  The key point is that, if we want a non-vacuous notion of completeness, then the reducing complexity class needs to be weaker (either provably or conjecturally) than the class being reduced to.  In fact complexity classes even smaller than \(\mathsf{LOGSPACE}\) almost always suffice in practice.

在我看来，这对于计算主义的辩论来说是一个重要的教训。例如，假设我们想要声称，下棋的计算与模拟瀑布的其他计算“等价”。那么，只有当有可能在一个计算模型中展示等价性（即给出简化）时，我们的主张才是非空洞的，而这个模型本身并不足以解决国际象棋或瀑布问题。

In my view, there is an important lesson here for debates about computationalism.  Suppose we want to claim, for example, that a computation that plays chess is “equivalent” to some other computation that simulates a waterfall.  Then our claim is only non-vacuous if it’s possible to exhibit the equivalence (i.e., give the reductions) within a model of computation that isn’t itself powerful enough to solve the chess or waterfall problems.

PAC 学习和归纳问题

PAC-Learning and the Problem of Induction

几个世纪前，大卫休谟著名学者指出，从过去（以及科学）中学习似乎在逻辑上是不可能的。例如，如果我们抽样500乌鸦，而且每一只都是黑色的，为什么这能给我们任何 理由——甚至是概率理由——来期待501s吨 乌鸦也是黑色的吗？对这个问题的任何现代答案可能都会参考奥卡姆剃刀原理，即与数据一致的更简单的假设更有可能是正确的原理。例如，所有乌鸦都是黑色的假设比大多数乌鸦是绿色或紫色的假设“更简单”，并且只有500我们碰巧看到的是黑色的。直观地看，奥卡姆剃刀似乎一定是休谟问题解决方案的一部分；困难在于，这样的回答本身就引出了问题：

Centuries ago, David Hume famously pointed out that learning from the past (and, by extension, science) seems logically impossible.  For example, if we sample \(500\) ravens and every one of them is black, why does that give us any grounds—even probabilistic grounds—for expecting the \(501^{st}\) raven to be black also?  Any modern answer to this question would probably refer to Occam’s razor, the principle that simpler hypotheses consistent with the data are more likely to be correct.  So for example, the hypothesis that all ravens are black is “ simpler” than the hypothesis that most ravens are green or purple, and that only the \(500\) we happened to see were black.  Intuitively, it seems Occam’s razor must be part of the solution to Hume’s problem; the difficulty is that such a response leads to questions of its own:

  1. 我们所说的“更简单”是什么意思？

  2. What do we mean by “simpler”?

  3. 为什么简单的解释可能是正确的？或者，更直白地说：现实必须具备哪些属性才能让奥卡姆剃刀“发挥作用”？

  4. Why are simple explanations likely to be correct?  Or, less ambitiously: what properties must reality have for Occam’s Razor to “work”?

  5. 我们必须收集多少数据才能找到可能预测未来数据的“简单假设”？我们如何找到这样的假设？

  6. How much data must we collect before we can find a “simple hypothesis” that will probably predict future data?  How do we go about finding such a hypothesis?

在我看来，由 Leslie Valiant 发起的PAC（概率近似正确）学习理论 1984 年，在所有这些问题上都取得了足够大的进展，值得任何对归纳法感兴趣的人研究。39在  这个理论中，我们考虑一个理想化的“学习者”，向他展示要点十1，…，十米 从某个大集合中随机抽取年代以及“分类” f（十1），…，f（十米）这些点。学习者的目标是推断函数f，足以预测 f（十） 对于大多数 未来点十∈年代举个例子，学习者可能是一家银行，年代 可能是一组人（由他们的信用历史表示），并且f（十） 可能代表一个人十 将拖欠贷款。

In my view, the theory of PAC (Probabilistically Approximately Correct) Learning, initiated by Leslie Valiant  in 1984, has made large enough advances on all of these questions that it deserves to be studied by anyone interested in induction.39  In this theory, we consider an idealized “ learner,” who is presented with points \(x_{1},\ldots,x_{m}%\) drawn randomly from some large set \(\mathcal{S}\), together with the “classifications” \(f\left( x_{1}\right) ,\ldots,f\left( x_{m}\right)\) of those points.  The learner’s goal is to infer the function \(f\), well enough to be able to predict \(f\left( x\right)\) for most future points \(x\in\mathcal{S}\).  As an example, the learner might be a bank, \(\mathcal{S}\) might be a set of people (represented by their credit histories), and \(f\left( x\right)\) might represent whether or not person \(x\) will default on a loan.

为了简单起见，我们通常假设年代 是一组二进制字符串，并且函数f每个地图 十∈年代 对于单个比特， f（十）∈{0，1}。这两个假设都可以被删除，而不会对理论产生重大影响。重要的假设如下：

For simplicity, we often assume that \(\mathcal{S}\) is a set of binary strings, and that the function \(f\) maps each \(x\in\mathcal{S}\) to a single bit, \(f\left( x\right) \in\left\{ 0,1\right\}\).  Both assumptions can be removed without significantly changing the theory.  The important assumptions are the following:

  1. 每个样本点十1，…，十米独立于某些（可能未知的）“样本分布”  得出 德超过 年代. 此外，未来点十学习者需要预测f（十）来自同一分布。

  2. Each of the sample points \(x_{1},\ldots,x_{m}\) is drawn independently from some (possibly-unknown) “sample distribution” \(\mathcal{D}\) over \(\mathcal{S}\).  Furthermore, the future points \(x\) on which the learner will need to predict \(f\left( x\right)\) are drawn from the same distribution.

  3. 函数f 属于已知的“假设类” 赫。 这赫表示“学习者愿意接受的可能性的集合”（通常比所有可能性的集合小得多）。2|年代| 可能的功能来自年代 到{0，1}）。

  4. The function \(f\) belongs to a known “hypothesis class” \(\mathcal{H}\).  This \(\mathcal{H}\) represents “the set of possibilities the learner is willing to entertain” (and is typically much smaller than the set of all \(2^{\left\vert \mathcal{S}\right\vert }\) possible functions from \(\mathcal{S}\) to \(\left\{ 0,1\right\}\)).

基于这些假设，我们得到以下核心结果。

Under these assumptions, we have the following central result.

定理 2（Valiant）。考虑一个有限假设类赫，布尔函数f：年代→{0，1}在赫以及样本分布 德超过年代以及错误率 ε>0和失败概率δ>0学习者愿意容忍的假设。时长：年代→{0，1} “好”如果普尔十∼德[时长（十）=f（十）]≥1−ε。另外，调用样本点十1，…，十米 任何假设都是“可靠的”时长∈赫 满足时长（十我）=f（十我） 面向所有人我∈{1，…，米} 很好。然后米=1ε在⁡|赫|δ采样点十1，…，十米 独立绘制德 至少有概率是可靠的1−δ。

Theorem 2 (Valiant ). Consider a finite hypothesis class \(\mathcal{H}\), a Boolean function \(f:\mathcal{S}\rightarrow\left\{ 0,1\right\}\) in \(\mathcal{H}\), and a sample distribution \(\mathcal{D}\) over \(\mathcal{S}\), as well as an error rate \(\varepsilon>0\) and failure probability \(\delta>0\) that the learner is willing to tolerate.  Call a hypothesis \(h:\mathcal{S}\rightarrow\left\{ 0,1\right\}\) “ good” if \[\Pr_{x\sim\mathcal{D}}\left[ h\left( x\right) =f\left( x\right) \right] \geq1-\varepsilon.\] Also, call sample points \(x_{1},\ldots,x_{m}\) “ reliable” if any hypothesis \(h\in\mathcal{H}\) that satisfies \(h\left( x_{i}\right) =f\left( x_{i}\right)\) for all \(i\in\left\{ 1,\ldots,m\right\}\) is good.  Then \[m=\frac{1}{\varepsilon}\ln\frac{\left\vert \mathcal{H}\right\vert }{\delta}%\] sample points \(x_{1},\ldots,x_{m}\) drawn independently from \(\mathcal{D}%\) will be reliable with probability at least \(1-\delta\).

直观地看，定理2表明f在少数随机选择的点上的行为可能决定了它在大多数剩余点上的行为。换句话说，如果通过某种未指定的方式，学习者设法找到任何假设时长∈赫 对所有过去数据点做出正确预测十1，…，十米，则提供米足够大（而且碰巧的是，米不需要很大），学习器可以在统计上确信时长也会对大多数未来点做出正确的预测。

Intuitively, Theorem 2 says that the behavior of \(f\) on a small number of randomly-chosen points probably determines its behavior on most of the remaining points.  In other words, if, by some unspecified means, the learner manages to find any hypothesis \(h\in \mathcal{H}\) that makes correct predictions on all its past data points \(x_{1},\ldots,x_{m}\), then provided \(m\) is large enough (and as it happens, \(m\) doesn’t need to be very large), the learner can be statistically confident that \(h\) will also make the correct predictions on most future points.

定理2中带有复杂性理论明显印记的部分 是样本大小的界限，米≥1ε在⁡|赫|δ。这一界限有三个显著的含义。首先，即使类赫 包含大量假设（例如，2n），仍然可以学习任意函数f∈赫 使用线性 数量的样本数据，因为米 仅随对数增长|赫|：换句话说，就像写下一个假设所需的位数。其次，我们可以得出假设的概率时长 无法推广到 指数级小的领域（比如，δ=2−n）以增加样本量为代价米仅受线性因素的影响。第三，假设该假设确实具有普遍性，其错误率ε 与米。不难证明这些依赖关系都是紧密的，例如，如果我们要求ε=0 或者δ=0 那么没有有限米就足够了。这就是“PAC-learning”这个名字的由来：人们所能期望的最多就是输出一个“可能、近似”正确的假设。

The part of Theorem 2 that bears the unmistakable imprint of complexity theory is the bound on sample size, \(m\geq\frac{1}{\varepsilon}% \ln\frac{\left\vert \mathcal{H}\right\vert }{\delta}\).  This bound has three notable implications.  First, even if the class \(\mathcal{H}\) contains exponentially many hypotheses (say, \(2^{n}\)), one can still learn an arbitrary function \(f\in\mathcal{H}\) using a linear amount of sample data, since \(m\) grows only logarithmically with \(\left\vert \mathcal{H}\right\vert\): in other words, like the number of bits needed to write down an individual hypothesis.  Second, one can make the probability that the hypothesis \(h\) will fail to generalize exponentially small (say, \(\delta=2^{-n}\)), at the cost of increasing the sample size \(m\) by only a linear factor.  Third, assuming the hypothesis does generalize, its error rate \(\varepsilon\) decreases inversely with \(m\).  It is not hard to show that each of these dependencies is tight, so that for example, if we demand either \(\varepsilon=0\) or \(\delta=0\) then no finite \(m\) suffices.  This is the origin of the name “ PAC-learning”: the most one can hope for is to output a hypothesis that is “probably, approximately” correct.

定理2的证明很简单：考虑任何假设时长∈赫这很糟糕，这意味着普尔十∼德[时长（十）=f（十）]<1−ε。然后根据独立假设， 普尔十1，…，十米∼德[时长（十1）=f（十1）∧⋯∧时长（十米）=f（十米）]<（1−ε）米。 现在，错误假设的数量不超过假设的总数，|赫|。因此，根据联合约束，存在一个与f 在所有十1，…，十米 最多可以|赫|⋅（1−ε）米。 所以δ≤|赫|⋅（1−ε）米，剩下的就是求解米。

The proof of Theorem 2 is easy: consider any hypothesis \(h\in\mathcal{H}\) that is bad, meaning that \[\Pr_{x\sim\mathcal{D}}\left[ h\left( x\right) =f\left( x\right) \right] <1-\varepsilon.\] Then by the independence assumption, \[\Pr_{x_{1},\ldots,x_{m}\sim\mathcal{D}}\left[ h\left( x_{1}\right) =f\left( x_{1}\right) \wedge\cdots\wedge h\left( x_{m}\right) =f\left( x_{m}\right) \right] <\left( 1-\varepsilon\right) ^{m}.\] Now, the number of bad hypotheses is no more than the total number of hypotheses, \(\left\vert \mathcal{H}\right\vert\).  So by the union bound, the probability that there exists a bad hypothesis that agrees with \(f\) on all of \(x_{1},\ldots,x_{m}\) can be at most \(\left\vert \mathcal{H}% \right\vert \cdot\left( 1-\varepsilon\right) ^{m}\).  Therefore \(\delta \leq\left\vert \mathcal{H}\right\vert \cdot\left( 1-\varepsilon\right) ^{m}%\), and all that remains is to solve for \(m\).

定理2与休谟归纳法问题的相关性 在于，该定理描述了一类非平凡的情况，在这些情况下，归纳法 保证以高概率起作用。定理2 还阐明了奥卡姆剃刀在归纳法中的作用。为了使用“合理”数量的样本点进行学习米，假设类赫 必须具有足够小的基数。但这相当于说每个假设时长∈赫 必须有一个简洁的描述——因为指定任意假设所需的位数时长∈赫只是⌈日志2⁡|赫|⌉。如果指定假设所需的位数太大，则赫总是容易受到过度拟合 问题的影响：一些假设时长∈赫 幸存下来并偶然接触样本数据。

The relevance of Theorem 2 to Hume’s problem of induction is that the theorem describes a nontrivial class of situations where induction is guaranteed to work with high probability.  Theorem 2 also illuminates the role of Occam’s Razor in induction.  In order to learn using a “reasonable” number of sample points \(m\), the hypothesis class \(\mathcal{H}\) must have a sufficiently small cardinality.  But that is equivalent to saying that every hypothesis \(h\in\mathcal{H}\) must have a succinct description—since the number of bits needed to specify an arbitrary hypothesis \(h\in\mathcal{H}\) is simply \(\left\lceil \log_{2}\left\vert \mathcal{H}\right\vert \right\rceil\).  If the number of bits needed to specify a hypothesis is too large, then \(\mathcal{H}\) will always be vulnerable to the problem of overfitting: some hypotheses \(h\in\mathcal{H}\) surviving contact with the sample data just by chance.

正如 Agustı́n Rayo 向我指出的那样，奥卡姆剃刀有几种可能的解释，这些解释与描述复杂性无关：例如，我们可能希望我们的假设在本体论或意识形态承诺方面“简单”。然而，无论我们在多大程度上将奥卡姆剃刀解释为 更短或更低复杂度的假设是可取的，定理2比人们想象的更接近于剃刀为何有效的数学依据。

As pointed out to me by Agustı́n Rayo, there are several possible interpretations of Occam’s Razor that have nothing to do with descriptive complexity: for example, we might want our hypotheses to be “ simple” in terms of their ontological or ideological commitments.  However, to whatever extent we interpret Occam’s Razor as saying that shorter or lower-complexity hypotheses are preferable, Theorem 2 comes closer than one might have thought possible to a mathematical justification for why the Razor works.

许多哲学家可能熟悉奥卡姆剃刀的其他形式化方法。例如，在贝叶斯框架内，人们可以选择所有可能假设的先验，从而赋予“更简单”假设更大的权重（例如，简单性是通过计算预测的最短程序的长度来衡量的）。然而，虽然 PAC 学习和贝叶斯方法是相关的，但 PAC 方法的优势在于只需要 对要考虑的假设进行定性决策，而不是对假设进行定量先验。给定假设类赫，然后可以寻求适用于任何 f∈赫（另一方面，PAC 方法需要对观测值的概率分布做出假设，而贝叶斯方法则不需要。）

Many philosophers might be familiar with alternative formal approaches to Occam’s Razor.  For example, within a Bayesian framework, one can choose a prior over all possible hypotheses that gives greater weight to “simpler” hypotheses (where simplicity is measured, for example, by the length of the shortest program that computes the predictions).  However, while the PAC-learning and Bayesian approaches are related, the PAC approach has the advantage of requiring only a qualitative decision about which hypotheses one wants to consider, rather than a quantitative prior over hypotheses.  Given the hypothesis class \(\mathcal{H}\), one can then seek learning methods that work for any \(f\in\mathcal{H}\).  (On the other hand, the PAC approach requires an assumption about the probability distribution over observations, while the Bayesian approach does not.)

基本 PAC 模型的缺点

Drawbacks of the Basic PAC Model

现在我想讨论一下定理2的三个缺点，因为我认为这些缺点和优点一样阐明了归纳法的哲学方面。

I’d now like to discuss three drawbacks of Theorem 2, since I think the drawbacks illuminate philosophical aspects of induction as well as the advantages do.

第一个缺点是定理2仅适用于 有限假设类。然而，在科学中，假设通常涉及连续参数，其中存在不可数的无穷大。当然，人们可以通过简单地离散化参数来解决这个问题，但假设的数量（以及定理2的相关性）将取决于离散化的精细程度。幸运的是，我们可以通过认识到学习者只关心两个假设之间的“差异”，因为它们会导致不同的预测，从而避免这种困难。这导致了VC 维  的基本概念 （以其创始人 Vapnik 和 Chervonenkis 命名） ）。

The first drawback is that Theorem 2 works only for finite hypothesis classes.  In science, however, hypotheses often involve continuous parameters, of which there is an uncountable infinity.  Of course, one could solve this problem by simply discretizing the parameters, but then the number of hypotheses (and therefore the relevance of Theorem 2) would depend on how fine the discretization was.  Fortunately, we can avoid such difficulties by realizing that the learner only cares about the “differences” between two hypotheses insofar as they lead to different predictions.  This leads to the fundamental notion of VC-dimension (after its originators, Vapnik and Chervonenkis ).

定义 3 (VC 维)。假设类 赫 破坏样本点{十1，…，十钾}⊆年代 如果对于所有2钾 可能的设置 时长（十1），…，时长（十钾），存在一个假设时长∈赫与这些设置兼容。然后调光（赫），VC 维赫，是最大的钾存在一个子集{十1，…，十钾}⊆年代 那 赫 破碎（或者如果不存在有限最大值，那么调光（赫）=∞）。

Definition 3 (VC-dimension). A hypothesis class \(\mathcal{H}\) shatters the sample points \(\left\{ x_{1},\ldots,x_{k}\right\} \subseteq\mathcal{S}\) if for all \(2^{k}\) possible settings of \(h\left( x_{1}\right) ,\ldots,h\left( x_{k}\right)\), there exists a hypothesis \(h\in\mathcal{H}\) compatible with those settings.  Then \(\operatorname*{VCdim}\left( \mathcal{H}\right)\), the VC-dimension of \(\mathcal{H}\), is the largest \(k\) for which there exists a subset \(\left\{ x_{1},\ldots,x_{k}\right\} \subseteq\mathcal{S}\) that \(\mathcal{H}\) shatters (or if no finite maximum exists, then \(\operatorname*{VCdim}\left( \mathcal{H}\right) =\infty\)).

显然，任何有限假设类都有有限的 VC 维数：事实上， 调光（赫）≤日志2⁡|赫|。然而，即使是无限假设类，如果“足够简单”，也可以具有有限的 VC 维数。例如，让赫是所有函数的类 时长一个，b：R→{0，1} 形式时长一个，b（十）={1如果 一个≤十≤b0否则。那么很容易检查调光（赫）=2。

Clearly any finite hypothesis class has finite VC-dimension: indeed, \(\operatorname*{VCdim}\left( \mathcal{H}\right) \leq\log_{2}\left\vert \mathcal{H}\right\vert\).  However, even an infinite hypothesis class can have finite VC-dimension if it is “sufficiently simple.”  For example, let \(\mathcal{H}\) be the class of all functions \(h_{a,b}:\mathbb{R}\rightarrow\left\{ 0,1\right\}\) of the form \[h_{a,b}\left( x\right) =\left\{ \begin{array} [c]{cc}% 1 & \text{if }a\leq x\leq b \\ 0 & \text{otherwise.} % \end{array} \right.\] Then it is easy to check that \(\operatorname*{VCdim}\left( \mathcal{H}% \right) =2\).

有了 VC 维的概念，我们可以对 Blumer 等人提出的 定理2进行强有力的（且更难证明的）概括。。

With the notion of VC-dimension in hand, we can state a powerful (and harder-to-prove!) generalization of Theorem 2, due to Blumer et al. .

定理 4（Blumer 等人 ）对于某些通用常数钾>0，界限米定理2中 的米=钾调光（赫）ε在⁡1δε，现在定理适用于任何假设类赫，有限或无限。

Theorem 4 (Blumer et al. ). For some universal constant \(K>0\), the bound on \(m\) in Theorem 2 can be replaced by \[m=\frac{K\operatorname*{VCdim}\left( \mathcal{H}\right) }{\varepsilon}% \ln\frac{1}{\delta\varepsilon},\] with the theorem now holding for any hypothesis class \(\mathcal{H}\), finite or infinite.

如果赫具有无限的 VC 维数，那么很容易构造一个概率分布 德 在采样点上，没有有限个 米 样本来自 德 足以 PAC 学习一个函数 f∈赫：人们确实处于休谟所描述的不幸境地，即根本没有理由预测下一只乌鸦将是黑色的。从某种意义上说，定理4 告诉我们，有限的 VC 维数是科学归纳的必要和充分条件。同样，定理4  也可以根据奥卡姆剃刀进行解释，此时 VC 维数的较小性起着简单性的作用。

If \(\mathcal{H}\) has infinite VC-dimension, then it is easy to construct a probability distribution \(\mathcal{D}\) over sample points such that no finite number \(m\) of samples from \(D\) suffices to PAC-learn a function \(f\in\mathcal{H}\): one really is in the unfortunate situation described by Hume, of having no grounds at all for predicting that the next raven will be black.  In some sense, then, Theorem 4 is telling us that finite VC-dimension is a necessary and sufficient condition for scientific induction to be possible.  Once again, Theorem 4  also has an interpretation in terms of Occam’s Razor, with the smallness of the VC-dimension now playing the role of simplicity.

定理2的第二个缺点 是它没有给我们提供如何找到假设的线索时长∈赫 与样本数据一致。它只是说，如果我们发现这样一个时长， 然后时长可能接近真相。这说明，即使在 PAC 学习设想的简单设置中，归纳也不能仅仅是看到足够的数据然后从中“概括”，因为可能需要大量计算才能找到合适的概括！事实上，根据 Kearns 和 Valiant 的工作我们现在知道，许多自然学习问题（例如，从随机的语法和不语法的句子例子中推断出常规或上下文无关语言的规则）在极强的意义上是计算困难的：

The second drawback of Theorem 2 is that it gives us no clues about how to find a hypothesis \(h\in\mathcal{H}\) consistent with the sample data.  All it says is that, if we find such an \(h\), then \(h\) will probably be close to the truth.  This illustrates that, even in the simple setup envisioned by PAC-learning, induction cannot be merely a matter of seeing enough data and then “ generalizing” from it, because immense computations might be needed to find a suitable generalization!  Indeed, following the work of Kearns and Valiant , we now know that many natural learning problems—as an example, inferring the rules of a regular or context-free language from random examples of grammatical and ungrammatical sentences—are computationally intractable in an extremely strong sense:

任何找到与数据一致的假设的多项式时间算法都意味着可以破解广泛使用的密码系统（如 RSA）的多项式时间算法！40

Any polynomial-time algorithm for finding a hypothesis consistent with the data would imply a polynomial-time algorithm for breaking widely-used cryptosystems such as RSA!40

密码学出现在上述陈述中绝非偶然。从某种意义上说，学习和密码学是“双重”问题：学习者希望在数据中发现模式，而密码学家希望生成 难以发现模式的数据。更具体地说，密码学中的基本原语之一称为伪随机函数族。这是一类可高效计算的布尔函数fs：{0，1}n→{0，1}，由一个短随机“种子”参数化 s，这些函数几乎 无法通过多项式时间算法与随机函数区分开来。在这里，我们设想，可能的区分算法可以查询函数fs关于各点十，并且它 知道来自s 到fs，所以只不知道种子s 本身。密码学中有强有力的证据表明伪随机函数家族存在：事实上，Goldreich、Goldwasser 和 Micali展示了如何从任何伪随机生成器开始构建一个（后者在[WONT]节中提到）。

The appearance of cryptography in the above statement is far from accidental.  In a sense that can be made precise, learning and cryptography are “dual” problems: a learner wants to find patterns in data, while a cryptographer wants to generate data whose patterns are hard to find.  More concretely, one of the basic primitives in cryptography is called a pseudorandom function family.  This is a family of efficiently-computable Boolean functions \(f_{s}:\left\{ 0,1\right\} ^{n}\rightarrow\left\{ 0,1\right\}\), parameterized by a short random “seed” \(s\), that are virtually indistinguishable from random functions by a polynomial-time algorithm.  Here, we imagine that the would-be distinguishing algorithm can query the function \(f_{s}\) on various points \(x\), and also that it knows the mapping from \(s\) to \(f_{s}\), and so is ignorant only of the seed \(s\) itself.  There is strong evidence in cryptography that pseudorandom function families exist: indeed, Goldreich, Goldwasser, and Micali showed how to construct one starting from any pseudorandom generator (the latter was mentioned in Section [WONT]).

现在，给定一个伪随机函数族{fs}，想象一个 PAC 学习者，其假设类赫 包括fs 所有可能的种子 s. 为学习者提供一些随机选择的样本点十1，…，十米∈{0，1}n以及fs 关于这些观点：fs（十1），…，fs（十米）有了这些“训练数据”，学习者的目标是弄清楚如何计算fs 从而预测fs（十） 关于新观点十，不在训练样本中的点。不幸的是，很容易看出，如果学习器能够做到这一点，那么它就能区分fs 从一个真正的随机函数中得出的——从而推翻了我们最初的假设{fs} 是伪随机的！我们的结论是，如果现代密码学的基本假设成立（特别是如果存在伪随机生成器），那么一定存在纯粹由于计算复杂性（而不是由于数据不足）而无法进行学习的情况。

Now, given a pseudorandom function family \(\left\{ f_{s}\right\}\), imagine a PAC-learner whose hypothesis class \(\mathcal{H}\) consists of \(f_{s}\) for all possible seeds \(s\).  The learner is provided some randomly-chosen sample points \(x_{1},\ldots,x_{m}\in\left\{ 0,1\right\} ^{n}\), together with the values of \(f_{s}\) on those points: \(f_{s}\left( x_{1}\right) ,\ldots ,f_{s}\left( x_{m}\right)\).  Given this “training data,” the learner’s goal is to figure out how to compute \(f_{s}\) for itself—and thereby predict the values of \(f_{s}\left( x\right)\) on new points \(x\), points not in the training sample.  Unfortunately, it’s easy to see that if the learner could do that, then it would thereby distinguish \(f_{s}\) from a truly random function—and thereby contradict our starting assumption that \(\left\{ f_{s}\right\}\) was pseudorandom!  Our conclusion is that, if the basic assumptions of modern cryptography hold (and in particular, if there exist pseudorandom generators), then there must be situations where learning is impossible purely because of computational complexity (and not because of insufficient data).

定理2的第三个缺点 是假设分布德 学习者接受测试的分布与抽取样本点的分布相同。在我看来，这是最严重的缺点，因为它告诉我们，PAC 学习模拟的是本科生通过解决去年的问题来备考的“学习”，或者雇主使用回归模型来识别成功雇佣的特征，或者密码分析员从明文和密文集合中破解密码的过程。然而，它并没有模拟爱因斯坦或西拉德的“学习”，他们预测的现象与迄今为止观察到的任何现象都不同。正如大卫·德意志在他最近的著作《无限的开始》中强调的那样 ，科学的目标不仅仅是总结观察结果，从而让我们对类似的观察结果做出预测。相反，目标是发现具有“影响力”的解释，这意味着能够预测即使在新的或假设的情况下会发生什么，比如太阳突然消失或量子计算机正在建造。在我看来，开发一个引人注目的解释学习数学模型——一个“对解释就像 PAC 模型对预测一样”的模型——是一个悬而未决的未解问题。41

The third drawback of Theorem 2 is the assumption that the distribution \(\mathcal{D}\) from which the learner is tested is the same as the distribution from which the sample points were drawn.  To me, this is the most serious drawback, since it tells us that PAC-learning models the “learning” performed by an undergraduate cramming for an exam by solving last year’s problems, or an employer using a regression model to identify the characteristics of successful hires, or a cryptanalyst breaking a code from a collection of plaintexts and ciphertexts.  It does not, however, model the “learning”  of an Einstein or a Szilard, making predictions about phenomena that are different in kind from anything yet observed.  As David Deutsch stresses in his recent book The Beginning of Infinity , the goal of science is not merely to summarize observations, and thereby let us make predictions about similar observations.  Rather, the goal is to discover explanations with “reach,” meaning the ability to predict what would happen even in novel or hypothetical situations, like the Sun suddenly disappearing or a quantum computer being built.  In my view, developing a compelling mathematical model of explanatory learning—a model that “is to explanation as the PAC model is to prediction”—is an outstanding open problem.41

计算复杂性、Bleen 和 Grue

Computational Complexity, Bleen, and Grue

1955 年，纳尔逊·古德曼 提出了他所谓的“新归纳之谜”，该谜题延续了奥卡姆剃刀对休谟最初的归纳问题的回答。在古德曼的谜题中，我们被要求考虑“所有绿宝石都是绿色的”这一假设。问题是，为什么我们支持 该假设，而不是以下替代方案，该方案与我们所有关于绿色绿宝石的证据同样相符？

In 1955, Nelson Goodman  proposed what he called the “new riddle of induction,” which survives the Occam’s Razor answer to Hume’s original induction problem.  In Goodman’s riddle, we are asked to consider the hypothesis “All emeralds are green.”  The question is, why do we favor that hypothesis over the following alternative, which is equally compatible with all our evidence of green emeralds?

“2030 年 1 月 1 日之前所有祖母绿都是绿色，之后则变成蓝色。”

“All emeralds are green before January 1, 2030, and then blue afterwards.”

显而易见的答案是，第二种假设增加了多余的复杂性，因此不受奥卡姆剃刀原则的青睐。对此，古德曼回答说，“简单”和“复杂”的定义取决于我们的语言。具体来说，假设我们没有表示绿色或蓝色的词，但我们有一个词grue，意思是“2030 年 1 月 1 日之前为绿色，之后为蓝色”，还有一个词bleen，意思是“2030 年 1 月 1 日之前为蓝色，之后为绿色”。在这种情况下，我们只能这样表达“所有祖母绿都是绿色”的假设

The obvious answer is that the second hypothesis adds superfluous complications, and is therefore disfavored by Occam’s Razor.  To that, Goodman replies that the definitions of “ simple” and “complicated”  depend on our language.  In particular, suppose we had no words for green or blue, but we did have a word grue, meaning “green before January 1, 2030, and blue afterwards,” and a word bleen, meaning “blue before January 1, 2030, and green afterwards.”  In that case, we could only express the hypothesis “All emeralds are green” by saying

“2030 年 1 月 1 日之前，所有祖母绿都是绿色的，之后就会变成蓝色。”

“All emeralds are grue before January 1, 2030, and then bleen afterwards.”

—显然，这个假设比简单的“所有祖母绿都是绿色的”更为复杂！

—a manifestly more complicated hypothesis than the simple “All emeralds are grue”!

我承认，当我思考这个可怕的谜语时，我不禁想起了关于反归纳主义者的笑话，当被问及为什么他们继续相信未来不会像过去，而这种错误的信念给他们的文明带来的只有贫穷和痛苦时，他们回答说：“因为反归纳从来没有奏效过！”是的，如果我们人为地定义我们的原始概念“违背世界的规律”，那么我们不应该惊讶于世界的实际行为变得更加难以描述，或者我们做出了错误的预测。这就像我们使用一种没有内置乘法函数的编程语言，而只有F（十，是）：=17十−是−十2+2十是在这种情况下，正常人的第一反应要么是更换编程语言，要么 用以下方式定义乘法：F，忘记 F 从那时起！42  现在，这里有一个真正的哲学问题：为什么grue、bleen 和F（十，是） 逆世界潮流而行，而绿色、蓝色和乘法却顺世界潮流？但对我来说，这个问题（就像维格纳对“自然科学中数学的不合理有效性”的困惑） ）更多地是关于世界本身而不是关于人类的概念，所以我们不应该指望任何纯粹的语言分析来解决它。

I confess that, when I contemplate the grue riddle, I can’t help but recall the joke about the Anti-Inductivists, who, when asked why they continue to believe that the future won’t resemble the past, when that false belief has brought their civilization nothing but poverty and misery, reply, “because anti-induction has never worked before!”  Yes, if we artificially define our primitive concepts “against the grain of the world,”  then we shouldn’t be surprised if the world’s actual behavior becomes more cumbersome to describe, or if we make wrong predictions.  It would be as if we were using a programming language that had no built-in function for multiplication, but only for \(F\left( x,y\right) :=17x-y-x^{2}+2xy\).  In that case, a normal person’s first instinct would be either to switch programming languages, or else to define multiplication in terms of \(F\), and forget about \(F\) from that point onward!42  Now, there is a genuine philosophical problem here: why do grue, bleen, and \(F\left( x,y\right)\) go “ against the grain of the world,” whereas green, blue, and multiplication go with the grain?  But to me, that problem (like Wigner’s puzzlement over “the unreasonable effectiveness of mathematics in natural sciences” ) is more about the world itself than about human concepts, so we shouldn’t expect any purely linguistic analysis to resolve it.

那么计算复杂性又如何呢？在我看来，虽然计算复杂性无法解决这个难题，但它确实提供了一个有用的见解。也就是说，当我们谈论假设的简单性或复杂性时，我们应该区分两个问题：

What about computational complexity, then?  In my view, while computational complexity doesn’t solve the grue riddle, it does contribute a useful insight.  Namely, that when we talk about the simplicity or complexity of hypotheses, we should distinguish two issues:

  1. 假设大小的渐近缩放，作为“大小” n我们的学习问题趋于无穷。

  2. The asymptotic scaling of the hypothesis size, as the “size” \(n\) of our learning problem goes to infinity.

  3. 恒定要素间接费用。

  4. The constant-factor overheads.

就第[PAC]节中的基本PAC模型而言，我们可以想象一个“隐藏参数” n，用于测量指定集合中单个点所需的位数年代=年代n（其他测量学习问题“大小”的方法也可以，但这种方法特别方便。）为了方便起见，我们可以确定年代n使用集合 {0，1}n的n位字符串，这样n=日志2⁡|年代n|。然后我们需要考虑的不仅仅是一个假设类，而是一个无限的假设类家族赫={赫1，赫2，赫3，…}，每个正整数一个n。 这里 赫n 由假设函数组成 时长  那张地图 年代n={0，1}n 到 {0，1}。

In terms of the basic PAC model in Section [PAC], we can imagine a “hidden parameter” \(n\), which measures the number of bits needed to specify an individual point in the set \(\mathcal{S}% =\mathcal{S}_{n}\).  (Other ways to measure the “ size” of a learning problem would also work, but this way is particularly convenient.)  For convenience, we can identify \(\mathcal{S}_{n}\) with the set\(\ \left\{ 0,1\right\} ^{n}\) of \(n\)-bit strings, so that \(n=\log_{2}\left\vert \mathcal{S}_{n}\right\vert\).  We then need to consider, not just a single hypothesis class, but an infinite family of hypothesis classes \(\mathcal{H}=\left\{ \mathcal{H}% _{1},\mathcal{H}_{2},\mathcal{H}_{3},\ldots\right\}\), one for each positive integer \(n\).  Here \(\mathcal{H}_{n}\) consists of hypothesis functions \(h\)  that map \(\mathcal{S}_{n}=\left\{ 0,1\right\} ^{n}\) to \(\left\{ 0,1\right\}\).

现在让大号是一种 用于指定假设的语言赫：换句话说，从二进制字符串（的某个子集）映射是∈{0，1}∗ 到赫.另外，假设 时长∈赫， 让κ大号（时长）：=分钟{|是|：大号（是）=时长}是最短 描述的长度时长在语言中 大号。 （这里|是| 只是意味着位数是）最后，让 κ大号（n）：=最大限度{κ大号（时长）：时长∈赫n}是指定任意假设所需的位数赫n使用语言大号。 清楚地κ大号（n）≥⌈日志2⁡|赫n|⌉，当且仅当大号 是“最优的”（也就是说，如果它代表每个假设时长∈赫n 使用尽可能少的比特）。我们关心的问题是κ大号（n） 增长函数为n，提供多种语言选择大号。

Now let \(L\) be a language for specifying hypotheses in \(\mathcal{H}\): in other words, a mapping from (some subset of) binary strings \(y\in\left\{ 0,1\right\} ^{\ast}\) to \(\mathcal{H}\).  Also, given a hypothesis \(h\in\mathcal{H}\), let \[\kappa_{L}\left( h\right) :=\min\left\{ \left\vert y\right\vert :L\left( y\right) =h\right\}\] be the length of the shortest description of \(h\) in the language \(L\).  (Here \(\left\vert y\right\vert\) just means the number of bits in \(y\).)  Finally, let \[\kappa_{L}\left( n\right) :=\max\left\{ \kappa_{L}\left( h\right) :h\in\mathcal{H}_{n}\right\}\] be the number of bits needed to specify an arbitrary hypothesis in \(\mathcal{H}_{n}\) using the language \(L\).  Clearly \(\kappa_{L}\left( n\right) \geq\left\lceil \log_{2}\left\vert \mathcal{H}_{n}\right\vert \right\rceil\), with equality if and only if \(L\) is “ optimal” (that is, if it represents each hypothesis \(h\in\mathcal{H}_{n}\) using as few bits as possible).  The question that concerns us is how quickly \(\kappa_{L}\left( n\right)\) grows as a function of \(n\), for various choices of language \(L\).

这一切和格鲁谜题有什么关系？好吧，我们可以想想大号 （它的语法、词汇等）影响函数的“低阶”行为κ大号（n）。例如，假设我们运气不好，大号包含单词grue和 bleen，但不包含blue和green。这可能会增加κ大号（n） 大约十倍——从现在起，每次我们在阐述假设时提到“绿色”时长，我们需要一个冗长的迂回说法，比如“在 2030 年 1 月 1 日之前是 grue，之后是 bleen”，蓝色也是如此。43然而  ，复杂性理论的一个重要教训是，κ大号（n）—例如，它是多项式增长还是指数增长n—几乎完全不受细节的影响大号! 原因是，如果两种语言大号1 和大号2 只是在“低级细节”上有所不同，然后把一个假设从大号1 到大号2 或反之亦然，将使描述长度增加不超过一个多项式因子。事实上，就像我们的 grue 示例一样，通常存在一个“通用平移常数” 丙使得κ大号1（时长）≤丙κ大号2（时长） 甚至 κ大号1（时长）≤κ大号2（时长）+丙 对于 每一个假设时长∈赫。

What does any of this have to do with the grue riddle?  Well, we can think of the details of \(L\) (its syntax, vocabulary, etc.) as affecting the “lower-order” behavior of the function \(\kappa_{L}\left( n\right)\).  So for example, suppose we are unlucky enough that \(L\) contains the words grue and bleen, but not blue and green.  That might increase \(\kappa_{L}\left( n\right)\) by a factor of ten or so—since now, every time we want to mention “green” when specifying our hypothesis \(h\), we instead need a wordy circumlocution like “ grue before January 1, 2030, and then bleen afterwards,” and similarly for blue.43  However, a crucial lesson of complexity theory is that the “higher-order” behavior of \(\kappa _{L}\left( n\right)\)—for example, whether it grows polynomially or exponentially with \(n\)—is almost completely unaffected by the details of \(L\)!  The reason is that, if two languages \(L_{1}\) and \(L_{2}\) differ only in their “low-level details,” then translating a hypothesis from \(L_{1}\) to \(L_{2}\) or vice versa will increase the description length by no more than a polynomial factor.  Indeed, as in our grue example, there is usually a “universal translation constant” \(c\) such that \(\kappa_{L_{1}}\left( h\right) \leq c\kappa_{L_{2}}\left( h\right)\) or even \(\kappa_{L_{1}% }\left( h\right) \leq\kappa_{L_{2}}\left( h\right) +c\) for every hypothesis \(h\in\mathcal{H}\).

上述规则的一个例外是，如果语言大号1和大号2有不同的表达能力。例如，也许大号1只允许将表达式嵌套到第二层，而大号2允许嵌套任意深度；或大号1只允许命题连接词，而大号2还允许一阶量词。在这些情况下，κ大号1（时长）确实可能远大于κ大号2（时长） 对于一些假设时长，甚至可能呈指数级增长（κ大号1（时长）≈2κ大号2（时长）打个粗略的比方：假设你没有学过微分方程是什么，也不知道如何近似或数值求解它们。在这种情况下，牛顿力学对你来说可能和带有本轮的托勒密理论一样复杂，甚至更复杂！因为用牛顿力学进行预测的唯一方法是使用一张巨大的“预先计算的”微分方程解表——而对你来说，这张表似乎和本轮表一样笨重和不雅。但请注意，在这种情况下，你的看法不是随意选择词汇的结果，而是你数学表达能力的客观差距。

The one exception to the above rule is if the languages \(L_{1}\) and \(L_{2}\) have different expressive powers.  For example, maybe \(L_{1}\) only allows nesting expressions to depth two, while \(L_{2}\) allows nesting to arbitrary depths; or \(L_{1}\) only allows propositional connectives, while \(L_{2}\) also allows first-order quantifiers.  In those cases, \(\kappa_{L_{1}% }\left( h\right)\) could indeed be much greater than \(\kappa_{L_{2}}\left( h\right)\) for some hypotheses \(h\), possibly even exponentially greater (\(\kappa_{L_{1}}\left( h\right) \approx2^{\kappa_{L_{2}}\left( h\right) }%\)).  A rough analogy would be this: suppose you hadn’t learned what differential equations were, and had no idea how to solve them even approximately or numerically.  In that case, Newtonian mechanics might seem just as complicated to you as the Ptolemaic theory with epicycles, if not more complicated!  For the only way you could make predictions with Newtonian mechanics would be using a huge table of “ precomputed” differential equation solutions—and to you, that table would seem just as unwieldy and inelegant as a table of epicycles.  But notice that in this case, your perception would be the result, not of some arbitrary choice of vocabulary, but of an objective gap in your mathematical expressive powers.

总而言之，如果我们想使用奥卡姆剃刀来预测祖母绿的未来颜色，那么我们对词汇的选择——例如，我们是否将绿色/蓝色或蓝绿色/绿色作为原始概念——确实很重要。但我认为复杂性理论证明我们将绿色视为“小的——n效应”：在越来越复杂的学习问题的渐近极限中，这种现象变得越来越不重要。

To summarize, our choice of vocabulary—for example, whether we take green/blue or bleen/grue as primitive concepts—could indeed matter if we want to use Occam’s Razor to predict the future color of emeralds.  But I think that complexity theory justifies us in treating grue as a “small-\(n\) effect”: something that becomes less and less important in the asymptotic limit of more and more complicated learning problems.

量子计算

Quantum Computing

量子计算是一种利用量子力学解决某些计算问题的方案，其速度比我们目前所知道的解决方法快得多。44要  做到这一点，人们需要建造一种新型计算机，能够利用叠加和干涉的量子效应。由于量子态的脆弱性以及需要将其与外部环境隔离，建造这样一台足够大以解决有趣问题的计算机对物理学和工程学来说仍然是一个巨大的挑战。

Quantum computing is a proposal for using quantum mechanics to solve certain computational problems much faster than we know how to solve them today.44  To do so, one would need to build a new type of computer, capable of exploiting the quantum effects of superposition and interference.  Building such a computer—one large enough to solve interesting problems—remains an enormous challenge for physics and engineering, due to the fragility of quantum states and the need to isolate them from their external environment.

与此同时，理论计算机科学家已经广泛研究了如果有量子计算机我们能做什么和不能做什么。对于某些问题，众所周知，卓越的量子算法可以在多项式时间内解决它们，尽管最著名的经典算法需要指数时间。最著名的是，1994 年 Peter Shor 提出了一个多项式时间量子算法来分解整数，并作为副产品，破解了当今互联网上使用的大多数加密代码。除了实际意义之外，Shor 的算法还提供了一个关键证据，表明从经典计算机转向量子计算机将扩大多项式时间内可解决的问题类别。对于理论计算机科学家来说，这是一个深刻的教训：如果我们想知道高效计算的极限，我们可能需要“离开我们的扶手椅”，并结合物理学的实际事实（至少是量子力学的真假！）。45

In the meantime, though, theoretical computer scientists have extensively studied what we could and couldn’t do with a quantum computer if we had one.  For certain problems, remarkable quantum algorithms are known to solve them in polynomial time, even though the best-known classical algorithms require exponential time.  Most famously, in 1994 Peter Shor  gave a polynomial-time quantum algorithm for factoring integers, and as a byproduct, breaking most of the cryptographic codes used on the Internet today.  Besides the practical implications, Shor’s algorithm also provided a key piece of evidence that switching from classical to quantum computers would enlarge the class of problems solvable in polynomial-time.  For theoretical computer scientists, this had a profound lesson: if we want to know the limits of efficient computation, we may need to “leave our armchairs” and incorporate actual facts about physics (at a minimum, the truth or falsehood of quantum mechanics!).45

无论可扩展的量子计算机是否会很快建成，我个人（有偏见的）观点是量子计算代表了我们这个时代最伟大的科学进步之一。但在这里我想问一个不同的问题：量子计算对 哲学有什么影响吗？特别是对量子力学的解释？

Whether or not scalable quantum computers are built anytime soon, my own (biased) view is that quantum computing represents one of the great scientific advances of our time.  But here I want to ask a different question: does quantum computing have any implications for philosophy—and specifically, for the interpretation of quantum mechanics?

从某种角度来看，答案似乎是显而易见的“不”。不管它是什么，量子计算“仅仅”是量子力学的一个应用，因为这个理论在物理教科书中已经存在了 80 年。事实上， 如果你接受量子力学（目前理解的）是正确的，那么你大概也应该接受量子计算机的可能性，并像其他人一样对其操作做出相同的预测。无论你通过多世界诠释、玻姆力学或其他观点来描述量子过程背后的“现实”（或者，按照玻尔的哥本哈根诠释，拒绝讨论“现实”），似乎都无关紧要。

From one perspective, the answer seems like an obvious “ no.”  Whatever else it is, quantum computing is “merely” an application of quantum mechanics, as that theory has existed in physics textbooks for 80 years.  Indeed, if you accept that quantum mechanics (as currently understood) is true, then presumably you should also accept the possibility of quantum computers, and make the same predictions about their operation as everyone else.  Whether you describe the “ reality” behind quantum processes via the Many-Worlds Interpretation, Bohmian mechanics, or some other view (or, following Bohr’s Copenhagen Interpretation, refuse to discuss the “ reality” at all), seems irrelevant.

但从另一个角度来看，可扩展的量子计算机将测试量子力学量子计算机测试的“机制”不是以能量尺度或温度为特征，而是以计算复杂性为特征。量子力学最引人注目的事实之一是，为了表示n纠缠粒子，需要一个大小为指数的矢量n例如，要指定一千个自旋态1/2粒子，需要21000 复数称为“振幅”，每个振幅代表测量自旋的可能结果。{向上，向下}基础。量子态，表示为|ψ⟩，则是可能结果的线性组合或“叠加”，每个结果|十⟩ 以其振幅加权α十：|ψ⟩=∑十∈{向上，向下}1000α十|十⟩。鉴于|ψ⟩，可以计算出概率页十 任何特定的结果|十⟩将通过规则观察到页十=|α十|2. 46

From a different perspective, though, a scalable quantum computer would test quantum mechanics in an extremely novel regime—and for that reason, it could indeed raise new philosophical issues.  The “regime” quantum computers would test is characterized not by an energy scale or a temperature, but by computational complexity.  One of the most striking facts about quantum mechanics is that, to represent the state of \(n\) entangled particles, one needs a vector of size exponential in \(n\).  For example, to specify the state of a thousand spin-\(1/2\) particles, one needs \(2^{1000}\) complex numbers called “amplitudes,” one for every possible outcome of measuring the spins in the \(\left\{ \operatorname*{up}% ,\operatorname*{down}\right\}\) basis.  The quantum state, denoted \(\left\vert \psi\right\rangle\), is then a linear combination or “superposition” of the possible outcomes, with each outcome \(\left\vert x\right\rangle\) weighted by its amplitude \(\alpha_{x}\): \[\left\vert \psi\right\rangle =\sum_{x\in\left\{ \operatorname*{up}% ,\operatorname*{down}\right\} ^{1000}}\alpha_{x}\left\vert x\right\rangle .\] Given \(\left\vert \psi\right\rangle\), one can calculate the probability \(p_{x}\) that any particular outcome \(\left\vert x\right\rangle\) will be observed, via the rule \(p_{x}=\left\vert \alpha_{x}\right\vert ^{2}%\).46

现在，只有大约1080 可见宇宙中的原子，这个数量比21000。因此，假设量子力学是正确的，大自然似乎必须投入大量的“计算努力”来追踪小粒子集合——肯定比经典物理学所需的任何东西都要多！47，48  20 世纪 80 年代初，理查德·费曼 其他人也注意到了这一点，指出这背后隐藏着一个早已在实践中显现的问题：用传统计算机模拟量子力学极其困难。但费曼也提出了扭转这一困难的可能性，即用量子元件构建我们的计算机。可以想象，这样的计算机可以比传统计算机更快地解决某些问题：至少可以解决模拟量子力学的问题！

Now, there are only about \(10^{80}\) atoms in the visible universe, which is a much smaller number than \(2^{1000}\).  So assuming quantum mechanics is true, it seems Nature has to invest staggering amounts of “ computational effort” to keep track of small collections of particles—certainly more than anything classical physics requires!47\(^{,}\)48  In the early 1980s, Richard Feynman and others called attention to this point, noting that it underlay something that had long been apparent in practice: the extraordinary difficulty of simulating quantum mechanics using conventional computers.  But Feynman also raised the possibility of turning that difficulty around, by building our computers out of quantum components.  Such computers could conceivably solve certain problems faster than conventional computers: if nothing else, then at least the problem of simulating quantum mechanics!

因此，量子计算之所以有趣，不仅因为它的应用，而且（在我看来，更重要的是）因为它是第一种直接“探测”自然界量子描述中固有的指数性的技术。  我们可以将其与 20 世纪 80 年代首次令人信服地违反贝尔不等式的实验进行类比。就像今天的量子算法一样，贝尔对局部现实主义的驳斥“仅仅”是量子力学的一个数学结果。但那次驳斥（以及它所启发的实验）使得量子力学中概念上重要的方面不再可能被忽视——因此，它改变了哲学格局。在我看来，量子计算极有可能也会这样做。

Thus, quantum computing is interesting not just because of its applications, but (even more, in my opinion) because it is the first technology that would directly “probe” the exponentiality inherent in the quantum description of Nature.  One can make an analogy here to the experiments in the 1980s that first convincingly violated the Bell Inequality.  Like quantum algorithms today, Bell’s refutation of local realism was “merely” a mathematical consequence of quantum mechanics.  But that refutation (and the experiments that it inspired) made conceptually-important aspects of quantum mechanics no longer possible to ignore—and for that reason, it changed the philosophical landscape.  It seems overwhelmingly likely to me that quantum computing will do the same.

事实上，我们可以进一步扩展这个类比：就像曾经有“局部现实主义顽固分子”否认贝尔不等式违反的可能性（并在它被实现之后试图解释它），今天也有少数计算机科学家和物理学家（包括列昂尼德·列文，奥德·戈德里奇和 Gerard 't Hooft) 甚至在原则上否认了可扩展量子计算机的可能性。尽管他们承认量子力学已经通过了一个世纪以来的每一个实验测试，但这些怀疑论者确信 量子力学将在量子计算测试的领域中失败——并且无论用什么新理论取代它，该理论都只允许经典计算。

Indeed, we can extend the analogy further: just as there were “local realist diehards” who denied that Bell Inequality violation would be possible (and tried to explain it away after it was achieved), so today a vocal minority of computer scientists and physicists (including Leonid Levin , Oded Goldreich , and Gerard ’t Hooft ) denies the possibility of scalable quantum computers, even in principle.  While they admit that quantum mechanics has passed every experimental test for a century, these skeptics are confident that quantum mechanics will fail in the regime tested by quantum computing—and that whatever new theory replaces it, that theory will allow only classical computing.

大多数量子计算研究人员很快指出，如果构建可扩展量子计算机的尝试最终导致量子力学的修订， 他们会非常兴奋！这样的结果可能构成自 20 世纪 20 年代以来物理学最大的革命，最终比构建量子计算机有趣得多。当然，可扩展量子计算也有可能因为“平凡的”技术原因而不是基础物理原因而被放弃，因为太难了。但这种“平凡的”可能性并不是 Levin、Goldreich 和 't Hooft 等怀疑论者所谈论的。

As most quantum computing researchers are quick to point out in response, they would be thrilled if the attempt to build scalable quantum computers led instead to a revision of quantum mechanics!  Such an outcome would probably constitute the largest revolution in physics since the 1920s, and ultimately be much more interesting than building a quantum computer.  Of course, it is also possible that scalable quantum computing will be given up as too difficult for “mundane”  technological reasons, rather than fundamental physics reasons.  But that “mundane” possibility is not what skeptics such as Levin, Goldreich, and ’t Hooft are talking about.

量子计算和多重世界解释

Quantum Computing and the Many-Worlds Interpretation

但让我们回到最初的问题：假设怀疑论者错了，而且可以构建可扩展的量子计算机。这与量子力学的解释有什么关系吗？最著名的论据是，答案是“是”，这是量子计算先驱和多世界诠释的坚定捍卫者戴维·德意志提出的。确切地说，德意志认为量子力学直接暗示了平行宇宙的存在，并且它独立于量子计算：在他看来，即使是双缝实验也只能用两个平行宇宙的干涉来解释。然而，德意志也认为量子计算为这一论点增添了情感冲击力。这是他在 1997 年出版的《现实的结构》一书中的说法 ：

But let’s return to the original question: suppose the skeptics are wrong, and it is possible to build scalable quantum computers.  Would that have any relevance to the interpretation of quantum mechanics?  The best-known argument that the answer is “yes” was made by David Deutsch, a quantum computing pioneer and staunch defender of the Many-Worlds Interpretation.  To be precise, Deutsch thinks that quantum mechanics straightforwardly implies the existence of parallel universes, and that it does so independently of quantum computing: on his view, even the double-slit experiment can only be explained in terms of two parallel universes interfering.  However, Deutsch also thinks that quantum computing adds emotional punch to the argument.  Here is how he put it in his 1997 book The Fabric of Reality :

从逻辑上讲，复杂量子计算的可能性对已经无法回答的多重世界解释没有任何帮助。但它确实增加了心理影响。对于 Shor 算法，争论已经变得非常激烈。对于那些仍然坚持单一宇宙世界观的人，我提出这个挑战： 解释 Shor 算法是如何工作的。  我的意思不仅仅是预测它会起作用，这只是解决几个无争议方程的问题。我的意思是提供一个解释。当 Shor 算法分解了一个数字时，使用10500 大约是可见计算资源的倍数，那么这个数字在哪里分解呢？只有大约1080 整个可见宇宙中的原子，与10500。因此，如果可见宇宙是物理现实的范围，那么物理现实根本不会包含分解如此大的数字所需的资源。那么，谁分解了它？计算是如何进行的，在哪里进行的？

Logically, the possibility of complex quantum computations adds nothing to a case [for the Many-Worlds Interpretation] that is already unanswerable.  But it does add psychological impact.  With Shor’s algorithm, the argument has been writ very large.  To those who still cling to a single-universe world-view, I issue this challenge: explain how Shor’s algorithm works.  I do not merely mean predict that it will work, which is merely a matter of solving a few uncontroversial equations.  I mean provide an explanation.  When Shor’s algorithm has factorized a number, using \(10^{500}\) or so times the computational resources that can be seen to be present, where was the number factorized?  There are only about \(10^{80}%\) atoms in the entire visible universe, an utterly minuscule number compared with \(10^{500}\).  So if the visible universe were the extent of physical reality, physical reality would not even remotely contain the resources required to factorize such a large number.  Who did factorize it, then?  How, and where, was the computation performed?

上一段中有很多内容可供有进取心的哲学家参考。特别是，不相信多世界理论的人应该如何回答 Deutsch 的挑战？在本节的其余部分，我将重点介绍两种可能的回应。

There is plenty in the above paragraph for an enterprising philosopher to mine.  In particular, how should a nonbeliever in Many-Worlds answer Deutsch’s challenge?  In the rest of this section, I’ll focus on two possible responses.

第一个回应是否认，如果 Shor 算法如预期那样工作，那么这只能通过假设“巨大的计算资源”来解释。在最明显的层面上，复杂性理论家尚未排除快速经典因式分解算法的可能性。49更一般地说  ，量子计算机可以比传统计算机更快地超多项式地解决某些问题，这不是一个定理，而是一个（深刻的、合理的 ）猜想。50，51  如果这个猜想失败了，那么我们似乎可以称之为“多项式时间隐变量理论”：一种无需调用任何外部计算就能重现量子力学预测的理论。磷.52这些理论  类似于爱因斯坦等人所希望的局部隐变量理论，后来贝尔排除了这种理论。

The first response is to deny that, if Shor’s algorithm works as predicted, that can only be explained by postulating “vast computational resources.”  At the most obvious level, complexity theorists have not yet ruled out the possibility of a fast classical factoring algorithm.49  More generally, that quantum computers can solve certain problems superpolynomially faster than classical computers is not a theorem, but a (profound, plausible) conjecture.50\(^{,}\)51  If the conjecture failed, then the door would seem open to what we might call “polynomial-time hidden-variable theories”: theories that reproduce the predictions of quantum mechanics without invoking any computations outside \(\mathsf{P}\).52  These would be analogous to the local hidden variable theories that Einstein and others had hoped for, before Bell ruled such theories out.

对 Deutsch 的挑战的第二个回应是，即使我们同意 Shor 的算法证明了自然界中存在大量计算资源的事实，我们也不认为应该将这些资源视为“平行宇宙”。为什么不简单地说只有一个宇宙，而且它是量子力学的？平行宇宙的语言难道不反映出一种讽刺的狭隘主义吗：想要将熟悉的科幻形象强加于一个比小说更奇怪的数学理论，而这种理论与我们任何前量子直觉（包括计算直觉）都不太相符 ？

A second response to Deutsch’s challenge is that, even if we agree that Shor’s algorithm demonstrates the reality of vast computational resources in Nature, it is not obvious that we should think of those resources as “parallel universes.”  Why not simply say that there is one universe, and that it is quantum-mechanical?  Doesn’t the parallel-universes language reflect an ironic parochialism: a desire to impose a familiar science-fiction image on a mathematical theory that is stranger than fiction, that doesn’t match any of our pre-quantum intuitions (including computational intuitions) particularly well?

我们可以这样进一步阐述这一点：如果一个人过于认真地对待量子计算机如何工作的平行宇宙解释（就像许多流行作家一样！），那么对量子计算做出进一步的推论自然是完全错误的。例如：

One can sharpen the point as follows: if one took the parallel-universes explanation of how a quantum computer works too seriously (as many popular writers do!), then it would be natural to make further inferences about quantum computing that are flat-out wrong.  For example:

“仅使用一千个量子比特，量子计算机就可以存储 21000 “经典片段。”

“Using only a thousand quantum bits (or qubits), a quantum computer could store \(2^{1000}\) classical bits.”

这只适用于“存储”一词的奇怪定义！根本问题是，当你测量量子计算机的状态时，你只能看到其中一种可能的结果；其余的都消失了。事实上，一个著名的结果被称为Holevo 定理  说的是，使用 n量子比特，没有办法存储超过n经典比特，以便以后可以可靠地检索这些比特。换句话说：对于“信息承载能力”的至少一个自然定义，量子比特具有与比特完全相同的容量。

This is true only for a bizarre definition of the word “ store”!  The fundamental problem is that, when you measure a quantum computer’s state, you see only one of the possible outcomes; the rest disappear.  Indeed, a celebrated result called Holevo’s Theorem  says that, using \(n\) qubits, there is no way to store more than \(n\) classical bits so that the bits can be reliably retrieved later.  In other words: for at least one natural definition of “ information-carrying capacity,” qubits have exactly the same capacity as bits.

再举一个例子：

To take another example:

“与只能通过逐个尝试除数来分解数字的传统计算机不同，量子计算机可以并行尝试所有可能的除数。”

“Unlike a classical computer, which can only factor numbers by trying the divisors one by one, a quantum computer could try all possible divisors in parallel.”

如果量子计算机能够驾驭大量平行世界，那么上述内容似乎是对 Shor 算法工作原理的合理猜测。但事实并非如此。请注意，如果 Shor 算法确实如此工作，那么它不仅可以用于分解整数，还可以用于更大的解题任务名词解释多项式时间内完全问题。（如脚注12所述，因式分解问题被强烈认为不是名词解释-完成。）但与普遍的误解相反，量子计算机既不为人所知，也不被认为能够解决名词解释-高效地完成问题。53像  往常一样，根本问题是测量只揭示了一个随机结果|十⟩。为了解决这个问题，并确保以高概率观察到正确的结果，量子算法需要生成 干涉图案，其中导致给定错误结果的计算路径相互抵消，而导致给定正确结果的路径相互加强。这是一个微妙的要求，据大家所知，它只能在少数问题上实现，其中大多数问题（如因式分解问题）具有来自代数或数论的特殊结构。54

If quantum computers can harness vast numbers of parallel worlds, then the above seems like a reasonable guess as to how Shor’s algorithm works.  But it’s not how it works at all.  Notice that, if Shor’s algorithm did work that way, then it could be used not only for factoring integers, but also for the much larger task of solving \(\mathsf{NP}\)-complete problems in polynomial time.  (As mentioned in footnote 12, the factoring problem is strongly believed not to be \(\mathsf{NP}%\)-complete.)  But contrary to a common misconception, quantum computers are neither known nor believed to be able to solve \(\mathsf{NP}\)-complete problems efficiently.53  As usual, the fundamental problem is that measuring reveals just a single random outcome \(\left\vert x\right\rangle\).  To get around that problem, and ensure that the right outcome is observed with high probability, a quantum algorithm needs to generate an interference pattern, in which the computational paths leading to a given wrong outcome cancel each other out, while the paths leading to a given right outcome reinforce each other.  This is a delicate requirement, and as far as anyone knows, it can only be achieved for a few problems, most of which (like the factoring problem) have special structure arising from algebra or number theory.54

多世界论者可能会反驳：“当然，我同意量子计算涉及以微妙和不明显的方式利用平行宇宙，但它仍然是在利用平行宇宙！ ”但即使在这里，也有一个令人着迷的讽刺。假设我们选择从平行宇宙的角度来思考量子算法。那么说得粗略一点，不仅许多宇宙必须相互干扰才能给出正确答案的最终振幅；它们还必须通过干扰失去平行宇宙的身份！  换句话说，无论宇宙集合对量子计算有多大用处，我们是否应该称它们为“平行宇宙”都是有争议的（而不是一个指数级大的、自干扰的量子力学团块的一部分）。相反，无论宇宙在多大程度上具有明确分离的身份，它们现在都“脱节”了，彼此之间没有因果联系。因此，我们可以通过仅调用其中一个宇宙并将其他宇宙视为未实现的假设来解释任何未来计算的输出。

A Many-Worlder might retort: “sure, I agree that quantum computing involves harnessing the parallel universes in subtle and non-obvious ways, but it’s still harnessing parallel universes!”   But even here, there’s a fascinating irony.  Suppose we choose to think of a quantum algorithm in terms of parallel universes.  Then to put it crudely, not only must many universes interfere to give a large final amplitude to the right answer; they must also, by interfering, lose their identities as parallel universes!  In other words, to whatever extent a collection of universes is useful for quantum computation, to that extent it is arguable whether we ought to call them “parallel universes” at all (as opposed to parts of one exponentially-large, self-interfering, quantum-mechanical blob).  Conversely, to whatever extent the universes have unambiguously separate identities, to that extent they’re now “decohered” and out of causal contact with each other. Thus we can explain the outputs of any future computations by invoking only one of the universes, and treating the others as unrealized hypotheticals.

需要澄清的是，我不认为上述对 Deutsch 论点的反对意见具有决定性，我也不确定自己对此事的看法。我提出这些反对意见的目的只是为了说明量子计算理论在多世界解释辩论中的潜力。

To clarify, I don’t regard either of the above objections to Deutsch’s argument as decisive, and am unsure what I think about the matter.  My purpose, in setting out the objections, was simply to illustrate the potential of quantum computing theory to inform debates about the Many-Worlds Interpretation.

新的计算证明概念

New Computational Notions of Proof

自欧几里得时代以来，数学证明主要有两种概念：

Since the time of Euclid, there have been two main notions of mathematical proof:

  1. “证明”是一种口头解释，它能让任何愿意并能够遵循它的人类数学家对所要证明的陈述产生一种确定感（理想情况下是理解）。

  2. A “proof” is a verbal explanation that induces a sense of certainty (and ideally, understanding) about the statement to be proved, in any human mathematician willing and able to follow it.

  3. “证明”是某些形式系统中编码句法推论的有限符号序列，以公理开始，以要证明的陈述结束。

  4. A “proof” is a finite sequence of symbols encoding syntactic deductions in some formal system, which start with axioms and end with the statement to be proved.

这两个概念之间的矛盾是数学哲学中反复出现的主题。但理论计算机科学经常处理第三个证明概念——似乎比上述两个概念受到的哲学分析要少得多。这个概念如下：

The tension between these two notions is a recurring theme in the philosophy of mathematics.  But theoretical computer science deals regularly with a third notion of proof—one that seems to have received much less philosophical analysis than either of the two above.  This notion is the following:

  1. “证明”是任何计算过程或协议（真实的或想象的），当且仅当所要证明的陈述为真时，它才能以某种方式终止。

  2. A “proof” is any computational process or protocol (real or imagined) that can terminate in a certain way if and only if the statement to be proved is true.

零知识证明

Zero-Knowledge Proofs

作为第三个概念的一个例子，请考虑Goldwasser、Micali 和 Rackoff 提出的零知识证明. 给定两个图格 和赫，每个都有n≈10000顶点，假设一个全能但不值得信任的巫师梅林希望说服持怀疑态度的亚瑟王格和 赫不是同构的。当然，Merlin 可以做到这一点的一种方法是列出所有n！ 通过对顶点进行置换得到的图格，那么请注意，这些都不相等赫。然而，这样的证明显然会耗尽亚瑟的耐心（事实上，它甚至无法在可观测的宇宙中写下来）。或者，梅林可以向亚瑟指出格和赫区分它们：例如，它们的邻接矩阵可能具有不同的特征值谱。不幸的是，目前还不能证明，如果格和赫是非同构的，总有一个微分性质，Arthur 可以在时间多项式中验证 n。

As an example of this third notion, consider zero-knowledge proofs, introduced by Goldwasser, Micali, and Rackoff .  Given two graphs \(G\) and \(H\), each with \(n\approx10000\) vertices, suppose that an all-powerful but untrustworthy wizard Merlin wishes to convince a skeptical king Arthur that \(G\) and \(H\) are not isomorphic.  Of course, one way Merlin could do this would be to list all \(n!\) graphs obtained by permuting the vertices of \(G\), then note that none of these equal \(H\).  However, such a proof would clearly exhaust Arthur’s patience (indeed, it could not even be written down within the observable universe).  Alternatively, Merlin could point Arthur to some property of \(G\) and \(H\) that differentiates them: for example, maybe their adjacency matrices have different eigenvalue spectra.  Unfortunately, it is not yet proven that, if \(G\) and \(H\) are non-isomorphic, there is always a differentiating property that Arthur can verify in time polynomial in \(n\).

但正如 Goldreich、Micali 和 Wigderson 所注意到的，Merlin 可以做另一件事：他可以让 Arthur挑战他。Merlin 可以说：

But as noticed by Goldreich, Micali, and Wigderson , there is something Merlin can do instead: he can let Arthur challenge him.  Merlin can say:

Arthur，给我发一张新图表钾，你可以通过随机排列 格或随机排列赫那么我保证我会告诉你，毫无疑问，钾≅格 或者钾≅赫。

Arthur, send me a new graph \(K\), which you obtained either by randomly permuting the vertices of \(G\), or randomly permuting the vertices of \(H\).  Then I guarantee that I will tell you, without fail, whether \(K\cong G\) or \(K\cong H\).

显然，如果格和赫是非同构的，那么 Merlin 总是能够正确回答这些挑战，因为他（Merlin）拥有无限的计算能力。但同样清楚的是，如果格和赫是同构的，那么 Merlin 一定会错误地回答一些挑战，无论他的计算能力如何——因为格从统计上看，与随机排列没有区别赫。

It is clear that, if \(G\) and \(H\) are really non-isomorphic, then Merlin can always answer such challenges correctly, by the assumption that he (Merlin) has unlimited computational power.  But it is equally clear that, if \(G\) and \(H\) are isomorphic, then Merlin must answer some challenges incorrectly, regardless of his computational power—since a random permutation of \(G\) is statistically indistinguishable from a random permutation of \(H\).

该协议至少有四个特点值得任何对数学证明的本质感兴趣的人思考。

This protocol has at least four features that merit reflection by anyone interested in the nature of mathematical proof.

首先，该协议是概率性的。Merlin 无法让 Arthur 确信格和赫是非同构的，因为即使它们是同构的，也有一个1/2 Merlin 有幸正确回答给定挑战的概率（因此，1/2钾 他回答的可能性 钾正确挑战）。Merlin 所能做的就是重复协议（比如说）100或者1000次，从而使他的证明不成立的可能性小于小行星撞击卡米洛特，杀死他和亚瑟的可能性。

First, the protocol is probabilistic.  Merlin cannot convince Arthur with certainty that \(G\) and \(H\) are non-isomorphic, since even if they were isomorphic, there’s a \(1/2\) probability that Merlin would get lucky and answer a given challenge correctly (and hence, a \(1/2^{k}\) probability that he would answer \(k\) challenges correctly).  All Merlin can do is offer to repeat the protocol (say) \(100\) or \(1000\) times, and thereby make it less likely that his proof is unsound than that an asteroid will strike Camelot, killing both him and Arthur.

其次，该协议是交互式的。与证明概念 (1) 和 (2) 不同，Arthur 不再是知识的被动接受者，而是挑战证明者的主动参与者。我们从经验中知道，询问研讨会演讲者的能力——提出演讲者无法预料的问题，评估回答，然后可能提出后续问题——通常会加快弄清演讲者是否知道自己在说什么的过程。复杂性理论通过发现语句的交互式证明（例如“格和赫不同构的证明”），而其已知最短的传统证明则要长得多。

Second, the protocol is interactive.  Unlike with proof notions (1) and (2), Arthur is no longer a passive recipient of knowledge, but an active player who challenges the prover.  We know from experience that the ability to interrogate a seminar speaker—to ask questions that the speaker could not have anticipated, evaluate the responses, and then possibly ask followup questions—often speeds up the process of figuring out whether the speaker knows what he or she is talking about.  Complexity theory affirms our intuition here, through its discovery of interactive proofs for statements (such as “\(G\) and \(H\) are not isomorphic”) whose shortest known conventional proofs are exponentially longer.

图非同构协议的第三个有趣特征（很少被提及的特征）是其可靠性隐含地依赖于 物理假设。也就是说，如果梅林有能力（无论是通过魔法还是通过普通的间谍活动）“窥视亚瑟的书房”，并直接观察亚瑟是否以格或者赫，那么显然他可以正确回答每一个挑战，即使格≅赫由此可见，梅林“证明”的说服力只能与亚瑟的数学以外的信念一样强大，即梅林没有 这样的能力。到目前为止，复杂性理论中还有许多其他“证明”的例子，其有效性取决于证明者的假定局限性。

The third interesting feature of the graph non-isomorphism protocol—a feature seldom mentioned—is that its soundness implicitly relies on a physical assumption.  Namely, if Merlin had the power (whether through magic or through ordinary espionage) to “peer into Arthur’s study” and directly observe whether Arthur started with \(G\) or \(H\), then clearly he could answer every challenge correctly even if \(G\cong H\).  It follows that the persuasiveness of Merlin’s “proof” can only be as strong as Arthur’s extramathematical belief that Merlin does not have such powers.  By now, there are many other examples in complexity theory of “ proofs” whose validity rests on assumed limitations of the provers.

正如希伯尔指出，上述交互式协议的三个属性 也适用于第[AI]节中讨论的图灵测试！图灵测试在定义上是交互式的，它是概率性的，因为即使是打印随机胡言乱语的程序也有一定的 概率偶然通过测试，并且它取决于 AI 程序不会通过（例如）秘密咨询人类来“作弊”的物理假设。出于这些原因，Shieber 认为，我们可以将图灵测试本身视为一种早期的交互式协议——它不是让验证者相信数学定理，而是让证明者相信智能言语行为的能力。55

As Shieber points out, all three of the above properties of interactive protocols also hold for the Turing Test discussed in Section [AI]!  The Turing Test is interactive by definition, it is probabilistic because even a program that printed random gibberish would have some nonzero probability of passing the test by chance, and it depends on the physical assumption that the AI program doesn’t “cheat” by (for example) secretly consulting a human.  For these reasons, Shieber argues that we can see the Turing Test itself as an early interactive protocol—one that convinces the verifier not of a mathematical theorem, but of the prover’s capacity for intelligent verbal behavior.55

然而，图非同构协议最引人注目的特征或许是它是零知识的：一个技术术语，形式化了我们的直觉，“除了被证明的陈述的真实性之外，Arthur 从协议中什么也学不到。” 56  因为 Merlin 告诉 Arthur 的只是他（Arthur）从哪个图开始，格或者赫。但亚瑟已经知道 他从哪个图开始！这意味着，亚瑟不仅没有“理解”是什么让格 和赫非同构的，他甚至无法向第三方证明 Merlin 向他证明的东西。这是计算证明的另一个方面，与证明概念 (1) 或 (2) 没有相似之处。

However, perhaps the most striking feature of the graph non-isomorphism protocol is that it is zero-knowledge: a technical term formalizing our intuition that “Arthur learns nothing from the protocol, beyond the truth of the statement being proved.” 56  For all Merlin ever tells Arthur is which graph he (Arthur) started with, \(G\) or \(H\).  But Arthur already knew which graph he started with!  This means that, not only does Arthur gain no “understanding” of what makes \(G\) and \(H\) non-isomorphic, he does not even gain the ability to prove to a third party what Merlin proved to him.  This is another aspect of computational proofs that has no analogue with proof notions (1) or (2).

有人可能会抱怨说，尽管零知识性质很有趣，但到目前为止，我们只展示了它对于一个极其特殊的问题而言是可以实现的。事实上，就像整数分解一样，今天有强有力的证据表明，图同构问题并非 如此 名词解释-完全的 . 57，58  然而，在给出图非同构协议的同一篇论文中，Goldreich、Micali 和 Wigderson还为​名词解释- 完整问题。根据定义名词解释-complete（参见第[ENTSCH]节），GMW 协议意味着 每个具有常规证明的数学陈述（例如，在 Zermelo-Fraenkel 集合论中）也具有相当大小的零知识证明！  作为示例应用，假设您刚刚证明了黎曼假设。您想让专家们相信您的胜利，但又担心他们会窃取您的功劳。在这种情况下，您需要做的“全部”是

One might complain that, as interesting as the zero-knowledge property is, so far we’ve only shown it’s achievable for an extremely specialized problem.  And indeed, just like with factoring integers, today there is strong evidence that the graph isomorphism problem is not \(\mathsf{NP}%\)-complete .57\(^{,}%\)58  However, in the same paper that gave the graph non-isomorphism protocol, Goldreich, Micali, and Wigderson also gave a celebrated zero-knowledge protocol (now called the GMW protocol) for the \(\mathsf{NP}\)-complete problems.  By the definition of \(\mathsf{NP}\)-complete (see Section [ENTSCH]), the GMW protocol meant that every mathematical statement that has a conventional proof (say, in Zermelo-Fraenkel set theory) also has a zero-knowledge proof of comparable size!  As an example application, suppose you’ve just proved the Riemann Hypothesis.  You want to convince the experts of your triumph, but are paranoid about them stealing credit for it.  In that case, “all” you need to do is

  1. 用正式语言重写你的证明，

  2. rewrite your proof in a formal language,

  3. 将结果编码为名词解释-完成问题，然后

  4. encode the result as the solution to an \(\mathsf{NP}\)-complete problem, and then

  5. 就像16吨时长世纪宫廷数学家向他的竞争对手发起决斗，邀请专家与您一起通过互联网运行 GMW 协议！

  6. like a \(16^{th}\)-century court mathematician challenging his competitors to a duel, invite the experts to run the GMW protocol with you over the Internet!

只要你正确回答了所有问题，专家们就可以从统计上确定你拥有黎曼假设的证明，而无需了解除证明长度的上限之外的任何信息。

Provided you answer all their challenges correctly, the experts can become statistically certain that you possess a proof of the Riemann Hypothesis, without learning anything about that proof besides an upper bound on its length.

更好的是，与图非同构协议不同，GMW 协议并不假设存在超级强大的巫师——只需要一个碰巧知道相关定理证明的普通多项式时间人。因此，如今 GMW 协议已不仅仅是一种理论上的奇观：它及其变体已在互联网加密领域得到广泛应用，客户端和服务器通常需要向对方证明他们正确地遵循了协议，同时又不泄露秘密信息。

Better yet, unlike the graph non-isomorphism protocol, the GMW protocol does not assume a super-powerful wizard—only an ordinary polynomial-time being who happens to know a proof of the relevant theorem.  As a result, today the GMW protocol is much more than a theoretical curiosity: it and its variants have found major applications in Internet cryptography, where clients and servers often need to prove to each other that they are following a protocol correctly without revealing secret information as they do so.

然而，有一个重要的警告：与图非同构协议不同，GMW 协议本质上依赖于 加密假设。GMW 协议的工作原理如下：你（证明者）首先发布数千条加密消息，每条消息都“承诺”你声称的证明中随机乱码的部分。然后，你提出解密这些消息中的一小部分，以便持怀疑态度的观察者“抽查”你的证明，但除了无用的事实之外，你对其结构一无所知，比如说，1729吨时长 步骤是有效的（但怎么可能无效呢？）。如果怀疑论者想增加他们对你的证明的信心，那么你只需一遍又一遍地与他们运行该协议，每次都使用一批新的加密消息。如果怀疑论者可以解密一批消息中的所有消息，那么他们就可以拼凑出你的证明——但要做到这一点，他们需要破解底层加密代码。

However, there is one important caveat: unlike the graph-nonisomorphism protocol, the GMW protocol relies essentially on a cryptographic hypothesis.  For here is how the GMW protocol works: you (the prover) first publish thousands of encrypted messages, each one “ committing” you to a randomly-garbled piece of your claimed proof.  You then offer to decrypt a tiny fraction of those messages, as a way for skeptical observers to “spot-check”  your proof, while learning nothing about its structure besides the useless fact that, say, the \(1729^{th}\) step is valid (but how could it not be valid?).  If the skeptics want to increase their confidence that your proof is sound, then you simply run the protocol over and over with them, using a fresh batch of encrypted messages each time.  If the skeptics could decrypt all the messages in a single batch, then they could piece together your proof—but to do that, they would need to break the underlying cryptographic code.

其他新概念

Other New Notions

让我提到复杂性理论家在过去二十年中深入探索过的另外四个“证明”概念，它们可能值得哲学上的关注。

Let me mention four other notions of “proof”  that complexity theorists have explored in depth over the last twenty years, and that might merit philosophical attention.

  • 多证明者交互式证明 ，其中亚瑟与 两个（或更多）计算能力强大但不值得信任的巫师交换信息。在这里，亚瑟可能会相信一些数学陈述，但前提是巫师在协议期间无法相互交流。（通常的类比是警察侦探将两个嫌疑人关在不同的牢房中，以防止他们协调答案。）有趣的是，在一些多证明者协议中，即使是非交流的巫师也可以通过使用量子纠缠成功地协调他们对亚瑟挑战的回应（从而说服亚瑟相信谎言） 。然而，其他协议被推测即使在面对纠缠的巫师时也能保持有效。
