E. Wigner. The unreasonable effectiveness of mathematics in the natural sciences. , 13(1), 1960.

R. de Wolf。计算学习理论的哲学应用：乔姆斯基天赋和奥卡姆剃刀。硕士论文，伊拉斯姆斯大学，1997 年。homepages.cwi.nl/rdewolf/publ/philosophy/phthesis.pdf。

R. de Wolf. Philosophical applications of computational learning theory: Chomskyan innateness and occam’s razor. Master’s thesis, Erasmus University, 1997. homepages.cwi.nl/rdewolf/publ/philosophy/phthesis.pdf.

  1. 麻省理工学院。电子邮件：[email protected]。本材料基于美国国家科学基金会资助的 0844626 号项目。此外，还获得了 DARPA YFA 资助、斯隆基金会和 TIBCO 主席的支持。↩︎

  2. MIT.  Email: [email protected].   This material is based upon work supported by the National Science Foundation under Grant No. 0844626.  Also supported by a DARPA YFA grant, the Sloan Foundation, and a TIBCO Chair.↩︎

  3. 当我在本文中使用“哲学”一词时，我 指的是分析传统中的哲学。我对大陆哲学或东方哲学了解不够多，无法判断它们是否与计算复杂性理论有任何有趣的联系。↩︎

  4. When I use the word “ philosophy” in this essay, I’ll mean philosophy within the analytic tradition.  I don’t understand Continental or Eastern philosophy well enough to say whether they have any interesting connections with computational complexity theory.↩︎

  5. 参见 philpapers.org/browse/computational-complexity ↩︎

  6. See philpapers.org/browse/computational-complexity↩︎

  7. 伪随机数生成器存在的猜想意味着磷≠名词解释 猜想（稍后会详细介绍），但可能更强：逆向蕴涵未知。↩︎

  8. The conjecture that pseudorandom generators exist implies the \(\mathsf{P}\neq\mathsf{NP}%\) conjecture (about which more later), but might be even stronger: the converse implication is unknown.↩︎

  9. 斯坦福哲学百科全书的“计算机科学哲学”条目 plato.stanford.edu/entries/computer-science 大部分篇幅都用于讨论这一联系。↩︎

  10. The Stanford Encyclopedia of Philosophy entry on “The Philosophy of Computer Science,”  plato.stanford.edu/entries/computer-science, devotes most of its space to this connection.↩︎

  11. 一种变体“资源受限的 Kolmogorov 复杂度”  确实考虑了时间和内存，并且是计算复杂性理论的一部分。↩︎

  12. A variant, “resource-bounded Kolmogorov complexity,”  does take time and memory into account, and is part of computational complexity theory proper.↩︎

  13. 该方法称为数域筛选法，引用的运行时间取决于数论中合理但未经证实的猜想。最佳证明运行时间为 ∼2n。这两种方法都比尝试所有可能除数的简单方法有了很大的改进，这种方法需要∼2n步骤。参见 Pomerance 对因式分解算法进行了很好的调查。↩︎

  14. This method is called the number field sieve, and the quoted running time depends on plausible but unproved conjectures in number theory.  The best proven running time is \(\sim2^{\sqrt{n}}\).  Both of these represent nontrivial improvements over the naı̈ve method of trying all possible divisors, which takes \(\sim2^{n}\) steps.  See Pomerance  for a good survey of factoring algorithms.↩︎

  15. 在某些情况下，“指数”意味着丙n 对于某个常数丙>1但在大多数复杂性理论背景下，它也可以意味着丙nd 对于常量丙>1 和d>0。↩︎​

  16. In some contexts, “ exponential” means \(c^{n}\) for some constant \(c>1\), but in most complexity-theoretic contexts it can also mean \(c^{n^{d}}\) for constants \(c>1\) and \(d>0\).↩︎

  17. 这并不是说计算模型的细节不重要：例如，有些问题已知可以在量子计算机上以多项式时间解决，但不 知道在经典计算机上是否可以在多项式时间内解决！但在我看来，多项式/指数区别能够“注意到”这种规模的建模选择这一事实是区别的一个特征，而不是一个缺陷。↩︎

  18. This is not to say that no details of the computational model matter: for example, some problems are known to be solvable in polynomial time on a quantum computer, but not known to be solvable in polynomial time on a classical computer!  But in my view, the fact that the polynomial/exponential distinction can “ notice” a modelling choice of this magnitude is a feature of the distinction, not a bug.↩︎

  19. 与普遍的误解相反，名词解释 不代表“非多项式”！有些计算问题已知 需要超过多项式时间（参见[TIME]节），但名词解释 问题不在其中。事实上，名词解释 和“非多项式”有一个非空交集，只要磷≠名词解释。

    有关磷，名词解释以及数百种其他复杂性类别，请参阅我的复杂性动物园网站：www.complexityzoo.com。↩︎

  20. Contrary to a common misconception, \(\mathsf{NP}\) does not stand for “Non-Polynomial”!  There are computational problems that are known to require more than polynomial time (see Section [TIME]), but the \(\mathsf{NP}%\) problems are not among those.  Indeed, the classes \(\mathsf{NP}\) and “Non-Polynomial” have a nonempty intersection exactly if \(\mathsf{P}\neq\mathsf{NP}\).

    For detailed definitions of \(\mathsf{P}\), \(\mathsf{NP}\), and several hundred other complexity classes, see my Complexity Zoo website: www.complexityzoo.com.↩︎

  21. 更多信息请访问 www.claymath.org/millennium/P_vs_NP/

    我自己的观点是磷 相对名词解释 显然是七个问题中 最重要的一个！因为如果磷=名词解释那么根据哥德尔的论证，我们很有可能也可以对计算机进行编程来解决其他六个问题。↩︎

  22. For more information see www.claymath.org/millennium/P_vs_NP/

    My own view is that \(\mathsf{P}\ \)versus \(\mathsf{NP}\) is manifestly the most important of the seven problems!  For if \(\mathsf{P}% =\mathsf{NP}\), then by Gödel’s argument, there is an excellent chance that we could program our computers to solve the other six problems as well.↩︎

  23. 有人可能会问：我们能否解释一下是什么使得 磷≠名词解释 问题如此之难，而不是仅仅指出许多聪明人都曾试图解决它但失败了？经过四十年的研究，我们确实 对这个问题的难度有了部分解释，即形式上的“障碍”排除了大量证明技术。到目前为止，确定的三个障碍是相对化 （排除了对角化和其他具有“可计算性”特征的技术）、 代数化 （即使与当今已知的主要非相对化技术相结合，也排除了对角化），以及自然证明 （这表明，许多“组合”技术如果有效，就可以反过来获得更快的算法来区分随机函数和伪随机函数）。↩︎

  24. One might ask: can we explain what makes the \(\mathsf{P}\neq\mathsf{NP}\) problem so hard, rather than just pointing out that many smart people have tried to solve it and failed?  After four decades of research, we do have partial explanations for the problem’s difficulty, in the form of formal “barriers”  that rule out large classes of proof techniques.  Three barriers identified so far are relativization (which rules out diagonalization and other techniques with a “computability”  flavor), algebrization (which rules out diagonalization even when combined with the main non-relativizing techniques known today), and natural proofs (which shows that many “ combinatorial” techniques, if they worked, could be turned around to get faster algorithms to distinguish random from pseudorandom functions).↩︎

  25. 相比之下，与普遍的误解相反，有强有力的证据表明，分解整数不是 名词解释-完成。众所周知，如果磷≠名词解释，则有名词解释 问题既不存在于 磷 也不名词解释-完全的，而因式分解就是此类问题的一个候选。当我们讨论量子计算时，这一点将变得相关。↩︎

  26. By contrast, and contrary to a common misconception, there is strong evidence that factoring integers is not \(\mathsf{NP}\)-complete.  It is known that if \(\mathsf{P}% \neq\mathsf{NP}\), then there are \(\mathsf{NP}\) problems that are neither in \(\mathsf{P}\) nor \(\mathsf{NP}\)-complete , and factoring is one candidate for such a problem.  This point will become relevant when we discuss quantum computing.↩︎

  27. 诚然，人们也许能够证明 达尔文自然选择需要指数时间来产生某些功能，而无需证明任何 算法都需要指数时间。↩︎

  28. Admittedly, one might be able to prove that Darwinian natural selection would require exponential time to produce some functionality, without thereby proving that any algorithm would require exponential time.↩︎

  29. 本节的灵感来自 A. Rupinski 在MathOverflow网站上提出的一个问题。请参阅 mathoverflow.net/questions/62925/philosophical-question-related-to-largest-known-primes/ ↩︎

  30. This section was inspired by a question of A. Rupinski on the website MathOverflow.  See mathoverflow.net/questions/62925/philosophical-question-related-to-largest-known-primes/↩︎

  31. www.mersenne.org ↩︎

  32. www.mersenne.org↩︎

  33. 例如，可以使用切比雪夫定理 （也称为伯特兰公设），该定理指出，对于所有 否>1 之间存在一个素数 否和2否。↩︎​

  34. For example, one could use Chebyshev’s Theorem (also called Bertrand’s Postulate), which says that for all \(N>1\) there exists a prime between \(N\) and \(2N\).↩︎

  35. 克拉默猜想指出，两个连续n位素数永远不会超过∼n2。这个猜想似乎异常困难：即使假设黎曼假设，也只知道如何推导出更弱的上限∼n2n/2。但有趣的是，如果克拉默猜想被证明，那么“第一个大于2钾−1” 就会根据我的标准定义“已知素数” 。↩︎

  36. Cramér’s Conjecture states that the spacing between two consecutive \(n\)-digit primes never exceeds \(\sim n^{2}\).  This conjecture appears staggeringly difficult: even assuming the Riemann Hypothesis, it is only known how to deduce the much weaker upper bound \(\sim n2^{n/2}\).  But interestingly, if Cramér’s Conjecture is proved, expressions like “the first prime larger than \(2^{k}% -1\)” will then define “known primes” according to my criterion.↩︎

  37. 具体来说，很容易检查可计算函数集 并不依赖于我们是否根据经典图灵机或量子图灵机、确定性图灵机或非确定性图灵机来定义可计算性。这些选择最多可以将图灵机的运行时间改变一个指数因子，这与可计算性理论无关。↩︎

  38. In particular, it is easy to check that the set of computable functions does not depend on whether we define computability with respect to a classical or a quantum Turing machine, or a deterministic or nondeterministic one.  At most, these choices can change a Turing machine’s running time by an exponential factor, which is irrelevant for computability theory.↩︎

  39. 图灵测试，由阿兰·图灵提出 1950 年，人类法官与另一个人或计算机对话程​​序通过来回输入消息进行交互的测试。如果法官无法可靠地区分程序与人类对话者，则程序“通过”测试。

    我所说的图灵测试的“强变体”是指，除了通常的电传打字机对话之外，还可以添加其他测试，包括视觉、听觉、触觉、嗅觉、说话、笔迹、面部表情、跳舞、运动和乐器等——尽管许多智力超群的人无法通过这些测试！↩︎

  40. The Turing Test, proposed by Alan Turing  in 1950, is a test where a human judge interacts with either another human or a computer conversation program, by typing messages back and forth.  The program “ passes” the Test if the judge can’t reliably distinguish the program from the human interlocutor.

    By a “strong variant” of the Turing Test, I mean that besides the usual teletype conversation, one could add additional tests requiring vision, hearing, touch, smell, speaking, handwriting, facial expressions, dancing, playing sports and musical instruments, etc.—even though many perfectly-intelligent humans would then be unable to pass the tests!↩︎

  41. 一个著名的例外是约翰·塞尔，他明确表示，如果（比如说）他最好的朋友被微芯片而不是大脑控制，那么他会认为他的朋友根本不是一个人。↩︎

  42. One famous exception is John Searle , who has made it clear that, if (say) his best friend turned out to be controlled by a microchip rather than a brain, then he would regard his friend as never having been a person at all.↩︎

  43. 参见丹尼特和查尔默斯 例如。总结一下：

    1. 为什么我们要假设计算机在一个已知健全的形式系统内运行？如果我们赋予计算机与人类相同的偶尔犯错的自由，那么不完备性定理就不再有意义了。

    2. 为什么我们要假设人类数学家具有“柏拉图现实的直接感知”？人类数学家（如弗雷格）以前在形式系统的一致性问题上犯过错误。

    3. 当然，计算机可以被编程来输出“我相信形式系统F是一致的”——甚至输出关于它为什么相信这一点的各种后续问题的答案。因此，在争论这种肯定“实际上不算数”（因为它们不会反映“真正的理解”）时，卢卡斯和彭罗斯等人工智能批评家被迫放弃他们对经验主义“石中剑测试”的愿景，并依靠与人工智能内部结构相关的其他未指定的标准。但那为什么要把剑放在石中呢？

    ↩︎

  44. See Dennett and Chalmers  for example.  To summarize:

    1. Why should we assume a computer operates within a knowably-sound formal system?  If we grant a computer the same freedom to make occasional mistakes that we grant humans, then the Incompleteness Theorem is no longer relevant.

    2. Why should we assume that human mathematicians have “direct perception of Platonic reality”?  Human mathematicians (such as Frege) have been wrong before about the consistency of formal systems.

    3. A computer could, of course, be programmed to output “I believe that formal system \(F\) is consistent”—and even to output answers to various followup questions about why it believes this.  So in arguing that such affirmations “wouldn’t really count”  (because they wouldn’t reflect “true understanding”), AI critics such as Lucas and Penrose are forced to retreat from their vision of an empirical “ sword-in-the-stone test,” and fall back on other, unspecified criteria related to the AI’s internal structure.  But then why put the sword in the stone in the first place?

    ↩︎

  45. 人们在互联网上通过电子邮件或即时消息进行互动，在交换了少得多的比特后，经常会判断对方是人类而不是垃圾邮件机器人！无论如何，宇宙学的考虑表明，上限大致为10122 任何可观察过程中的比特 。↩︎​

  46. People interacting over the Internet, via email or instant messages, regularly judge each other to be humans rather than spam-bots after exchanging a much smaller number of bits!  In any case, cosmological considerations suggest an upper bound of roughly \(10^{122}\) bits in any observable process .↩︎

  47. 有些读者可能会注意到这里的矛盾：我在[C101]节中解释过，复杂性理论家关心的是渐近行为，因为问题规模n 趋于无穷大。那么为什么我现在说，为了图灵测试的目的，我们应该将注意力限制在有限的值上n 例如1020? 这个问题有两个答案。第一个答案是，与因式分解问题或停机问题等数学问题相比，将图灵测试推广到任意对话长度是否有意义尚不清楚：因为图灵测试是根据人类定义的，而人类的对话能力是有限的。第二个答案是，无论在多大程度上，将图灵测试推广到任意对话长度都是 有意义的n我感兴趣的是通过测试的渐近复杂度是随多项式增长还是随指数增长n（正如本节其余部分所解释的那样）。↩︎

  48. Some readers might notice a tension here: I explained in Section [C101] that complexity theorists care about the asymptotic behavior as the problem size \(n\) goes to infinity.  So why am I now saying that, for the purposes of the Turing Test, we should restrict attention to finite values of \(n\) such as \(10^{20}\)?  There are two answers to this question.  The first is that, in contrast to mathematical problems like the factoring problem or the halting problem, it is unclear whether it even makes sense to generalize the Turing Test to arbitrary conversation lengths: for the Turing Test is defined in terms of human beings, and human conversational capacity is finite.  The second answer is that, to whatever extent it does make sense to generalize the Turing Test to arbitrary conversation lengths \(n\), I am interested in whether the asymptotic complexity of passing the test grows polynomially or exponentially with \(n\) (as the remainder of the section explains).↩︎

  49. 正如 Gil Kalai 向我指出的那样，人们可以推测存在一种有效的计算机程序可以通过图灵测试，但找到这样的程序需要指数级的计算资源。在这种情况下，人类大脑确实可以通过计算机程序有效地模拟，但可能永远无法通过人类编写的程序模拟！↩︎

  50. As Gil Kalai pointed out to me, one could speculate instead that an efficient computer program exists to pass the Turing Test, but that finding such a program would require exponential computational resources.  In that situation, the human brain could indeed be simulated efficiently by a computer program, but maybe not by a program that humans could ever write!↩︎

  51. 这里，通过图灵机米“高效”，我们的意思是米的运行时间、内存使用量和程序大小都足够适中，因此不存在理解原理的真正问题米可以通过一个经典的物理系统来模拟，该系统包括∼1011神经元和∼1014 突触。例如，图灵机包含一个大小为101020 从这个意义上来说，效率不高。↩︎

  52. Here, by a Turing machine \(M\) being “efficient,” we mean that \(M\)’s running time, memory usage, and program size are modest enough that there is no real problem of principle understanding how \(M\) could be simulated by a classical physical system consisting of \(\thicksim10^{11}\) neurons and \(\thicksim 10^{14}\) synapses.  For example, a Turing machine containing a lookup table of size \(10^{10^{20}}\) would not be efficient in this sense.↩︎

  53. 有趣的是，如果我们能解决名词解释- 完整问题，那么我们大概会发现证明计算机无法解决 这些问题要容易得多！↩︎

  54. And amusingly, if we could solve \(\mathsf{NP}\)-complete problems, then we’d presumably find it much easier to prove that computers couldn’t solve them!↩︎

  55. 事实上，我甚至不清楚我们是否应该认为人类能够解决所有磷 问题的有效解决，更不用说名词解释-完成问题！回想一下磷是确定性图灵机可以在多项式时间内解决 的问题 。许多问题都属于磷原因相当复杂：两个例子是测试一个数字是否为质数（尽管没有分解它！）并测试一个图是否具有完美匹配。当然，原则上，人类可以用铅笔和纸费力地运行这类问题的多项式时间算法。但是，在不能使用计算机的情况下，使用铅笔和纸是否合法？ “无辅助”人类智力的计算能力是什么？德鲁克最近的工作展示了如何使用库存照片集来增加可用于心算的“有效记忆”，为这些问题提供了一个令人着迷的经验视角。↩︎

  56. Indeed, it is not even clear to me that we should think of humans as being able to solve all \(\mathsf{P}\) problems efficiently, let alone \(\mathsf{NP}\)-complete problems!  Recall that \(\mathsf{P}\) is the class of problems that are solvable in polynomial time by a deterministic Turing machine.  Many problems are known to belong to \(\mathsf{P}\) for quite sophisticated reasons: two examples are testing whether a number is prime (though not factoring it!) and testing whether a graph has a perfect matching.  In principle, of course, a human could laboriously run the polynomial-time algorithms for such problems using pencil and paper.  But is the use of pencil and paper legitimate, where use of a computer would not be?  What is the computational power of the “unaided” human intellect?  Recent work of Drucker , which shows how to use a stock photography collection to increase the “effective memory” available for mental calculations, provides a fascinating empirical perspective on these questions.↩︎

  57. 毫不奇怪，这个特定的公理引起了争议：它为拉姆斯菲尔德的“未知的未知数”留下了不可能。↩︎

  58. Not surprisingly, this particular axiom has engendered controversy: it leaves no possibility for Rumsfeldian “unknown unknowns.”↩︎

  59. 如果我们不要求句子为真，那么我们谈论的大概是信念而不是 知识。↩︎

  60. If we don’t require the sentences to be true, then presumably we’re talking about belief rather than knowledge .↩︎

  61. “认识”一个人意味着曾经见过这个人，而“认识”一个地方意味着曾经去过这个地方。有趣的是，在希伯来语中，人们在表示“熟悉”的意义上使用完全不同的动词“认识”（makir）而不是在知识意义上使用完全不同的动词“认识”（yodeya）。↩︎

  62. For “knowing” a person suggests having actually met the person, while “knowing” a place suggests having visited the place.  Interestingly, in Hebrew, one uses a completely different verb for “know” in the sense of “being familiar with”  (makir) than for “know” in the intellectual sense (yodeya).↩︎

  63. 对于国际象棋n×n 众所周知，董事会经验值- 完整，并且还已知磷≠经验值。有关更多详细信息，请参阅第[TIME]节 ，特别是脚注60。↩︎

  64. For chess on an \(n\times n\) board is known to be \(\mathsf{EXP}\)-complete, and it is also known that \(\mathsf{P}\neq\mathsf{EXP}\).  See Section [TIME], and particularly footnote 60, for more details.↩︎

  65. 比较保罗·格雷厄姆表达的悲观情绪关于知识表示的更一般性内容：

    实际上，形式逻辑用处不大，因为尽管在过去 150 年里取得了一些进展，但我们仍然只能形式化一小部分语句。我们可能永远无法做得更好，原因与 20 世纪 80 年代的“知识表示”永远无法奏效相同；许多语句可能没有比巨大的模拟大脑状态更简洁的表示。

    ↩︎

  66. Compare the pessimism expressed by Paul Graham about knowledge representation more generally:

    In practice formal logic is not much use, because despite some progress in the last 150 years we’re still only able to formalize a small percentage of statements.  We may never do that much better, for the same reason 1980s-style “knowledge representation” could never have worked; many statements may have no representation more concise than a huge, analog brain state.

    ↩︎

  67. 西普特南 和西尔 对于该论证的两个实例（尽管我们在这里不关心其中任何一个的正式细节）。↩︎

  68. See Putnam  and Searle  for two instantiations of the argument (though the formal details of either will not concern us here).↩︎

  69. “计算主义” 指的是心智实际上就是一台计算机，而思维实际上是一种计算的观点。↩︎

  70. “ Computationalism” refers to the view that the mind is literally a computer, and that thought is literally a type of computation.↩︎

  71. 从技术上讲，这描述了一种受限的归约类，称为非自适应归约。 从国际象棋到瀑布的自适应归约可能通过某种程序解决国际象棋问题，该程序涉及初始化瀑布并观察其最终状态，然后使用该水生计算的结果初始化第二个瀑布并观察 其最终状态，依此类推，重复多项式次数。↩︎

  72. Technically, this describes a restricted class of reductions, called nonadaptive reductions.  An adaptive reduction from chess to waterfalls might solve a chess problem by some procedure that involves initializing a waterfall and observing its final state, then using the results of that aquatic computation to initialize a second waterfall and observe its final state, and so on for some polynomial number of repetitions.↩︎

  73. 敏锐的读者可能会怀疑，我们把结论偷偷带入了瀑布状态的假设中s磷∈年代 和f（s磷）∈电视 以“合理”的方式编码为二进制字符串（而不是，例如，以编码国际象棋问题的解决方案的方式）。但复杂性理论的一个重要教训是，当我们讨论“计算问题”时，我们总是对输入和输出编码做出隐含的承诺！因此，例如，如果通过质因数分解给出正整数作为输入，则因式分解问题将很简单（只需应用恒等函数）。但是谁在乎呢？如果在数学上定义瀑布模拟问题时，我们需要涉及解决国际象棋问题的输入和输出编码，那么将我们的问题（仅仅）称为“瀑布模拟问题”就不再合理了。↩︎

  74. The perceptive reader might suspect that we smuggled our conclusion into the assumption that the waterfall states \(s_{P}\in S\) and \(f\left( s_{P}\right) \in T\) were encoded as binary strings in a “reasonable” way (and not, for example, in a way that encodes the solution to the chess problem).  But a crucial lesson of complexity theory is that, when we discuss “computational problems,” we always make an implicit commitment about the input and output encodings anyway!  So for example, if positive integers were given as input via their prime factorizations, then the factoring problem would be trivial (just apply the identity function).  But who cares?  If, in mathematically defining the waterfall-simulation problem, we required input and output encodings that entailed solving chess problems, then it would no longer be reasonable to call our problem (solely) a “ waterfall-simulation problem” at all.↩︎

  75. 请注意物流空间 机器甚至没有足够的内存来存储其输入字符串！因此，我们认为输入字符串是在特殊的只读磁带上提供的 。↩︎

  76. Note that a \(\mathsf{LOGSPACE}\) machine does not even have enough memory to store its input string!  For this reason, we think of the input string as being provided on a special read-only tape.↩︎

  77. 参见 Kearns 和 VaziraniPAC 学习的精彩介绍，以及 de Wolf 感谢将 PAC 学习应用于哲学和语言学的先前工作：具体来说，是充实乔姆斯基的“刺激贫乏”论证。除了基于 PAC 学习的形式化之外，De Wolf 还讨论了奥卡姆剃刀的几种形式化。↩︎

  78. See Kearns and Vazirani for an excellent introduction to PAC-learning, and de Wolf for previous work applying PAC-learning to philosophy and linguistics: specifically, to fleshing out Chomsky’s “ poverty of the stimulus” argument.  De Wolf also discusses several formalizations of Occam’s Razor other than the one based on PAC-learning.↩︎

  79. 在“适当学习”的设定中——学习者需要以某种特定格式输出假设——甚至已知许多自然的 PAC 学习问题名词解释- 完整（参见 Pitt 和 Valiant例如）。但在“不恰当”的设置中——学习者可以使用任何多项式时间算法来描述其假设——人们只知道如何证明 PAC 学习问题在密码假设下很难，而且这似乎是有内在原因的（参见 Applebaum、Barak 和 Xiao）。↩︎

  80. In the setting of “ proper learning”—where the learner needs to output a hypothesis in some specified format—it is even known that many natural PAC-learning problems are \(\mathsf{NP}\)-complete (see Pitt and Valiant for example).  But in the “ improper” setting—where the learner can describe its hypothesis using any polynomial-time algorithm—it is only known how to show that PAC-learning problems are hard under cryptographic assumptions, and there seem to be inherent reasons for this (see Applebaum, Barak, and Xiao ).↩︎

  81. 实现这一目标的重要进展包括 Angluin 的工作 从查询和反例中学习有限自动机，以及 Angluin 等人的研究。  通过注入值来学习电路。这两篇论文都研究了自然学习模型，这些模型通过允许“受控的科学实验”来概括 PAC 模型，实验结果证实或反驳了假设，从而为下一步进行哪些实验提供指导。↩︎

  82. Important progress toward this goal includes the work of Angluin  on learning finite automata from queries and counterexamples, and that of Angluin et al.  on learning a circuit by injecting values.  Both papers study natural learning models that generalize the PAC model by allowing “controlled scientific experiments,” whose results confirm or refute a hypothesis and thereby provide guidance about which experiments to do next.↩︎

  83. 假设我们的编程语言只提供常数乘法、加法和函数F（十，是）：=一个十2+b十是+丙是2+d十+埃是+f.我们可以不失一般性地假设d=埃=f=0.然后提供一个十2+b十是+丙是2 分为两个独立的线性项，页十+问是 和 r十+s是，我们可以表达产品 十是 作为F（s十−问是，−r十+页是）（页s−问r）2。↩︎

  84. Suppose that our programming language provides only multiplication by constants, addition, and the function \(F\left( x,y\right) :=ax^{2}+bxy+cy^{2}+dx+ey+f\).  We can assume without loss of generality that \(d=e=f=0\).  Then provided \(ax^{2}+bxy+cy^{2}\) factors into two independent linear terms, \(px+qy\) and \(rx+sy\), we can express the product \(xy\) as \[\frac{F\left( sx-qy,-rx+py\right) }{\left( ps-qr\right) ^{2}}.\]↩︎

  85. 但请注意，如果语言大号表达能力足以实现这一点，我们可以简单地用 bleen 和 grue 来定义 一次绿色和蓝色，然后在需要时引用这些定义！在这种情况下，将 bleen 和 grue（而不是绿色和蓝色）作为原始概念将增加κ大号（n） 仅由 加法常数而不是乘法常数组成。

    上述事实与 Kolmogorov 复杂性理论的一个基本结果相关（参见 Li 和 Vitányi 例如）。也就是说，如果磷和问是任意两种图灵通用编程语言，并且如果钾磷（十） 和钾问（十） 最短程序的长度是多少磷和 问分别输出给定的字符串十∈{0，1}∗，则存在一个通用的“平移常数” 丙磷问，这样|钾磷（十）−钾问（十）|≤丙磷问对于每一个 十。 这丙磷问 是写入所需的位数磷-解释器问-程序或反之亦然。↩︎

  86. Though note that, if the language \(L\) is expressive enough to allow this, we can simply define green and blue in terms of bleen and grue once, then refer back to those definitions whenever needed!  In that case, taking bleen and grue (rather than green and blue) to be the primitive concepts would increase \(\kappa_{L}\left( n\right)\) by only an additive constant, rather than a multiplicative constant.

    The above fact is related to a fundamental result from the theory of Kolmogorov complexity (see Li and Vitányi  for example).  Namely, if \(P\) and \(Q\) are any two Turing-universal programming languages, and if \(K_{P}\left( x\right)\) and \(K_{Q}\left( x\right)\) are the lengths of the shortest programs in \(P\) and \(Q\) respectively that output a given string \(x\in\left\{ 0,1\right\} ^{\ast}\), then there exists a universal “translation constant” \(c_{PQ}\), such that \(\left\vert K_{P}\left( x\right) -K_{Q}\left( x\right) \right\vert \leq c_{PQ}\) for every \(x\).  This \(c_{PQ}\) is just the number of bits needed to write a \(P\)-interpreter for \(Q\)-programs or vice versa.↩︎

  87. 量子计算的权威参考书是 Nielsen 和 Chuang 的书. 如需更温和的介绍，请尝试 Mermin 或 Aharonov 的综述文章，堡垒现在或 Watrous有关多项式时间计算和物理定律（包括量子计算以外的推测模型）的一般讨论，请参阅我的综述文章“名词解释- 完成问题和物理现实” 。↩︎​

  88. The authoritative reference for quantum computing is the book of Nielsen and Chuang .  For gentler introductions, try Mermin  or the survey articles of Aharonov , Fortnow , or Watrous .  For a general discussion of polynomial-time computation and the laws of physics (including speculative models beyond quantum computation), see my survey article “\(\mathsf{NP}%\)-complete Problems and Physical Reality” .↩︎

  89. 相比之下，如果我们只想知道物理宇宙中什么是 可计算的，而不需要任何效率要求，那么这与目前的知识完全一致，即丘奇和图灵在 20 世纪 30 年代给出了正确的答案——而且他们这样做并没有融入任何超出“直觉可及”范围的物理学。↩︎

  90. By contrast, if we only want to know what is computable in the physical universe, with no efficiency requirement, then it remains entirely consistent with current knowledge that Church and Turing gave the correct answer in the 1930s—and that they did so without incorporating any physics beyond what is “accessible to intuition.”↩︎

  91. 这特别意味着振幅满足归一化条件∑十|α十|2=1。↩︎​

  92. This means, in particular, that the amplitudes satisfy the normalization condition \(\sum_{x}\left\vert \alpha_{x}\right\vert ^{2}=1\).↩︎

  93. 有人可能会反对，即使在古典世界中，如果我们根本不知道（比如说）一个n位串，那么我们也 用指数级的数字来描述我们的无知：即 概率 页十每个可能的字符串十∈{0，1}n！事实上，量子力学和经典概率论之间有着极其密切的联系；我经常把量子力学描述为“用复数而不是非负实数的概率论”。然而，一个关键的区别是，我们总是可以描述一个经典的弦十 具有确定值，向量2n 概率 页十 那么只是我们自身无知的心理表征。在量子态下，由于正负振幅之间的干扰 现象，我们就没有同样的奢侈了。↩︎

  94. One might object that even in the classical world, if we simply don’t know the value of (say) an \(n\)-bit string, then we also describe our ignorance using exponentially-many numbers: namely, the probability \(p_{x}\) of each possible string \(x\in\left\{ 0,1\right\} ^{n}\)!  And indeed, there is an extremely close connection between quantum mechanics and classical probability theory; I often describe quantum mechanics as just “probability theory with complex numbers instead of nonnegative reals.”  However, a crucial difference is that we can always describe a classical string \(x\) as “really” having a definite value; the vector of \(2^{n}\) probabilities \(p_{x}\) is then just a mental representation of our own ignorance.  With a quantum state, we do not have the same luxury, because of the phenomenon of interference between positive and negative amplitudes.↩︎

  95. 有人可能还会反对说，即使在经典物理学中，如果一个粒子的位置和动量可以是任意实数，那么记录它的状态也需要无限多的比特。事实上，科普兰，霍加斯、西格尔曼，其他作者推测物理量的连续性实际上可能允许“超级计算”——包括在有限的时间内解决停机问题！然而，从现代的角度来看，量子力学和量子引力强烈表明，位置和动量等可测量量的“连续性”是一种理论上的产物。  换句话说，对于模拟目的来说，将这些量近似到某种有限的精度就足够了，这可能与普朗克尺度有关10−33 厘米或10−43 秒。

    但量子态的指数性有所不同，至少有两个原因。首先，它不会导致与超级计算加速一样“不合理”的计算加速。其次，没有人知道所讨论的理论（量子力学） 会以与当前实验一致的方式在何处失效。换句话说，量子计算没有已知的“致命障碍”，类似于超级计算的普朗克尺度。参见 Aaronson 进一步讨论这一点，以及提出一个复杂性理论框架（称为“Sure/Shor 分离器”）来研究此类障碍。↩︎

  96. One might also object that, even in classical physics, it takes infinitely many bits to record the state of even a single particle, if its position and momentum can be arbitrary real numbers.  And indeed, Copeland , Hogarth , Siegelmann , and other writers have speculated that the continuity of physical quantities might actually allow “ hypercomputations”—including solving the halting problem in a finite amount of time!  From a modern perspective, though, quantum mechanics and quantum gravity strongly suggest that the “continuity” of measurable quantities such as positions and momenta is a theoretical artifact.  In other words, it ought to suffice for simulation purposes to approximate these quantities to some finite precision, probably related to the Planck scale of \(10^{-33}%\) centimeters or \(10^{-43}\) seconds.

    But the exponentiality of quantum states is different, for at least two reasons.  Firstly, it doesn’t lead to computational speedups that are nearly as “unreasonable” as the hypercomputing speedups.  Secondly, no one has any idea where the theory in question (quantum mechanics) could break down, in a manner consistent with current experiments.  In other words, there is no known “ killer obstacle” for quantum computing, analogous to the Planck scale for hypercomputing.  See Aaronson  for further discussion of this point, as well as a proposed complexity-theoretic framework (called “Sure/Shor separators”) with which to study such obstacles.↩︎

  97. 事实上，如果不先证明磷≠名词解释！但即使 磷≠名词解释，快速的经典因式分解算法可能仍然存在，同样是因为因式分解不被认为是名词解释-完成。↩︎

  98. Indeed, one cannot rule that possibility out, without first proving \(\mathsf{P}\neq\mathsf{NP}\)!  But even if \(\mathsf{P}\neq\mathsf{NP}\), a fast classical factoring algorithm might still exist, again because factoring is not thought to be \(\mathsf{NP}\)-complete.↩︎

  99. 这个猜想的正式版本是布隆迪≠边界量子协议， 在哪里布隆迪 （有界误差概率多项式时间）和边界量子协议 （有界误差量子多项式时间）是可以通过经典随机算法和量子算法有效解决的问题类别。 Bernstein 和 Vazirani 表明磷⊆布隆迪⊆边界量子协议⊆空间， 在哪里空间 是确定性图灵机使用多项式内存（但可能是指数时间）可以解决的问题类型。因此，任何证明布隆迪≠边界量子协议 猜测会立即意味着 磷≠空间后者几乎可以被认为是一项重大突破，磷≠名词解释。↩︎​

  100. A formal version of this conjecture is \(\mathsf{BPP}\neq\mathsf{BQP}\), where \(\mathsf{BPP}\) (Bounded-Error Probabilistic Polynomial-Time) and \(\mathsf{BQP}\) (Bounded-Error Quantum Polynomial-Time) are the classes of problems efficiently solvable by classical randomized algorithms and quantum algorithms respectively.  Bernstein and Vazirani  showed that \(\mathsf{P}\subseteq\mathsf{BPP}\subseteq\mathsf{BQP}\subseteq\mathsf{PSPACE}%\), where \(\mathsf{PSPACE}\) is the class of problems solvable by a deterministic Turing machine using a polynomial amount of memory (but possibly exponential time).  For this reason, any proof of the \(\mathsf{BPP}% \neq\mathsf{BQP}\) conjecture would immediately imply \(\mathsf{P}% \neq\mathsf{PSPACE}\) as well.  The latter would be considered almost as great a breakthrough as \(\mathsf{P}\neq\mathsf{NP}\).↩︎

  101. 让问题更加复杂的是，有些量子算法可以证明比任何经典算法实现指数级加速：一个例子就是西蒙算法，Shor 算法的重要前身。然而，所有此类算法都是在“黑箱模型”中制定的（参见 Beals 等人）。 )，其中要最小化的资源是算法对假设的黑盒进行的查询次数。由于黑盒模型相对容易分析，因此它是了解传统图灵机模型中可能存在的问题的重要来源。然而，众所周知，黑盒模型有时会误导我们对“真实”情况的认识。一个著名的例子是复杂性类别知识产权 和空间 相等，尽管存在一个黑匣子将它们分开（参见 Fortnow 以供讨论）。

    除了黑箱模型之外，量子复杂性和经典复杂性之间的无条件 指数分离还存在于其他几个受限模型中，包括通信复杂性 。↩︎​

  102. Complicating matters, there are quantum algorithms that provably achieve exponential speedups over any classical algorithm: one example is Simon’s algorithm , an important predecessor of Shor’s algorithm.  However, all such algorithms are formulated in the “ black-box model” (see Beals et al. ), where the resource to be minimized is the number of queries that an algorithm makes to a hypothetical black box.  Because it is relatively easy to analyze, the black-box model is a crucial source of insights about what might be true in the conventional Turing machine model.  However, it is also known that the black-box model sometimes misleads us about the “ real” situation.  As a famous example, the complexity classes \(\mathsf{IP}\) and \(\mathsf{PSPACE}\) are equal , despite the existence of a black box that separates them (see Fortnow  for discussion).

    Besides the black-box model, unconditional exponential separations between quantum and classical complexities are known in several other restricted models, including communication complexity .↩︎

  103. 从技术上讲，如果隐变量理论涉及经典随机性，那么它将更接近于复杂性类布隆迪 （有界误差概率多项式时间）。然而，今天有强有力的证据表明磷=布隆迪（参见 Impagliazzo 和 Wigderson）。↩︎

  104. Technically, if the hidden-variable theory involved classical randomness, then it would correspond more closely to the complexity class \(\mathsf{BPP}\) (Bounded-Error Probabilistic Polynomial-Time).  However, today there is strong evidence that \(\mathsf{P}=\mathsf{BPP}\) (see Impagliazzo and Wigderson ).↩︎

  105. 有一种出色的量子算法，叫做 Grover 算法 ，它可以搜索任意空间2否 仅可能的解决方案∼2否/2 步骤。但是，Grover 算法比传统的强力搜索算法提高了二次方（平方根），而不是指数级。并且，在不对搜索空间结构做任何进一步假设的情况下，Grover 算法是最优的，正如 Bennett 等人所证明的那样。 。↩︎​

  106. There is a remarkable quantum algorithm called Grover’s algorithm , which can search any space of \(2^{N}\) possible solutions in only \(\thicksim2^{N/2}\) steps.  However, Grover’s algorithm represents a quadratic (square-root) improvement over classical brute-force search, rather than an exponential improvement.  And without any further assumptions about the structure of the search space, Grover’s algorithm is optimal, as shown by Bennett et al. .↩︎

  107. 那些对 Shor 算法的工作原理感兴趣，但还没有准备好进行数学阐述的人，可以尝试阅读我广受欢迎的文章“Shor，我会做到的” 。↩︎​

  108. Those interested in further details of how Shor’s algorithm works, but still not ready for a mathematical exposition, might want to try my popular essay “ Shor, I’ll Do It” .↩︎

  109. 顺便说一句，这提供了一个很好的例子，说明计算复杂性理论的概念如何仅在隐喻层面上影响哲学，而忽略实际结果。在这篇文章中，我没有尝试收集复杂性理论的这种“隐喻”应用，只是因为它们太多了！↩︎

  110. Incidentally, this provides a good example of how notions from computational complexity theory can influence philosophy even just at the level of metaphor, forgetting about the actual results.  In this essay, I didn’t try to collect such “metaphorical” applications of complexity theory, simply because there were too many of them!↩︎

  111. 从技术上讲，该协议是“诚实验证者零知识”，这意味着，假设Arthur 正确遵循协议 ，那么除了被证明的陈述的真实性之外，Arthur 从他的 Merlin 对话中不会学到任何东西 。如果 Arthur 作弊——例如，通过发送一个图钾他还不知道它的同构格或赫——那么梅林的回答确实可以告诉亚瑟一些新东西。然而，戈德里奇、米卡利和维格德森 还给出了图非同构的更复杂的证明协议，即使在 Arthur 作弊的情况下，它仍然是零知识。↩︎

  112. Technically, the protocol is “ honest-verifier zero-knowledge,” meaning that Arthur learns nothing from his conversation his Merlin besides the truth of the statement being proved, assuming Arthur follows the protocol correctly.  If Arthur cheats—for example, by sending a graph \(K\) for which he doesn’t already know an isomorphism either to \(G\) or to \(H\)—then Merlin’s response could indeed tell Arthur something new.  However, Goldreich, Micali, and Wigderson  also gave a more sophisticated proof protocol for graph non-isomorphism, which remains zero-knowledge even in the case where Arthur cheats.↩︎

  113. 事实上，甚至还没有一个共识认为图同构是外部的磷！主要原因是，与整数分解相比，图同构在实践中变得极其容易。事实上，找到无法通过简单不变量区分的非同构图本身就是一个难题！在过去，几个长期以来被认为“在实际应用中可有效解决”的问题（如线性规划和素数测试）最终被证明是 磷 从严格的数学意义上来说也是如此。↩︎

  114. Indeed, there is not even a consensus belief that graph isomorphism is outside \(\mathsf{P}\)!  The main reason is that, in contrast to factoring integers, graph isomorphism turns out to be extremely easy in practice.  Indeed, finding non-isomorphic graphs that can’t be distinguished by simple invariants is itself a hard problem!  And in the past, several problems (such as linear programming and primality testing) that were long known to be “efficiently solvable for practical purposes” were eventually shown to be in \(\mathsf{P}\) in the strict mathematical sense as well.↩︎

  115. 也有强有力的证据表明，图非同构有简短的 传统证明——换句话说，不仅图同构，而且图非同构最终都会被证明是名词解释 。↩︎​

  116. There is also strong evidence that there are short conventional proofs for graph non-isomorphism—in other words, that not just graph isomorphism but also graph non-isomorphism will ultimately turn out to be in \(\mathsf{NP}\) .↩︎

  117. 更准确地说，具有一维带的图灵机多项式等价于具有钾任意维带钾，并且也多项式等价于随机存取机（可以在单位时间内“跳转”到任何内存位置，没有局部性约束）。

    另一方面，如果我们关心速度的多项式差异，特别是如果我们想要研究并行计算模型，计算和存储元素的空间布局细节（以及元素之间的通信速度）就变得至关重要。↩︎

  118. More precisely, Turing machines with one-dimensional tapes are polynomially equivalent to Turing machines with \(k\)-dimensional tapes for any \(k\), and are also polynomially equivalent to random-access machines (which can “jump” to any memory location in unit time, with no locality constraint).

    On the other hand, if we care about polynomial differences in speed, and especially if we want to study parallel computing models, details about the spatial layout of the computing and memory elements (as well as the speed of communication among the elements) can become vitally important.↩︎

  119. 为什么“只有”一个指数量？因为图灵机乙 内存位的运行时间不能超过2乙 时间步骤。此后，机器必须停止或返回到之前访问的配置（从而进入无限循环）。↩︎

  120. Why “ only” an exponential amount?  Because a Turing machine with \(B\) bits of memory can run for no more than \(2^{B}\) time steps.  After that, the machine must either halt or else return to a configuration previously visited (thereby entering an infinite loop).↩︎

  121. 请注意，为了讨论此类游戏的计算复杂性，我们首先需要将它们推广到n×n 棋盘！但是如果我们这样做，那么对于许多自然游戏来说，确定哪个玩家从给定位置获胜的问题不仅仅是空间， 但空间- 完整（即，它捕捉了整个课程的难度空间）例如，Reisch 表明这对于 Hex 来说是正确的。

    那么如何将国际象棋适当地推广到n×n 董事会？这也是空间—但据大家所知，只有当我们对棋局的步数施加多项式上限时，才能做到这一点。如果没有这样的限制，Fraenkel 和 Lichtenstein 表明国际象棋是经验值- 完整；有了这样的限制，Storer 表明国际象棋是空间-完成。↩︎

  122. Note that, in order to speak about the computational complexity of such games, we first need to generalize them to an \(n\times n\) board!  But if we do so, then for many natural games, the problem of determining which player has the win from a given position is not only in \(\mathsf{PSPACE}\), but \(\mathsf{PSPACE}\)-complete (i.e., it captures the entire difficulty of the class \(\mathsf{PSPACE}\)).  For example, Reisch showed that this is true for Hex.

    What about a suitable generalization of chess to an \(n\times n\) board?  That’s also in \(\mathsf{PSPACE}\)—but as far as anyone knows, only if we impose a polynomial upper bound on the number of moves in a chess game.  Without such a restriction, Fraenkel and Lichtenstein showed that chess is \(\mathsf{EXP}\)-complete; with such a restriction, Storer  showed that chess is \(\mathsf{PSPACE}\)-complete.↩︎

  123. 在这种情况下，我们称一个函数f（n） “指数”，如果它的上限是2页（n）对于某个多项式页。另外，请注意， 超过指数的内存在这里是无用的，因为运行的图灵机电视时间步骤最多可以访问电视 记忆细胞。↩︎

  124. In this context, we call a function \(f\left( n\right)\) “exponential” if it can be upper-bounded by \(2^{p\left( n\right) }\), for some polynomial \(p\).  Also, note that more than exponential memory would be useless here, since a Turing machine that runs for \(T\) time steps can visit at most \(T\) memory cells.↩︎

  125. 更一般地，时间层次定理表明，如果f 和克 任何两个“足够表现良好”的函数都满足f（n）≪克（n）（例如：f（n）=n2 和克（n）=n3），那么 就有可解的计算问题 克（n） 时间但不在 f（n） 时间。该定理的证明使用了对角化，可以被认为是图灵证明停机问题不可解性的缩小版。也就是说，我们认为，如果总是可以模拟一个克（n）时间图灵机f（n）时间图灵机，那么我们就可以构造一个克（n）时间机器“提前预测了自己的输出”，然后输出了其他的东西——从而导致了矛盾。

    使用类似的论证，我们可以证明（例如）存在可使用以下方法解决的计算问题n3 内存位，但没有使用n2 位等等，在大多数情况下，我们想要比较相同计算资源的更多与更少。  在复杂性理论中，困难的部分是比较两种 不同的资源：例如，确定性与非确定性（磷=？名词解释 问题），时间与空间（磷=？空间)，或经典计算与量子计算（布隆迪=？边界量子协议）。因为在这些情况下，对角化本身不再起作用。↩︎

  126. More generally, the Time Hierarchy Theorem shows that, if \(f\) and \(g\) are any two “ sufficiently well-behaved” functions that satisfy \(f\left( n\right) \ll g\left( n\right)\) (for example: \(f\left( n\right) =n^{2}%\) and \(g\left( n\right) =n^{3}\)), then there are computational problems solvable in \(g\left( n\right)\) time but not in \(f\left( n\right)\) time.  The proof of this theorem uses diagonalization, and can be thought of as a scaled-down version of Turing’s proof of the unsolvability of the halting problem.  That is, we argue that, if it were always possible to simulate a \(g\left( n\right)\)-time Turing machine by an \(f\left( n\right)\)-time Turing machine, then we could construct a \(g\left( n\right)\)-time machine that “ predicted its own output in advance” and then output something else—thereby causing a contradiction.

    Using similar arguments, we can show (for example) that there exist computational problems solvable using \(n^{3}\) bits of memory but not using \(n^{2}\) bits, and so on in most cases where we want to compare more versus less of the same computational resource.  In complexity theory, the hard part is comparing two different resources: for example, determinism versus nondeterminism (the \(\mathsf{P}\overset{?}{=}\mathsf{NP}%\) problem), time versus space (\(\mathsf{P\overset{?}{=}PSPACE}\)), or classical versus quantum computation (\(\mathsf{BPP\overset{?}{=}BQP}\)).  For in those cases, diagonalization by itself no longer works.↩︎

  127. 事实是磷≠经验值 有一个有趣的含义，通常归因于哈特曼尼斯：即三个不等式中至少有一个

    1. 磷≠名词解释

    2. 名词解释≠空间

    3. 空间≠经验值

    必定是正确的，尽管证明其中任何一个 单独为真都将代表数学上的巨大进步！

    上述观察有时被用作间接证据磷≠名词解释。在我们关于复杂度类别对之间不平等的数百个未经证实的信念中，其中很大一部分必须是正确的，只是为了避免与层次定理相矛盾。那么为什么不呢 磷≠名词解释 特别是（鉴于我们在那里的直觉比对大多数其他不等式的直觉更强）？↩︎

  128. The fact that \(\mathsf{P}\neq\mathsf{EXP}\) has an amusing implication, often attributed to Hartmanis: namely, at least one of the three inequalities

    1. \(\mathsf{P}\neq\mathsf{NP}\)

    2. \(\mathsf{NP}\neq\mathsf{PSPACE}\)

    3. \(\mathsf{PSPACE}\neq\mathsf{EXP}\)

    must be true, even though proving any one of them to be true individually would represent a titanic advance in mathematics!

    The above observation is sometimes offered as circumstantial evidence for \(\mathsf{P}\neq\mathsf{NP}\). Of all our hundreds of unproved beliefs about inequalities between pairs of complexity classes, a large fraction of them must be correct, simply to avoid contradicting the hierarchy theorems.  So then why not \(\mathsf{P}\neq\mathsf{NP}\) in particular (given that our intuition there is stronger than our intuitions for most of the other inequalities)?↩︎

  129. 有关该主题的更多信息，请参阅我的博客文章www.scottaaronson.com/blog/?p=368。↩︎

  130. See my blog post www.scottaaronson.com/blog/?p=368 for more on this theme.↩︎

  131. 虽然尚不清楚这些解决方案是否是“物理的”：例如，它们是否能在量子引力理论中存在（见 例如）。↩︎

  132. Though it is not known whether those solutions are “physical” : for example, whether or not they can survive in a quantum theory of gravity (see for example).↩︎

  133. 在量子力学中，混合态可以被认为是量子态的经典概率分布。然而，一个重要的转折是，相同的混合态可以用不同的概率分布来表示：例如，状态的均等混合|0⟩ 和|1⟩ 在物理上与等量混合物没有区别|0⟩+|1⟩2 和|0⟩−|1⟩2。这就是为什么混合状态在数学上用海森堡密度矩阵形式表示的原因。↩︎

  134. In quantum mechanics, a mixed state can be thought of as a classical probability distribution over quantum states.  However, an important twist is that the same mixed state can be represented by different probability distributions: for example, an equal mixture of the states \(\left\vert 0\right\rangle\) and \(\left\vert 1\right\rangle\) is physically indistinguishable from an equal mixture of \(\frac{\left\vert 0\right\rangle +\left\vert 1\right\rangle }{\sqrt{2}}\) and \(\frac{\left\vert 0\right\rangle -\left\vert 1\right\rangle }{\sqrt{2}}\).  This is why mixed states are represented mathematically using Heisenberg’s density matrix formalism.↩︎

  135. 更详细地说，如果状态空间由经典概率分布组成，Deutsch 的提议就会有效德 或量子混合态ρ但如果它是纯态|ψ⟩。因此，如果有人相信只有纯态才是物理学的基础，而概率分布和混合态总是反映主观无知，那么他可能会以此为由拒绝 Deutsch 的提议。↩︎

  136. In more detail, Deutsch’s proposal works if the state space consists of classical probability distributions \(\mathcal{D}\) or quantum mixed states \(\rho\), but not if it consists of pure states \(\left\vert \psi\right\rangle\).  Thus, if one believed that only pure states were fundamental in physics, and that probability distributions and mixed states always reflected subjective ignorance, one might reject Deutsch’s proposal on that ground.↩︎

  137. 具体来说，在 Lloyd 等人的提议中，解决祖父悖论的唯一方法是通过某种“枪卡壳”的变体：存在没有一致解决方案的演化，并且需要假设物理定律是这样的：它们永远不会发生。↩︎

  138. In particular, in Lloyd et al.’s proposal, the only way to deal with the grandfather paradox is by some variant of “the gun jams”: there are evolutions with no consistent solution, and it needs to be postulated that the laws of physics are such that they never occur.↩︎

  139. 具体来说，在 CTC 宇宙中，图灵机磁带头无法像在空间中来回穿梭一样在时间中来回穿梭。如果一个人这样想，那么他实际上想到的是第二个“元时间”，而“原始”时间只是空间的另一个维度。换言之：即使 CTC 会使时间 循环，时间仍将保持其方向性。这就是为什么，如果我们想证明 CTC 计算机具有空间，我们需要一个涉及因果一致性的非平凡论证。↩︎

  140. Specifically, it is not true that in a CTC universe, a Turing machine tape head could just travel back and forth in time the same way it travels back and forth in space.  If one thinks this way, then one really has in mind a second, “meta-time,” while the “ original” time has become merely one more dimension of space.  To put the point differently: even though a CTC would make time cyclic, time would still retain its directionality.  This is the reason why, if we want to show that CTC computers have the power of \(\mathsf{PSPACE}\), we need a nontrivial argument involving causal consistency.↩︎

  141. 这种可能性在 Deutsch 的论文中也进行了详细讨论。↩︎​

  142. This possibility is also discussed at length in Deutsch’s paper .↩︎

  143. 为简单起见，我们假设集合Ω 可能状态的数量是可数的；否则我们当然可以使用连续概率测度。↩︎

  144. Here we assume for simplicity that the set \(\Omega\) of possible states is countable; otherwise we could of course use a continuous probability measure.↩︎

  145. 与往常一样，受到广泛相信的复杂性假设的影响。↩︎

  146. Subject, as usual, to widely-believed complexity assumptions.↩︎

  147. 对于像连续统假设这样的数学陈述，情况就大不相同了，显然不能将其表述为对理想化计算过程的预测（因为它们无法通过整数的一阶甚至二阶量化来表达）​​。对于这些陈述，除了它们在某些形式系统中的可证明性之外，我真的 不清楚它们的真实性或虚假性意味着什么。↩︎

  148. The situation is very different for mathematical statements like the Continuum Hypothesis, which can’t obviously be phrased as predictions about idealized computational processes (since they’re not expressible by first-order or even second-order quantification over the integers).  For those statements, it really is unclear to me what one means by their truth or falsehood apart from their provability in some formal system.↩︎

  149. 另一方面，它假设我们知道如何定义输入的合理概率分布。但正如第[HUMANS]节所讨论的那样，似乎很难解释我们所说的“结构化实例”或“实践中通常出现的实例类型” 。↩︎

  150. On the other hand, it would presuppose that we knew how to define reasonable probability distributions over inputs.  But as discussed in Section [HUMANS], it seems hard to explain what we mean by “structured instances,” or “the types of instances that normally arise in practice.”↩︎

  151. 我想到的另一个例子是弦理论，它的许多“预测”都以数学猜想的形式出现。↩︎

  152. One other example that springs to mind, of a scientific theory many of whose “ predictions” take the form of mathematical conjectures, is string theory.↩︎
